Reviews.Title: “Wow! This place is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: BeachloverAr
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel in order to be close to Universal Studios which is a short walk away from the property. They have a shuttle bus, but we didn't take it. The room we had was spectacular. I believe we were on the 17th floor in a suite. The views of LA were fantastic as the whole front of the room were windows. The room itself had a couch, a desk, a mini refrigerator and a separate bathroom. The bathroom was just like a spa bathroom, very roomy, clean, modern and very good lighting. The bed was extremely comfortable. My only complaint was the location of the TV. It was located in a cabinet and was hard to see from the bed, and it was a little small for the room. They had a very nice outdoor pool, which we didn't use. I would highly recommend this hotel. It isn't cheap but it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: I stayed last Saturday night with my wife and we loved this hotel. Very clean and attractive property and the hotel staff really shined. My wife said she was "blown away" by their service and we would not hesitate to stay there again anytime we attend an event at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Louise Cate C
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay at this hotel again, friendly service 24hr desk very helpful when locked ourselves out! Beautiful pool area, heaps of reasonably priced eating areas, bar, coffee lounge and gift shop. Shuttle to airport good , but LAX so busy-make sureyougetinstructions where to catch bus! Definitely stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: lazvi01
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Universal Studios Hollywood and looking for an overnight stay, this is the closest hotel to this attraction. Just a short walk or you have the option to take the free shuttle to the park. The room was dated but comfortable. The only thing that we did not like is that their buffet is near the lobby and the foods were displayed where people are walking back and fort with luggages or going to and from meetings or other events. They should have separated the buffet away from foot traffic. We could even smell the seafood inside the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property with Great Staff; Very Convenient to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: RazorTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March 2012. The hotel is very nice and the staff offer outstanding service. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Universal Studios, which is a great attraction if you like movies and entertainment. Check-in was fast and efficient. The rooms are over-sized with good views of the local area. The room was clean, and the bathroom was quite spacious. We got good recommendations from staff on local restaurants. Parking is convenient and covered. I definitely would stay here again- great property!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed at Hilton for one night and visited Universal Studios Pros: Across the street from Universal Studios. Full service hotel. Free shuttle to and from Universal. As a Hilton Diamond member, received free upgrade to executive level floor and large fruit plate. Cons: Shuttle only runs until 9pm. Avoid the breakfast buffet in hotel--looks nice but items are dried out and not well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: damiengibson
Reviews.Content: Getting here by public transport from the airport was a trek but we got there in the end. Hotel is nice and clean, check in was quick and easy. Our room was really nice with great views of the hill sides and the pool below. Room service was quick and the food was of a high standard. Plus side is the free shuttle service to Universal Studios which leaves often but you can also walk which takes around 15 minutes. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton universal-a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: graham T
Reviews.Content: 5min walk to universal studios and city walk,food was excellent,helpful staff Rooms very nice,would have no hesitation staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Los Angeles - a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo2207
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Hilton Los Angeles and my experience there was amazing. The staff is very helpful, the rooms are confortable, they have frigobar inside for us to use and storage things that we buy at the supermarket. The beds are very confortable and they take care of all the buiding. Everything there was perfect. I just think that the parking is very expensive. We need to pay U$18,00 por self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Salf
Reviews.Content: Next to Universal Studios, Easy access to freeway and to Hollywood. Very nice rooms with views. Excellent breakfast buffet. The weekend buffet looked fabulous, but we did not try it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: donnyagreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work. Location- 4 minute walk to universal studios/ city walk. No need for the shuttle. Food- outstanding buffet. I'm very picky about hotel food. But this place did it right Bar- great menu. Friendly staff. Good prices for a hotel rooms- they were good. Could be freshened a bit. Staff- good. Attentive. Check in took way to long.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to City Walk and Universal”
Reviews.Author: Critic1000
Reviews.Content: Best family weekend getaway. Close to everything. Free shuttle takes you to City walk and Universal. Room facing park a must. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rcjetskier
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise out of LA and decided to stay in LA and visit Universal Studios for a couple of days. I booked the Hilton due to the convenient location and I'm also a HiltonHonors member. Have to admit it didn't start out great. We were checking in and I was waiting in the HiltonHonors line and the desk attendant acted like I was invisible and was going to help the person in the regular line not the Honors line and the acted like, "oh" thought you were those other people. Which clearly I wasn't, I was not even standing close to them. So that didn't get us to a good start. So then she started to help us then because I forgot to bring my AAA card, (to get the better rate) she pawned me off on the manager on duty. Instead of just doing what he could to do help with the fact I didn't bring my card, he was determined to find on my paperwork where it said, it was necessary. (Which he didn't due to the fact it wasn't on it)! We finally got that sorted out. We finally made it to our room, the room was very nice and big. We ate at the buffet, there was a huge variety of things to choose from, we really enjoyed it, till a girl came up and wanted to take our picture, I was a little taken back, but said okay. Well she was back about 10 minutes later with it in a frame and wanted to know if we would like to purchase it! Really, in the middle of eating? That was a bit of a turn off, but other than that we really did love the convenience of Universal being a shuttle away, we walked back at the end of the evening, shuttles don't run that late, but it wasn't a bad walk and it was very nice. Would I go back, probably, the issues were minor. The room it self was great, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hilton I've experienced!”
Reviews.Author: MaryTony
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here on 3 separate occasions since 2009. Service is always top notch! Love the large jacuzzi for morning soak and wake up! Excellent "base camp" for exploring our favorite places in LA - Griffith Park, Burbank, Topanga Canyon! Just don't confuse the buffet, which spreads out all down the corridor, for free bar goodies. You will get your hand slapped (figuratively). Cannot speak to value, as we have always used HHonors rewards for our stays.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars, overpriced, dirty, old and tired looking.”
Reviews.Author: Missy454
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed were the cobwebs all around the windows and the state of the bath tub. It looks old, rusty and is chipped all over the inside. It appears there was an attempt to recoat it with some kind of paint rather than replace it. We're actually still here now,(2nd night of 3). Parking is $18 a day and wifi $7.95/ day. For what they charge a night both should be included, the rooms should be immaculate and the tubs replaced when they are chipped. We checked in late here and stood at the counter for a few minutes even though we were the only people checking in and there were 2 front desk people working. We were not greeted with a smile. Also, water leaked through our windows when it rained. We just stayed for 4 nights at the Embassy suites in Anaheim, ( also Hilton chain) and this place doesn't even compare in value, cleanliness and quality of furniture, tv's etc... Basically this place is very worn looking with the appearance of very heavy traffic without adequate renovations afterwards. I would recommend staying here only if you are getting a heavy discount and going to universal. It's definitly not 4 stars. My room is prepaid so we're stuck here otherwise we would have left today.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great service”
Reviews.Author: karibee7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Universal Hilton for a conference and it was fantastic. In terms of conference accommodations, the hotel room was clean and spacious, the break out rooms were nice, the food was very good, and the staff were very professional and friendly. And the location was very good. It was a two minute walk from universal studios and city walk (lots to do there!) Plus it was a five minute walk from the metro, which will take you to all the major sites. The concierge recommended a wonderful restaurant, so tap into his suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “great location; odd service”
Reviews.Author: austintraveler52
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Universal for work or play, this hotel is perfectly located. Only reservation I have is that we spent a long time arguing to get a few extra blankets from housekeeping The person in housekeeping kept refusing to give us enough blankets. She said her task was to ration them. Called the front desk a couple of times finally the issue was resolved. In all my travels, I have never before had someone in housekeeping refuse blankets. Odd. She must have been having a really bad day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in February. Really convenient location for sight seeing..10 minutes to Hollywood/Beverly Hills area and about 30-40 to Santa Monica depending on traffic. Hotel staff were always helpful and provided a printed directions for major attractions when we asked about the area (thanks Helen from MS). On day 2, groups of teenage cheerleaders checked in (some of which ended up next door to us!) I immediately went to the desk and the clerk, Sarah, said she was sorry for the inconvenience and we were moved to the executive floor at no extra charge. Bell hop came to the room and we were moved within 20 minutes from the time I was at the desk. Really impeccable service...Weekend dinner buffet was delicious and worth the price. Rooms were clean with great views and comfy beds. Would definitely stay here again when I visit LA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Universal Studio and Great buffet”
Reviews.Author: starrynight88
Reviews.Content: After NYC, this hotel provides a relaxed and resort style feelings. Within 5 - 10 mins walking distance to Universal Studio. There are also free pick ups from the theme park from the hotel. Walk 15 mins downhill and you will get to a subway that takes you to Hollywood Boulevard :-). The only problem being walking uphill to the hotel on your way back. It was a steep hill :-),... We found a way of overcoming this - there is a trolley bus that takes you up the hill to Universal studio and from there it is a easy walk to the hotel. Best thing - the fabulous seafood buffet - on one should miss. I have never felf more satiated bboth in quality and quantity,,, Great service and everyone stops by to ask about your holiday...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: kd2226
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are planning on visiting Universal Studios. There are shuttle buses to the park, but it is only a 5 minute walk anyway, The hotel itself was very nice with a big beautiful lobby, nice clean rooms and helpful staff. Room service was prompt and delicious. I had been a bit wary of staying in a multi-storied building in earthquake country, but there was info in the room on how the building has been constructed to earthquake standards and this eased my mind (at least partially). We really enjoyed our day in the theme park and the evening at City Walk. Our one complaint about Univ Studios was the amount of time we had to stand in line to purchase tickets - wasted almost an hour of our day. I would definitely buy our tickets in advance next time. No complaints, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing over the top service!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan8
Reviews.Content: Holy Mackrel. This place rocks. I stayed here several years ago, for a trip to Universal Studios, but this time was for four nights, worked related. I seriously do not know who trained this staff, but they have had to be some of the best hospitality people around. I log about 130 nights a year on the road for work and have stayed at so many Southern California properties, but these folks are top notch. Rory, a Northern California transplant, at the front desk was one of the nicest guys around. He was busy when I went to check in and at least twice told me he would be right with me. As a Diamond member that was great.. He explained a lot to me about the hotel as I checked in. He then walked me to the elevator, called the elevator, stepped in and pushed the floor number for me? What??? What awesome service. This has never happened to me before. It appears they do this for all the guests. Crazy customer service in a good way. I was lucky enough to score an alcove room on the 20th floor with views of Universal Studios and Citywalk. Very nice room with many windows. I could not hear freeway noise at all and a had a straight shot of US 101. The room was super clean and smelled fresh. Yes the decor is a little outdated, but not an issue at all. Each room has a min refrigerator as well. Yes! The elevators did bug me. They have 5, but wow...slow! Super great bath products with many extras to boot. As I walked through the lobby many of the staff would greet you. This property has the can do spirit. Each morning I called housekeeping to request housekeeping before noon. Each time it was a no problem type attitude. Front manager Terry Lin looked at future reservations for me and gave me a card stating to call him to further look into my stay as the computer wasn't showing some availability of some dates I needed. Hats off to GM Juan Aquinde for making this a Hotel I won't soon forget and will try to return too frequently.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Short and sweet.....a winner!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeRohman
Reviews.Content: I will offer a short and sweet review of this property. I travel about 60 days a year on business/pleasure and this is a decent property worth staying at. I have fairly high standards with lodging properties. If you are a Universal Studios fan, it is walking distance from Universal Hollywood and City Walk. If you are a "Hollywood" fan, the property is only a $15 cab ride from many of the Hollywood tourist areas. If you fly into LAX, take out a second mortgage as the cab ride will set you back about $90. But as for the actual hotel, the rooms are nice, the joint is clean and if you want a decent lodging property, you will likely be happy staying here. On a scale from 1-10, this Hilton is a solid 8.....which means that most folks will be happy staying there. I would return. Finally, I am from the East Coast and I like my hotel room temp. to be in the "Meat Locker" range. For whatever reason, I am convinced that California hotels in their quest for going green, have a rule that their rooms cannot be cooled below 72F..... Every time I stay in a California hotel, I can't get the room cool enough.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Bob J
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, I came back with welts all over my body! I had at least 100 bites. I called the hotel to notify them, and they did nothing but try to convince me that I got the bites somewhere else. Needless to say I will NEVER stay at this hotel again for as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and overall experience”
Reviews.Author: gone2explore
Reviews.Content: All of the staff I encountered were notably courteous and helpful. Stewart at the front desk was especially welcoming. The rooms were very clean, classy, and comfortable. The location was a reasonably short walk to the Universal Studios park and CityWalk, although the route was a bit poorly marked and confusing. Still, it was nice to be located so close and have views of the Studios and the variety of options so conveniently located. My company was hosting a series of meetings and banquets at their site and (although I cannot speak for the meeting planner who coordinated the contract or other advance details), from a guest perspective they helped each of our events run seamlessly. Even their catered banquet meals were a step above what I have typically/frequently found at other hotels. I would look forward to the opportunity to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: H_Rod88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a Tuesday. We had tickets to Universal Studios, and picked this hotel because it was closest to the park. We tried to check in a little early, but there were no rooms available. The lady at the front desk was a little rude and short with us. She told us we'd have to pay a $150 deopsit. We parked in self parking which was $18 a day. That was a little pricy. It's understandable that they charge this much because they are so close to the park, but we felt like maybe they should have discounted rates for guests of the hotel. After we were done at the park we walked over to the hotel to check in. The man that was at the front desk was much more friendly and helpful. Our room was still not available, so he upgraded us to a bigger room on the 2nd floor. He asked us for a $100 deposit. I'm not sure why the first lady told us a higher price, but we were glad to save the extra $50. When we got to our room we had trouble getting the wifi to connect, so I called the front desk and sent the IT guy up to our room within minutes. He had to call another IT guy for additional help, and they got the wifi connected for us. The room was clean and rather large. It was room 202 below the lobby. The view was ok, nothing too special. The bed was comfortabe and the bathroom was very large. Upon checkout we noticed that we had been charged twice for our WiFi connection. We informed the lady that we were having issues with the connection and that we shouldn't be double charged, She made a phone call, fixed the problem, and checked us out. We enjoyed our stay, and would probably stay here again next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Family_Point_Person
Reviews.Content: I typically don't write reviews, but when I checked into the Hilton, it was my fifth hotel over four cities and 12 days on the road, so I was feeling a bit road weary when Stuart greeted me at check-in with a "welcome back" before he even looked up my reservation--and I hadn't been at the hotel in over five years. We made small talk which included that my stay was going to be days 12-14 and then home, and Stuart surprised me with an upgrade to a magnificent room saying he wanted this to be the best hotel experience of my trip. The whole hotel is great... it has the amenities of a vacation place with the conveniences for business, but what a treat. Stuart then went the extra mile by calling my room shortly after I got there to make sure it was okay, plus the hotel delivered a lovely fruit plate as turn-down service my first night. I would definitely return to the hotel for leisure or business, and I hope management recognizes Stuart for the great brand ambassador that he is.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start...great finish”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, I was informed there was no room for me. Candidly, I did not properly check my confirmation or I would have noticed it was a day off. In any event, the honors check-in staffer was less than helpful. Normally, as a long-time gold member, you would expect action. Please find a room for me here or at the very least call the Sheraton next door and help me find a room there. This did not happen. Nothing happened. After finally securing a room it became very clear that my issue was isolated to this individual. The room was great and the remaining staff were fantastic in every way. I have stayed here several times over the years and the rooms are great. Big room, big bathroom and a well appointed and clean environment. The lobby is nice and for me the location is usually excellent. It's nice to have Citywalk right next door. The views are pretty cool usually, parking is conveninet (although not cheap) and the web connection was fast. Normally after a situation like mine I would be angry and avoid Hilton properties for a long time, but in this situation it was clear that I made a mistake, encountered a untrained or substandard staffer, and in the end I had a very good stay, If the location works for you, this is a very good hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rock and Roll Fantasy Camp Hotel 2012”
Reviews.Author: Barbara P
Reviews.Content: We flew out to CA to watch our son perfrom at Whiskey A GoGo at the end of Rock and Roll Fantasy Camp. The hotel where everyone stayed was the Hilton LA. Our room was lovely - on the 2nd floor (below the lobby) overlooking a woodsy area. Very clean, classy, quiet and understated. Friendly staff, big buffets on the weekend, beautiful fresh flower arrangements, large lobby, nice bar, coffee stand that serves Starbucks and a very nice gym. We enjoyed ourselves, had restful sleep and would go back again and recommend to others. The only negative was the smell of seafood permeating throughout the hotel when the buffets were out. The lobby was also chilly in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Pabrro
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would stay here again. The customer service at check-in was great; fast and friendly. The hotel has a nice upscale style but there is some wear in places. Not a big deal to me, though. Parking is either $23 for valet or $18 per day for Self Park. Factor this in when you consider the overall cost to stay. We had a King Bed Alcove room that was very spacious and comfortable. The windows were huge and offered a great view. Free bottled water and a fruit tray was a nice touch. WiFi was not free but I don't know how much it cost per day. Another thing to factor into the overall cost of the room. Ironing board and Iron and free safe were in the closet. Lots of outlets around the room to recharge all of our electronics. The bathroom was spacious and had a vanity in addition to the usual sink counter. Hot water pressure was inconsistent, but I never had a cold shower. The room showed some wear in places but I wouldn't consider it a big deal unless you are very picky about these things.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but very crowded”
Reviews.Author: volk04
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to LA or to Universal Studios this hotel is a good choice. It is conveniently located in the heart of Universal which means you can easily walk to the park or take the free shuttle. I stayed here in January when visiting LA for a long weekend. The hotel is outside of the city, but I wanted to be near Universal so it was a good pick. It is a large hotel, and had a conference, wedding, and another event going while I was there. The room was large, and clean. I booked a king alcove. My only complaint about the room is that they did not provide cups for the coffee maker, and there wasnt any lotion in the bathroom. I would recommend staying here if you are going to Universal, but you need to be aware that it is a large hotel, and can accommodate a lot of guests. If you do not like to be around a lot of people do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Limerock
Reviews.Content: Great location. Superb breakfast. Somewhat decent pool area with free popcorn (good for the kids). Rather old, worn hotell but the place to stay if you are going to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Universal Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: sherylschwoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a birthday get away. The hotel is beautiful. The staff was helpful in making reservations for dinner and directions. We had a wonderful 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty nice. The bed was decently comfortable. I have stayed on much nicer beds in hotels. The room was contemporary. My one complaint about the room was the lack of hot water. I was up at about 7:00am because I had a business meeting and the water would not get warm. Figuring that most people would still be asleep, you would think that they would have more hot water. I ate at the breakfast buffet and was disappointed. It was overpriced and not very good. Most of the food was cold and dried out. For $25 dollars I expected a good breakfast, but felt like it was Denny's quality if even that. The biggest pro of the hotel is the location. You are within about 5-10 minutes walking distance to Universal Studios and City Walk. No need for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Abbie G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here FREE ( on my hilton club points) for just the one night in January when visiting LA, we were upgraded into the executive suite on the top floor and the room was dull and shabby. The room was of an average size with a poor view. The bed was hard and the bathroom was small with dated decor and fittings, and this was meant to be better than their normal rooms!! The service was very good and the staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was appalling and would certainly never pay the money for it. I am not a fussy person and for a free night it really was fine, and probably would return if it was another free night, but I would not pay the prices they charge for a room. I understand the location pushes up the room prices but I am sure you can find cleaner and more comfortable rooms for a similar if not smaller price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: arun0708
Reviews.Content: Right next to universal studios theme park, it is an excellent hotel for families, We got a room on a higher floor facing hills and pool. Nice Pool/hot tub open till midnight. There is a shuttle to universal studios from the hotel. Hotel also surprised with complimentary fruit/cheese platter. Rooms were very comfortable. We were few hours beyond the permitted daily time for parking but they did not charge us for the extra hours. Hotel check in staff and service were nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: RayckPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for family of 6. There is a ferry to the Universal studio which is convenient. It is a bit of a walk to and fro the metro and is on a slope. Sheraton is a bit nearer to metro. Not much of a great scenic view. Staff were mostly courteous but we encountered a female one (Sandra) that was rude. Alex at reception was great. Good if you want to spend most of your time at the studios, if not look closer to twon.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 nights stay in November '11, the hotel is nice and staff friendly, could be a little be more well decorated. Breakfast must be improved. location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jrus12
Reviews.Content: From the minute we drove up, all staff members were friendly, courteous and extremly helpful. We were upgraded to the 16th floor with the most beautiful view of the San Fernando Valley. Watched an amazing 'moon' set the next morning. This hotel was so convenient, the shuttle takes you right to Universal Studio and to the Metro if you want to see Hollywood and its attraction is only one stop away....The buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner is fantastic! Dont miss it! I had gotten a cold and the staff were very accommodationg, getting me extra tea, and honey. The room was very spacious we had the corner Alcove, the bathroom was beautiful and the shower delightful. The only down side we felt being from New York, is the price for parking, and Internet service....come now...that was a bit much....should be inclusive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CliffKol
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel for five nights. The room was large and had a couch, sitting area, desk, hallway, separate bathroom, and view of Universal. Although we were facing the 101 the room was totally quiet and you would never know a freeway was right below. Staff was wonderful and always helpful. The continental breakfast that came with the room was delicious. The only issue we had was the inconsistency between waiters at the restaurant or lounge. We had vouchers from Hilton and each waiter explained the deal differently or delivered a different meal each time. We did not visit the gym or the business center, so cannot comment as others have in their reviews. Our room though, was full of electrical outlets, which was a terrific benefit since we have phones, cameras and laptops to recharge. Most hotel rooms have just one or two outlets, which becomes a pain. Self parking was also great, we always found a spot near the elevators. All in all, would highly recommend this hotel, especially at the reasonable rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is average except the price!”
Reviews.Author: charlessouthey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and was surprised by the mediocrity of the property. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Everyone went the extra mile to help (When they could). However, there were several things that were downright poor: First and foremost was the gym. It is small and dark and dingy with only 7 cardiovascular machines. The TV's on several of these machines only displayed one or two channels. Second, the showers. We had about 150 in our group and for some strange reason the hotel ran out of hot water by 7 every morning. Last and most disappointing was the business center. The hotel charges $1 a page to print. No, not for high quality, high res color...that is for black and white. You can only imagine my shock when I needed to print a draft copy of my presentation that was a 100 pages. At this point I asked fro the General manager who was not available. I then left a message requesting he call me. I know your shocked to hear he did not call me back. So, to sum it up. If you want to chat with a great staff and then stay in a very average hotel that is right on top of the 101 freeway and like to wake to the roar of traffic then this is your place...but make sure you also like to be gauged!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: amusaint
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last part of our honeymoon in September. When we went to check in the front desk Manager stepped in and told us we were the guests of the day. This was an amazing surprise and we were upgraded to the nicest room I have ever stayed in and came with many perks. It was a two bedroom suite with on the top floor with a fantastic view of the hills. We were in California for 7 days and stayed in nice hotels the whole time, but the Hilton at Universal City was by far the nicest with the most hospitable staff. We splurged and ordered a room service breakfast and it arrived on time and everything was the perfect temperature. We went over to City Walk for dinner so I canâ€™t comment on the buffet, but it did look beautiful when we passed it. This hotel is perfect for guests who want to be close to Universal Studios and be treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay before flying home”
Reviews.Author: laur3njayn3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before flying home from LAX. Location was good for universal city walk but I'm not sure how far it would be from the usual sites you go to see whilst in LA. Room was nice - terrible view though (highway/freeway). The night we stayed we took the 10 minute walk over citywalk and ate at the Hardrock cafe - it was easy to get to from the hotel. Upon check out we used the free internet PC they had in reception to do online check-in. This was a good idea for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: kevinlydot
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded by a wonderful Front Desk person named Fidel when we arrived and told him about our Anniversary. His recommendation of the Dinner Buffet went noticed and we arrived, were put into the cattle call which is called food. The Host neglected to tell us the we could chose off of a separate menu if we did not want to eat the flavorless and excessive sugar ladened food offerings. I was forced to ask a buffet replenisher for butter and really did not feel that the price $44.00 was worth it. You may find it a value if you like to eat gluttonously and "expensive" crab legs that have watered down flavor or shrimp you have to peel and eat. Our mistake was that we did not learn our lesson and went to the Breakfast Buffet and got the same thing as the night past only the Hilton's interpretation of breakfast food. Not a good thing. It is a property that is beautiful and unfortunately a one nighter place.

Reviews.Title: “Now that I have stayed at both Universal Hotels, I would come back here”
Reviews.Author: Gwen88
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is not only a closer walk (plus they have a shuttle if you don't want to waste your walking energy getting over to Universal Studios) but the rooms seemed a little nicer with their pillow top beds and the weekend breakfast buffet was amazing. It even included crab legs and things you don't normally see at breakfast like fresh squeezed orange juice. I might rate it higher if it was less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Viewes”
Reviews.Author: DiabloDeb
Reviews.Content: Every time I visit Universal I stay at this Hilton, the staff has always been incredible and the same can be said for their rooms. I had booked this room rather late, a week in advance. We had decided to see a concert at the Gibson Amphitheater. There is a free shuttle service the operates between the Hilton and Universal Studios/Citywalk and even if you have to walk it is not that far at all. Even though we arrived a little after hotel check-in time, our room was not ready. So they gave us vouchers for the Lounge to get appetizers. The room was well worth waiting for, had a spectacular view from the 19th. floor. Internet if offered for a small fee unless you are a gold or higher Honors card holder.

Reviews.Title: “Super busy, but nice rooms & good service”
Reviews.Author: Interested01
Reviews.Content: Friday evening seafood and prime rib buffet is $44. I didn't buy it, but so many people did that it was slow going as i made my way from the parking elevators to the front desk. (Self-parking was extremely tight due to hotel events.) When I got to the desk the staff was friendly and professional. The room was on a high floor--huge windows overlooking the theme park with great views of the surrounding hills. The room was big with extra furniture, big bathroom, lots of amenities, including fresh fruit and other snacks (courtesy of the Hilton loyalty program). A really nice breakfast buffet was included. BEWARE: On Sunday mornings they remove the breakfast items long before the advertised time of 10:30 to make way for brunch. My server went out of her way to find me the items I missed. The parking attendant, bartender, and housekeeping staff were all helpful and really nice. I'll stay there again when I can afford it. The lobby was really cold in the evening. I was told the engineers were working on it. Could there be some kind of design problem?

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for Universal Studios in LA”
Reviews.Author: QueenBeeNZ
Reviews.Content: The location is what swayed me to stay at this hotel as the primary purpose of our stay was to visit the Universal Studios theme park. So I went ahead and booked, requesting a high floor, theme park view, alcove room, We arrived at 11.30am on a Sunday morning. I was expecting to arrange for luggage to be stored until the official check in time of 2.00pm but was pleasantly surprised that our room was already available and ready. Check in staff were friendly and efficient. I don't think they noted my HHilton Honours membership at the time so can only assume they treat all their guests like this. And what a room! It was spacious, clean with a comfortable King Sized bed and a truly beautiful view over the Universal Studios theme park and the North Hollywood hills beyond. It was a treat to watch the sunset every evening. Well worth the extra $28 (I think) per night I paid for the higher floor/view. We also received a small welcome basket of goodies, including 2 bottles of Hilton water, which I believe was for HHilton Honours members. Very nice touch. Universal Studios is a short 5-10 minute walk across a car park and up and over a walking bridge. The hotel also has a shuttle, if you don't want to exert yourself. I would not want to do the same walk from the Sheraton a little further down the hill - it's a very steep climb! The hotel can arrange theme park tickets for you but I recommend you just go over and check at the Park's box office first as we found prices to be cheaper than those advertised online. We didn't eat there but the hotel has a good restaurant and the Sunday buffet breakfast is popular. We did get room service on our first night - there was a bit of confusion about the menu as apparently the one in our room was the "old menu". The panini or sandwich I ordered was no longer available, but the burger and fries I got instead were good. We did head down to the bar for happy hour one evening, which was very relaxing and pleasant. The bar staff were really good - some of the best I'd encountered on this trip. My favourite part of the hotel was the Starbucks corner which is hidden down the corridor from the bar, by the conference rooms. Besides coffee, there was a small selection of donuts, slices and fruit to choose from. Prices were the same as the Starbucks over at Citywalk, but this was a much more pleasant experience. By the third visit the server knew our order (although we were there at least twice a day, every day :)). You can see and ride everything at Universal Studios in under a day and Citywalk in the evening. The Metro station is located at the bottom of the hill (there's a free shuttle from Citywalk) from which you can travel to the usual tourist traps - Hollywood Blvd, Kodak Theatre etc. Still there's not much else to see and do in this neighborhood so I wouldn't recommend this for longer-term stays. Ours was a quick 3 day visit so this suited us fine. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a little bit of affordable luxury on a quick visit to Universal City/Studios area.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to LA”
Reviews.Author: DubsPeople
Reviews.Content: We (adult family) stayed at the Hilton Los Angels / Universal City Last Summer. We picked it as some relatives had stayed some months earlier. It is a nice hotel near to Universal City and theme park, just a short walk away over a foot bridge. The food was good, breakfast had all the variety you could want â€˜buffet styleâ€™; tea coffee is served. We opted to pay each day, we were room only and it was no advantage to paying B&B for the few days we were staying; if fact the family deal was better value at the time. The Hotel itself is nice, we had adjoining rooms mid way up the tower and had nice views. The hotel is located a short distance away from the Kodak and Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Blvd, just one stop of the â€˜subwayâ€™ train. The taxi from LAX is about 40+ minutes depending on traffic ~ $60 fair. The hotel staff advised not to go to the beaches as there were now a lot of dropouts and plenty of pick pockets so we stuck to the hotel and booked our trips from the concierge â€“ better idea. The gripe (probably a minor one) in my experience is thisâ€¦ the first night there was a problem with the air conditioning and the lobby area which is kinda open plan with the bar area was like an ice box. We did experience LA hospitality with the rude bar tender regarding tipping. I wouldnâ€™t mind but we had generously tipped the bell boy + waitress who server our food on arrival etc. etc and fully understand the tipping regime in the USA; we have been many times. We waited for 25 minutes to be served our first order of drinks â€“ we tipped her!. The bar tender then sent home the waitress(s) due to the lack of people in the bar area (two people at bar) as it was soooo cold. Hence for our second order I had to get up and go to the bar myself, so I donâ€™t tip for shoddy service and especially when I have to supplement it with self-service!! The bar tender threw me a card which, in my opinion, rudely pointed out the way I should be tipping himâ€¦..NOT GOOD. We did complain to the reception and we were told our experience was unacceptable and the management would be informed we did not receive any contact from management â€“ â€˜bad form guysâ€™. While on the topic of tipping my understanding is 10% if service is ok; 15% for good; & 20% for excellent; well the expected norm at this hotel is 15%-20% !! someone tell the bar tender to improve his PR skills and remind him there is a world recession going on.

Reviews.Title: “A good overall stay”
Reviews.Author: kazk82
Reviews.Content: A great hotel if you are visiting Universal (it is the closest universal hotel). We arrived really early on an international flight and even though they were heavily booked, they managed to rearrange things so we could check in early to shower and have a quick nap before our day at universal. We were really appreciative of this. There were also lovely touches like delivering a newspaper every morning and a fruit plate our first night there.Â We were a little nervous of traveling around LA at night, so for us this was perfect as we could head up to city walk for dinner and shopping and feel completely safe. In saying that, we decided to hang around the walk of fame in Hollywood after a tour one day, and it was only one metro stop ($1.50) away from Universal stop. Very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Close to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Celeste M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Universal City in Jan 2012. We changed our mind on arrival and requested two rooms, Pamela (supervisor on Front Desk) was fantastic and identified our needs immediately and matched them to a King Corner suite with connecting room for the teenagers, offered a discounted rate for the second room and was fantastic for the whole stay. The hotel is close to Universal Studios and City Walk for nighttime dining and shopping. City Walk was a little seedy as the night wore on so - don't let your teens stroll alone. the hotel offered a good buffet but otherwise expensive for snacks etc. Don't hesitate if you want proximity to the Studio. Get yourself a fast pass if visiting the studio - travelling from Australia we won't be back soon so we got to try everything without having to line up.

Reviews.Title: “Great LOCATION for Universal Studios & Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mjp66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton a few years ago and loved the location, spacious rooms and Hotel facilities so we decided to stay again on our return to the US.When we checked into our room the first thing we noticed was that the floor had not been vacuumed from the previous guests - this immediately gives the guest a rather sour taste in their mouth!! The issue was reported to Front Office who arranged for Housekeeping to go and vacuum the room.Our room overlooked the 101 Freeway which was ok for a short stay but on our previous visit we had a room that looked over Universal Studios which was a much nicer outlook. As a family we don't tend to spend alot of time in the room so we normally select Hotels for their location and proximity to major attractions. This Hotel provides the guest with a courtesy bus on a regular basis to and from Universal Studios which is a MUST do activity whilst in LA. We have experienced Disneyland,California Adventure Park, Legoland, Seaworld & we find Universal Studios to be one of the better attractions in Southern California. Whilst staying at this Hilton we also like to take a taxi into Hollywood Blvd which costs around $13.00 one way - otherwise you can take the metro at the bottom of the BIG hill (walking down is OK but walking back up can be a bit of a struggle!!) What I enjoy about this Hilton is the public spaces and Restaurant areas. The Hotel has also got a cool bar that serves drinks and lots of complimentary nibblies of an evening - a very nice touch.If you are lucky you may overhear conversations from "movie" people which is always a buzz when you are in Hollywood!!! Food wise we loved the freshly prepared Sushi that can be eaten either in the bar or in the Restaurant....very delicious. If you are there when the BUFFET is on then make sure you GO - this is by far the best buffet we have experienced in the US!! We ate in the Restaurant both nights and found some of the servers to be excellent and others rather average. The meals were also very fractured in their arrival time to our table - on one night 3 family members had finished their entrees (mains) before my husband had received his which was not good planning on the kitchens behalf. Staff were all very helpful & friendly and we enjoyed our stay at this Hilton once again. I would recommend this Hotel to others and would be happy to return to this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay near Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Highwaydude
Reviews.Content: After finding a good airfare deal to LAX, we choose to spend a weekend and visit Universal Studios. After some research of hotels, we decided on the Hilton Universal Studios. Both the Hilton and the Sheraton are very convenient to Universal Studios. We never arranged for a rental car for this trip and took the Supper Shuttle from LAX to the Hotel. It cost $22/person and roughly took us about 40 mins to reach our hotel. We were greeted upon arrival and the staff at the front deck was very polite. Even taking the time to walk us to the elevator and explaining the layout of the hotel and taking any questions we had. A very nice touch. I booked the King Bedroom Alcove room and was very surprised at the nice layout of these spacious rooms. Being a Hilton Gold Member I received coupons for free continental breakfast in the morning but you can also upgrade to the huge buffet for only $9. How can you pass that up. We arrived on a friday early and had nothing planned for that afternoon. After talking with the host at the travel concierge deck, She suggested a Hollywood Tour, which with our luck was leaving in a few minutes. We took the tour, which cost us $64/person. The tour lasted around 5 hours and included such sights as the Hollywood Sign, Hollywood walk of fame, Historic Farmers market, and traveled thru areas of famous stars homes. The tour I would say was a 3 out of 5. It could of been better but given little research we took it. Both Saturday and Sunday we spent at Universal Studios, the hotel offers a free shuttle to and from the park or you can also walk it, which is a short 10-15 min walk. Food options are plentifully as well. With CityWalk also right next to Universal Studios, you have lots of food and shopping options to keep you busy. To sum it all up. If you just want to spend the weekend at Universal Studios, you can't go wrong with the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “From the time you drive up to the door til the time you settle in your room AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: karlahannaford
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is above and beyond what i would expect. Drive up and someone is right there offering to help with luggage. Check in was easy and front desk staff was friendly. We were escorted to the elevator by front desk person that helped us. Our room is on the 8th floor with views of universal. Our luggage arrived soon after we checked out our room. That person was friendly and gave us good info on area. We ordered breakfast the next morning and it arrived on a table wheeled in by a waiter. Food is exceptionally good!!!! Before coming here I read reviews everywhere about Hilton and Sheraton both near Universal. Without hesitation I know I made the beat choice. A truly perfect stay and we have 3 more nights to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible water issues”
Reviews.Author: SailAwaySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed here following a night at the Montage in Laguna Beach, we are hilton honors members so understand what a typical hilton should be. Hopefully we hit it on an off day but the first night we had zero hot water. They called at around 10:00 pm to say it was resolved but it wasn't. So the next morning we turned on the shower and it was scalding and wouldn't cool off. So I used that water to make my tea and headed off to Universal...sans shower. At about 3:00 pm we returned to see if the water issues were resolved. It was back to tepid so we decided to check out early. The manager said that she would offer us a free night due to the incoveniences but we never received a letter and now it has been almost 4 weeks since our stay. The only positive is location but if you can't take a shower it's not even worth half the price.

Reviews.Title: “OK but could be better”
Reviews.Author: jgcbdsgte
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights between Christmas and the new year. The main reason we stayed here as will no doubt be the same as most others, is the location to Universal and for this it is great. However, with some small attention to detail it could be a lot better, i just got the feeling that the hotel knows the location will bring in guests and as such minor issues are left ignored. The room itself was poorly cleaned, you could write a message on the dust on the TV. If someone had opened the cabinet door when cleaning the room they would have noticed. There were stains on the carpet, one one morning there was no hot water at approx 7.00 am, tried to use the transport to Universal twice but couldn't get on it so walked instead etc. At the buffet breakfast (which isn't the cheapest) it felt that tourist are on one side and business guest are on the other. On our trip we also stayed at a Holiday Inn, whilst they cheerfully acknowledge us at Priority Club members, the Hilton staff ignored us as being HH members........perhaps we were only tourists? If we were looking to stay close to Universal then for location this is a great hotel, i just wouldn't expect the normal standards that other Hilton's normally deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great city.”
Reviews.Author: mateo b
Reviews.Content: Great staff/room and fun city. What else do you guys need, lol.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lise C
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We booked 2 adjoining rooms, both were clean and spacious. The location was great, a short walk to Universal Studios and City Walk (shuttle service is available but we did not use it). Reception staff were friendly and helpful, conciege service seemed more like a tour booking service - not very helpful or knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: hawaiimama
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hilton twice now. It is the closest hotel to our sons home so that was why we chose it the first time. It is big and has lots to offer. We were pleased with the room size and the good service we have gotten from all the staff. Check in has been easy both times, our rooms always ready. We stayed here first in October, then again over Christmas. I was a little disappointed with the holiday decorations, I expected them to be incredible, but that is not a reason to chose a hotel. The carpets the second time did show lots of wear and dirt which surprised me. They have large, very ornate carpeting and it looked horrible. They were trying to dry out some leakage in October so perhaps this caused the staining? This hotel gives you a voucher for a continental breakfast if you are gold members of HIlton and it is the biggest continental breakfast, with the ability to upgrade to the full buffet for $9.00. If you are a breakfast eater this is a bargain as you cannot try all the different offerings on this wonderful buffet. There was a large amount of foreign visitors and they cater to many different food likings. This hotel is at Universal Studios and they offer tickets and free shuttles to the park. We have not gone but it looks very handy, it's also close enough to walk over to the park or the City Walk area. The staff is very helpful and friendly, at the restaurant, the front desk, and the housekeeping. There is the option of self park in the garage, or valet. The parking does cost money either way, the self parking is very easy to use. They have what looks like a very nice pool and hot tub area, we saw lots of people swimming in December so it must be heated. We have enjoyed both stays here and will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: Just steps away from universal studios,this large hilton served to our needs. walk distance to Universal Studios and City Walk, minutes away by car from Burbank and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Once again - great service”
Reviews.Author: peapod33
Reviews.Content: Visiting Universal Hilton again- the only place I'll stay for business when I'm in town! Valet courteous and helpful as usual - and they genuinely seem surprised when you tip. Service with a smile. Front desk quick, fast and helpful -- very professional but friendly. Lobby is nice size - yes, the carpet shows a bit of wear but it's a really busy hotel - I'm sure they have a lot of groups coming through all the time. I recommend the Cafe Sierra for breakfast- great buffet with great service. LARGE assortment: from fresh fruits, pastries, toaster/ bagel station, Asian food, traditional English Breakfast, eggs/sausage/bacon/home fries to yummy fresh squeezed orange juice. Great service - last time I was here the gentleman waited until I was back at table from buffet for my coffee as he didn't want it sitting & getting cold! Rooms are always nice, clean and really good size for the chain & area. This time in 1667 - away from elevator (good) but still close (no long walk). Large windows and this room has partial view of Universal City Walk and City. BIG room, two big full beds ,full desk with comfy office chair and the light has multiple outlets for computer, Ipad, etc. Sitting area with chair/ottoman, lamp and table. TV is flat screen and pulls out & angles. (I wish every hotel would learn this). Mini fridge in every room. Nice bench for luggage or for getting ready. Coffee/ tea maker as well. Good large table btw. the beds that again has multiple outlets for your phone, laptop, etc. Big marble bathroom with decent light, lots of mirrors, lighted makeup mirror w/ magnification & hair dryer. Nice toiletries as well. Careful though - floors can be slick although I think they re-surfaced the tubs awhile ago so they aren't slick anymore ( a good thing). Good closet space & hangers (double wide closet) and good size safe that can fit my 17"laptop in it. Room service always fast and amazing. Best steak & burger I've ever had. No one ever seems to be able to do medium -rare, but the Hilton can! Always perfect & pink. Very courteous Yet friendly room service staff. Good bunch of guys. Yes, room service is expensive but they have a diverse menu compared to many hotels (including apps, Asian, sandwiches, Kid's menu, large dessert menu, etc.) Nice that they carry Coke & Pepsi products too! This visit I was escorted to elevator and front desk called about 10 minutes later to make sure everything was OK & had I received my non-feather pillows yet (I'm allergic to feather.) They hadn't arrived yet, but I wasn't stressed but the gentleman on the phone seemed quite upset they weren't in the room yet. Great service. Had a pretty fruit, chocolate & trail mix plate delivered (maybe since I'm an H Honors member?) and two comp bottles of water - nice touch after traveling. Now I'm off to sleep in the comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a splurge.”
Reviews.Author: CincyTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Christmas Eve to begin our California vacation. From the minute we pulled into the valet, we had an amazing experience. The bell captain was very friendly and helpful. The front desk personnel were efficient and friendly. The porters were excellent (they had our bags up to the room before we arrived). The room (including the bathroom) was immaculate. We did order room service as we were completely exhausted--the food was WAY above the normal room service fare. We had the breakfast buffet Christmas morning--outstanding food with friendly, helpful waitstaff. You do have to pay for parking--hello--it's LA!. This hotel is next to Universal Studios and close to the Hollywood side of town. It is a minimum of 30 minutes from the airport if you are flying into LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Really convenient for universal”
Reviews.Author: wonderfuldavey
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walk from the metro stop and another 5 minutes to universal. Great location and a great feeling after a long day in the park to know your room is only around the corner. We went for new years eve, and although they were very busy we were checked in and escorted personally to the elevator. Complimentary fruit plate in our room and great view of the park and city walk.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend for visit to Universal City”
Reviews.Author: kaotic363
Reviews.Content: We booked an Alcove room and we really enjoyed our stay even though only for 1 night. The view from the room was absolutely spectacular and the room interior was great and newly upgraded. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel staff even left a gift basket for us as a Hilton Honors Elite member which was very thoughtful. I would highly recommend this hotel for those that are looking for accommodations for their visit to Universal City.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't too bad”
Reviews.Author: sox15
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Across the street from Universal Studios, comfortable bed, room, and bathroom, great views of the freeway and Universal Studios itself, easy in/out of parking garage, fitness center THE BAD: Extra charge for wifi, parking fees. I did not bring this up with management, but there was a very noticeable draft coming from the taped up windows. Yep, the window that used to open was TAPED! Weird for a Hilton property - I'd expect this to come from a roadside motel. THE UGLY: Parking garage isn't convenient to the hotel. You have to take an elevator to the lobby, then walk past the restaurant and the lobby to get to another bank of elevators to your room. Getting to Universal Studios involves walking through the lobby, past the restaurant, through a corridor past all the multi-purpose rooms, into a dark lobby, and then through a dimly lit courtyard, and then down a dark street. It IS safe however.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cubagirl1998
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights 2 weeks ago and I was very happy. The staff was very welcoming. I know someone wrote that they thought the staff was being rude to them because they were Asian. I came with my parents and niece and we're Asian. The staff was very friendly and room service was impeccable. The room had 2 double beds and it was very large. I even liked the bath products they had. We had the breakfast buffett which had alot variety. It was all very tasty. They even had a Starbucks in the hotel so we got our fix in the morning. We were only a $15 ride to Hollywood Blvd. I would stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JPCtor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Great location in LA as it is close to the highway and can get anywhere. Also, as the name suggests, it is across from Universal Studios and CityWalk which are great attractions. For me, Universal Studios is a one day affair and the rest of the time should be spent seeing everything Los Angeles has to offer. A recommendation is going to Malibu because it is absolutely beautiful. Driving through the canyon to Malibu is also a great experience. The concierge is beyond great as they are so helpful to get anywhere you need to go. The staff were all friendly and attended to all concerns although one person at the front desk was not so pleasant. The restaurant was good. The pool was also nice. Had an executive room on the 19th floor facing the studios as well as the San Fernando Valley and also could see down town to the south. Room was large and very very clean. We rented a car for the last half of the trip and parking is quite expensive, but that's not too surprising. As this is for some reason the only Hilton in LA (other than the airport) there are lots of business travellers as well as some families, although during the week it seems that the former outweigh the latter which makes the hotel somewhat quiet and nice. Also, the hotel is extremely far from the airport so Super Shuttle is the most economical way to get there, as we learned the hard way getting there spending around 90 dollars on a cab. Super Shuttle is half that.

Reviews.Title: “studio visit”
Reviews.Author: zelda42
Reviews.Content: For those who want to visit universal studios in Los Angeles, this is the hotel. You can have a nice walk to the entrance plaza, or take the shuttle. Rooms are large and well maintained. The alcove rooms are the best other than the suites. Very good breakfast buffett with extensive choices. On weekends they have an astonishing dinner buffett with an emphasis on fresh shellfish. The front desk people are friendly and efficient. Also for those who prefer not to drive everywhere, and the bottom of the hill there is a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “This Hilton sets the bar...the BEST Hilton I've been to!”
Reviews.Author: rokquarri
Reviews.Content: 1) Location...5-9 minutes walking distance from City Walk. 2) Room size...HUGE! Had a couch king size bed, desk, fridge, flat screen in a wall unit with ample walking space and the bathroom was enough for 2 comfortably. 3) Comfort...luxury from the king size bed to the couch to the oversized toilet seats! Lol.... I was comfortable everywhere I sat! 4) Food...the buffets were the best I've had in a while...I had the breakfast twice....so many delicious choices...I didn't have room or time to eat everrything! 5) Service...lets just say I tipped way more than usual. Everyone was polite and at your beck and call. They set the standard for customer service like no other! GREAT EXPERIENCE!

Reviews.Title: “Wish the beds were larger”
Reviews.Author: Nanski
Reviews.Content: My family and I total 6 -- there are 3 adults and 3 teenage children. We visited Universal Studios and wanted a convienent place to stay. This was it-- they have a tram that runs every 15 min.so you never have to use your car while you are there. They do charge 18 dollars a day to park though. The rooms are great and the view( if you are facing the right way) is beautiful. My only complaint is your choice of beds in the room. Your choice is - 1 King or 2 Full beds They don't have queen beds, so it was a little uncomfortable when your used to a larger bed. The breakfast was fabulous, but very expensive. This hotel is NOT cheap, but I think its worth it. I will stay here again, next time we visit Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Crushtastica
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very clean stayed 8 nights used it as our base in LA, as the other reviews state great for Universal, we arrived early about 11.00am and although our room was not ready the very helpful front desk staff moved us to one that was 19th floor great views, did not use the pool area but it looked pristine, Only downside cost of $18 dollars per night for the car but then again thats LA it cost more to park the car for 8 days around LA than it did to feed myself! LOL. Also hotel has a limit on changing travellers cheques of $100 a day can be a bit of pain if like myself you forget to do it when you are out (but that is my fault and not the hotels). Great stay, Great staff very friendly and helpfull, I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: MelbPk
Reviews.Content: As we are planning to go to Universal Studio, decided to stay at Hilton LA Universal City. It is conveniently located and a short drive (10mins) from downtown LA. There is a free shuttle bus to Universal City (which also picks up Sheraton next door) but it is easily walkable to Universal Studio (across the traffic lights). Overall we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: glen c
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, we stayed 2 nights specifically to do universal studios, it was a great loctation for that. Has an amazing food dining and room service menu. Hotel was clean and staff were friendly and helpful, we recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Tmamacita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Universal City Hilton from August 3 to August 13 of 2011. We had some difficulty choosing between the UCH and the Sheraton Universal but we were very satisfied with our stay at the Hilton. We took the bed and breakfast package which provided us with a lovely breakfast buffet each morning which had hot and cold cereals, fruit, cold cuts, and a delicious array of hot items - eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, pancakes, omelets, and even dim sum. We took advantage of the free shuttle bus that came to the front of the hotel every half hour or so to go to the Universal Theme Park. There was also a shuttle bus from the theme park to the Universal red line metro station at the bottom of the hill which was complimentary as well. The Universal City Walk has a number of restaurants including Tony Roma's, Bubba Gump's Shrimp, and our favourite eatery, Wolfgang Puck's. The hotel was modern, clean and comfortable with a good workout centre and a wonderful outdoor pool. The service was friendly and the Concierge was helpful with printing off directions for the public transit as we chose not to rent a car. We loved the location and the ambience - would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzbrazil
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (5 minutes walk to Universal Studios or to metro station). Excellent breakfast. Excelent room. We will be back !!! The staff were very helpful and friendly. Tip: In front of the hotel there is a stop for a hop-on hop-off Tour Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “First Hilton won't be the last”
Reviews.Author: ben82d
Reviews.Content: This is the first Hilton Hotel I have stayed at and the first time I have been to the USA. Let me say for a first impression, well I WILL BE BACK!! Upon arrival the staff were very friendly and welcoming, the lobby looks oh so grand and lives up to the Hilton name. The concierge who checked us in was very polite and friendly and gave us the run down of the hotel, where things are, what is available to us and the local information about Universal Studios and Universal City walk. The room was on the 22nd (executive) floor, it had a king bed that was one of the best beds I have ever slept in, the sheets were soft and comfortable. The room also had a nice lounge to us as well as a work desk with a business chair that I set up with my laptop. The view over the city was nice I would have preferred a look over universal but oh well. The furnishings from the floors to the walls and the bathroom made me feel I was staying in exclusive comfort....not luxury but comfort. We also had breakfast included which was a massive spread with things to make the eyes bulge and mouth water. They also have a starbucks in the hotel as well. The only negative thing I can say was the doors between rooms needs to be a bit better sound proofed as I was trying to sleep on the first night and our neighbours had a conversation that I could hear word for word and had a young child who was running around causing a ruckus until late at night. If you are going to Universal Studios I can't recommend this hotel enough. Its 5-10 minutes walk from the door to the gate of the studios or city walk. There is also a shuttle that runs every 10-15 minutes as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for universal studios.”
Reviews.Author: 4kinloaded
Reviews.Content: Very handy location for the universal studios. Free regular shuttle bus or 5minutes walk. 10 mins from train station $6 ticket got me to the walk of fame approx 10 mins on train. We found hotel staff very helpful. Hotel pool was nice to chill round with free sunbeds and towels. Would stay again car park on site but not free.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out wonder”
Reviews.Author: caidy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a conundrum. It is not glamouress but for a big rude city like L.A. the staff are absolutely wonderful. However the hotel is right off the 405 which for a Irish country girl was rather exciting but very very noisy. The hotel does provide earplugs but like Karl Pilkington I can hear my heart beat so I don't like them. It is convenient if you are a contestant on "Wheel of Fortune" or "Jeopardy" as there were several at the bar hoopin and hollerin like they'd won the rodeo but that's more funny than annoying. The annoying thing is the bathrooms are so outdated. They are worn and rather sad. The rooms are nice and the telly is HUGE for the room. The breakfast was absolutely FANTASTIC and the restaurant staff were wonderful. I love Hilton most of the time and I liked this hotel but one thing....IT IS NOT CLOSE TO THE AIRPORT. Do not let the reservation agent fool you. It is very very far so let the shuttle take you or it will cost you about 40 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, located right at the studio”
Reviews.Author: BamaGreg
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business travel. It's a pretty good hotel. The rooms are larger than normal and the beds comfortable. The pillows are especially good. The bathrooms are large, modern, and better than the ones at the nearby Sheraton (which hsa slightly better bedrooms but is more expensive and lacks the great views.). The buffets here are good but expensive; it's worthwhile to walk across the street to the Citywalk (sp?), which boasts a large number of eateries. Avoid the coffee bar here, which serves substandard brew. The hotel's best feature is its staff; everyone I interacted with was surprisingly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: happybunnynumber2
Reviews.Content: We didn't go to Universal Studios but went to Burbank (WB tour), city walk, and Walk of Fame area. This was the perfect location. For a 3 night stay, we only took our car out 1 time. We walked or took metro the other times. We booked standard king room but I'm not sure how (maybe being a HHonors member), we had a 20th floor (out of 22 floors) huge alcove executive room. We had a fruit platter with bottled water waiting in our room and received vouchers for breakfast and appetizers. What a WONDERFUL unexpected surprise!! I will say the staff isn't the friendliest (front desk, concierge, breakfast staff) or the happiest, other than Jill in the Atrium Lounge (she's great!). But for the upgrades, location, nice clean hotel, we'd come back if we're in the Universal City area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelisfun1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect for our stay in Los Angeles. It is close to all the city walk restaurants and Universal City. Great staff that were very friendly and helpful. Beautiful grounds and very comfortable beds. I would recommend to anyone and will stay again when we return in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great location and nice clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: rza3000
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for four nights, the rooms are large, the TV is good also has HBO, bathroom is large and clean. The Hotel has a Self park which was $18 per day with in and out privileges which in LA is not that expensive!! Free USA today every morning which is nice however i would have preferred free WIFI over a free paper, WIFI is charged at an extortionate $8 per 24 hours probably due to the fact it is provided directly through AT&T, but billable to the room. Location wise it is a short walk over a bridge (after you leave hotel) to Universal City Walk and Universal Studios. not far from the hotel are a few fast food places in n out carls jr etc and you also have the city walk restaurants. Pros: Nice, Clean and cheaper than most good LA hotels and friendly staff, Cons: expensive WIFI, during an event the roads get busy and normarlly detour you so getting into the hotel can be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: jim0521
Reviews.Content: Luxurious Hilton hotel - very easy, fun, walk to Universal or use hotel shuttle. Let's just say eating the breakfast buffet that locals no doubt take advantage of, might be the highlight of your stay. Location perfect - Makes you feel like you are staying right in the Universal park. As a diamond honors member, I can tell you this is one of Hilton's best. hint.......I think if you sign up as a hilton member you might get the breakfast buffet free. That $35 buffet that you will not likely forget. $18 self park auto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cathymccreary
Reviews.Content: TheHilton Universal was really a great place to stay. It was walking distance to Universal Studios and a short trip to Hollywood and Vine. The personnel in the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. The lobby restaurant buffet was among the best I have ever had. Nothing bad to say about this experience. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best service I had in a while”
Reviews.Author: Thelmaccc
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and could not believe the friendliness and great service! An absolute delight. Also very convenient location for trips to universal studios. Rooms were very good and great beds as can be expected from a Hilton . Would recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “One Nice Hilton~ We liked everything about it”
Reviews.Author: Vneuman921
Reviews.Content: Attending the special Halloween Horror Nights at Universal Studio's we wanted to stay as close as possible to the park and this is by far the closest you can get. It's about a 10 minute (or less) walk over to the park from this wonderfully maintained property sitting high on the hill overlooking Universal Studio. We usually stay at the Sheraton which is directly below The Hilton but after having stayed here we're not going back. It's just a far nicer hotel from the moment you walk in and it had everything we needed from really nice restaurant, great lobby bar~outside common areas to sit in, and relaxing nicely appointed rooms. Our view from the 16th floor overlooking the park was just great. The room was spacious,Clean and the beds were really comfortable. In fact this Hilton although an older property really made our stay. I'd encourage anyone thinking about staying here to definitely give it a try. Not only is it right next to Universal Studio's but it's just over the hill and a few miles up the highway from Downtown Hollywood and still set apart enough to not be surrounded by traffic and noise from the City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay! Service cannot be beat.”
Reviews.Author: jager28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a rare weekend away from the kids for our anniversary. We chose to stay at this Hilton due to its proximity to Universal Studios. A few weeks earlier, my husband had stayed at this Hilton for business and was very impressed. At the end of our stay, I was equally impressed. Every employee we encountered went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed and were having a good stay. Check in was quick and we had a wonderful King room with a VERY large bathroom. We used the concierge desk to help up purchase tickets to Universal the next day. The walk to Universal Studios or City Walk was about 10min, or you can take the free shuttle. Being so close to Universal was a blessing as we were visiting during Halloween time and there were TONS of people driving to Universal for their Halloween Horror nights. It was wonderful to walk past the lines of people waiting in their cars knowing we could pass right by them. We ate 2 meals at the hotel. We tried the evening buffet. The selection was wonderful. The seafood was fresh and they never ran out of everything. Even though it was very busy, the service was excellent. Given this was a seafood buffet, the price tag is larger than normal. We decided to eat here since we were tired from the trip to LA. The breakfast was equally as good. My husband had the buffet and I had the continental breakfast. We had to eat fairly early (6:30 a.m.) due to our flight and everyone we encountered was very friendly and eager to ensure we had a good meal. Overall, I was very impressed with the service level of this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat. I will recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Universal Studios. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Universal City Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mohsen000
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great soft beds, fantastic bells and parking service, great breakfast and service, the first room we were given was not clean we even found a used bandage in the wardrobe, they changed our room, small rooms, need upgrading. On the 25th we had dinner in the hotel, 30 min before they took our drinks order, 40 min for the food order, water and a diet pepsi order never arrived we asked 4 times, after 55 min I went to star bucks and bought drinks, the food was served cold, rude waitress 10 person dinning and we were told sorry very busy. Try the Sheraton better hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: OmahaNEOmaha
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this hotel. Check in was quick and very friendly. Our room was a king alcove with a view of the pool, City Walk, and the freeway. Very clean and well appointed, including a small fridge. The bed was comfortable, the TV was a good size flat screen. We had a nice couch.
