The public and convention areas were clean comfortable and inviting. The pool area was quiet and plesant place to read as well as swim. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful with any questions. There is a small convienince store and Starbucks in the lobby. We ate once in the bar and once in the restaraunt and while not cheap, service and food were very good. City Walk Universal City was a short seven minute walk away (with a steep staircase to climb) for other food choices and shops. The shuttle to the City Walk worked well also. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Guest Services !!!”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids love visiting amusement parks. So After Orlando Universal Studios We decided to go to Los Angeles Universal Studios and have vacation on west coast. We decided to stay in this hotel for our holiday. It was a great choice. Because everything was just great. The hotel, the rooms, the front desk, the housekeeping, management of the hotel, location of the hotel. I recommend this hotel to everybody for sure. Thanks for everything Hilton Los Angeles. We were appreciated for your hospitality service standarts.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient to Universal ....”
Reviews.Author: wiliwali
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for five nights for a convention downtown, but since my wife was along, we decided to stay out in Universal City. The Hilton was less expensive than the downtown hotels, and really could not have been much nicer. Everyone from the doorman, front desk, bellman, room service, to housekeeping staff was very friendly, helpful, and polite. The room had a great view of the Universal City Walk, and you could look all the way down the Hollywood Freeway and see the city skyline (when the LA haze cleared!). The room had a huge TV, refridgerator, and safe. The bed was just how we like it. Universal City is located at the top of a steep hill. The Hilton is also near the top of the hill, so the walk from the hotel to Universal is not too bad, but if you want to go down the hill to the Metro or to Studio CIty, the walk back up is a hike for flatlanders like us. Universal does run a shuttle up the hill, however. The pool is nice sized and private. We did not try the resturant, but most meals seem to be served buffet sytle, and were impressive looking. Room service was prompt, effiecent, and good. Hollywood is only one Metro subway stop away, and you can be downtown in a half an hour or so. The subway may not be as nice as Washington DC, but it sure beats most other city systems I have been on. It is really close to the Burbank airport if you want to avoid LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my daughter's 21st Birthday”
Reviews.Author: ToriorVictoria
Reviews.Content: I want to preface this review by saying that I do not normally take the time to write reviews. However, I am so disgusted that I feel compelled to share our experience with this hotel. We had a VIP event at Universal Studios as part of my daughter's 21st birthday celebration. I booked two upgraded alcove king rooms on the 20th floor for the four of us to stay, the night prior to our Universal Studios event. We booked this hotel based on the proximity of the hotel to Universal Studios. When we arrived, only one room was available (which was fine), so we dropped our baggage off in the room that was available. The view was nice (windows filthy) but the room seemed tired. Being in a rush to leave to got to Beverly Hills, we did not really look too closely at the entire room and left for the rest of the day. Upon return to the hotel, we picked up the keys to the second room and went upstairs to get changed for our birthday dinner plans (Universal CityWalk). This is where the nightmare began. The first room had an intoxicating smell of Febreze. The floor was filthy. Dog pee (or something else?) on the floor behind the couch. Food stains (or something else?) had run down the baseboards in several locations. Old food and jam containers were under the television stand. This room was dirty everywhere we looked! I went next door to the other room (where my daughter was staying) to take a look at the conditions. The room did not smell of Febreze but had several stains down the walls and baseboards. I put my hand on the back of an armless vanity chair, to move it away from the wall, so I could sit by my mom. I felt something wet and looked at the back of the chair. The back and top of the chair had someone's fresh blood on it. Maybe the previous guest? ( Earlier- we had been told by the front desk that the person in that room was doing a late check out). I immediately ran into the bathroom and scrubbed and scrubbed my hands fearful of catching something. After numerous phone calls and waiting around for a long time(ruining any chance of making it to our birthday dinner plans), hotel security came to take a report. The front desk supervisor refused to come up to take a look at the filthy conditions of our rooms or the bloody chair. Christine, from security agreed that the rooms were filthy and that it was unacceptable. Nathan [--] (hotel manager) called us and said that the hotel would find us other rooms and he would personally make this right, including them getting me a doctor (which never happened!). For the next 4 hours, we had to either wait around in the lobby, the dirty rooms, or follow them up and down to different floors while they tried to find us two clean rooms. In between waiting around, we were escorted by the staff to the hotel lobby bar because we had missed dinner. We had 2 appetizers, 1 burger, 4 soft drinks, for a charge to us of $76. The food was so terrible, we left it (insult to injury at this point). Somewhere between 10:30 and 11:00pm, we ended up in 2 regular rooms on separate floors. At that point, we were too tired to care if the rooms were dirty and too upset because of ruining my daughter's birthday. I could barely sleep because of being so upset and my worry of what I might be exposed to by placing my hand on a bloodied chair. The next day upon check out, they had the nerve to try to charge me for parking and internet access. I requested that my parking fee, internet charge and previous night's bill for food at their lobby bar be removed. After some confusion, they removed these charges. I was assured by the Director of Operations that he would call my husband later that day to see how to make this right. In addition, I was told by the front desk supervisor (on duty at 8:30am) that Nathan Duke would call us personally. Neither person bothered to call us! The worst experience we have ever had at a hotel and we have traveled all over the world. This ruined my daughter's special birthday! In addition, I am left to worry about medical issues. There is no excuse for the lack of basic cleanliness that this hotel has clearly been cutting corners on for a long time! Spraying Febreze fabric spray (or an equivalent) is not a replacement for cleaning. Just because you are busy due to Universal Studios guests and business travelers does not mean you should skip thoroughly cleaning your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The best sleep you'll ever have”
Reviews.Author: bulldogspikesmom
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at the Hilton Universal, attending a convention. Normally, it takes me a night ( or even two) to get used to a new mattress. But this was a totally different experience. The beds were so comfortable that I fell asleep in a matter of minutes the first night and every night thereafter and arose in the morning with none of my usual morning stiffness. In addition, the maid service was excellent - the rooms were spotless, the view superb. The nightly buffet is out of this world - fresh oysters, crab legs, mussels, salads and vegetable dishes, chinese food, a carving table with roast beef and roast lamb and a beautiful dessert table. The staff was kind, attentive, helpful and fast. All this, plus a regular shuttle to Universal City Walk and the Studio Tour entrance. A great experience that I would happily repeat anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal Studios / Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chipwich
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (w/ kids ages 6 and 2) stayed here during Labor Day weekend 2011. We were in town for a family event and decided to visit Universal Studios during the last 2 days of our stay. This was my first stay ever at a Hilton and chose this hotel because of the close proximity to the park. The front desk was able to accommodate for our early check-in because I called when we were about 30 min. away. After check-in a nice lady behind the counter walked us to the elevator as we headed to our room. We had a nice size room with a great view of City Walk and the 101 freeway. Overall friendly hotel staff- one employee even offered to take a family picture of us in their nice lobby. The shuttle service was very convenient and ran about every 15 min. There was one night that we stayed a little bit longer at the park, after the shuttle service ended. The walk back to the hotel took less than 10 min. The only downside during our stay here was during breakfast, my husband, wearing a tank top, was told to wear a shirt at the open restaurant downstairs (CafÃ© Sierra). On the hotelâ€™s website, their eBrochure refers to this restaurant as â€œcasual dining.â€� First of all it was 85+ degree weather that holiday weekend and being SoCal residents, we only packed tank tops and shorts for this trip. I understand the shirt requirement maybe for their Sunday champagne brunch; however, we went for a casual breakfast before heading out for a day at Universal Studios. At least the staff let us finish our meal and offered to bring my husband a â€œlaundered shirt from downstairsâ€� next time we eat there. Nonetheless, we chose not to eat there the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel with Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: Bertybign
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient taking only 3 minutes where I received a requested room upgrade facing away from the Studios nearby for an extra $20 per night.. Elevators are fast and numerous with almost no wait in both directions. Staff are friendly and give the impression that they genuinely want to help whever they can. The room was very quiet, spacious with a well fitted bathroom and the air con worked perfectly. Wireless internet had a good reception in the room but was quite slow all for $8 per day. (Careful, they charge for each device connected!). The outstandng feature of this hotel is the fantastic buffet meals served every breakfast ($20) and Dinner ($44). The quality is excellent and variety outstanding with live music (piano) in the evenings.. The only negative comment concenrs the restuarant waitresses who expect 15-20% tip even though I served myself at the buffet. I was chased across the foyer on the first night by an angry member of staff complaining that I had not left a tip! My advice is dont leave these greedy people anything extra when using the buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Across the street from Universal Studios - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SD-Traveler-CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from Universal Studios, about a 5 minute walk (up hill and up some stairs) or you can take the shuttle service. The shuttle service is not run by hotel but by Universal Studios so the times are not so good during the week, it ends at 4:30pm, but on the weekends it runs from open until 9pm. The service is great, the rooms are clean and modern with a lot of amenities. We had a great view to the park. The beds have very soft linens and the toiletries are Peter Thomas Roth. We received a very nice plate of fresh fruit, a tin with chocolate and gourmet trail mix on arrival in our room and two bottles of water. We were traveling with family and requested rooms next to eachother, and they actually came through and we even had adjoining rooms. This is the first time hotel has actually come through with this request. Last year we stayed at another hotel and they put us in different buildings. I know that a lot of people complain about the fee for parking but it is Los Angeles and it costs money to park at every hotel. The parking was $18 to self park for 24 hours, not a big deal. It costs the same at Univeral Studios and this is safer. The staff was great about letting us keep our luggage in their hotel after we checked out since we were going to be at Univeral Studios all day. The seafood and prime rib buffet is $40, a little pricey but if you like seafood then it is worth it. I would definately stay here again, very convenient and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: bunnyprofessor
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly (apart from the Starbucks barista in the lobby!). The room was always very clean. The bathroom could have been in better condition, it was showing signs of age. The pool was a good size and the staff were very attentive. A pleasant stay with good people. Oh, and the hotel bar was not too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Universal Studios and Universal City Buard walk !”
Reviews.Author: Nidhipratap
Reviews.Content: It's a nice Hilton business like hotel . The rooms are nice big size and the concierge is helpful . The pool area is quite good and is open till midnight ( is heated as well ) Close to Umiversal City board walk

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Universal Theme Park”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: I use to stay here almost every two weeks because I love this hotel and my business meetings were nearby. These days I visit less often and actually miss this hotel. As usual I was upgraded to my corner alcove room on a high floor with a great view. As usual being Hilton gold I received my complimentary breakfast, evening snack coupons, and fruit basket was delivered to my room. This is a great hotel if you plan to visit Universal Theme Park. Sheraton down the hill is my second choice if the Hilton is not available. I will continue to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: randyoflht
Reviews.Content: This place was above great. The room was nice and clean. The WIFI was a little slow. The Seafood Buffet was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Quick response to our issues, clean and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: GoCAT591
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and found it to be a great location for eateries and access to Universal Studios. The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful. On the second night we were woken by a group of loud women next door after midnight. We phoned the operator and in no time, a security person was heard knocking on their door. It took three attempts to quieten this group down and each time we phoned the operator, security was there promptly. Despite having a rough night and not much sleep, I went down to pass on my thanks for the promptness in dealing with the problem. As we had a late flight back to Australia that night I asked for a later checkout. The duty manager was very sympathetic and arranged this for us. We later found out that they went to some lengths to ensure that we were not disturbed for the day so that we could catch up on some sleep. I commend the hotel for their response to our issues and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rfg07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want to go to Universal Studios but the nearby metro makes the hotel convenient for visiting sights like Chinese theatre etc. There are lots of good restaurants, shops and bars within walking distance and the hotel staff were really helpful with directions etc. All in all we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: papasandnic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in early September (me, husband, and 4-month old baby). Overall we had a pleasant stay. We had a King alcove room with a view overlooking 101 (and Vivid Entertainment...lol). The room was great and there was plenty of room for the luggage, crib, large stroller. Great size bathroom with a separate vanity. My husband raved about the water pressure in the shower - they gained high points from my husband on this! My only real complaints... because the size of the room we got and the shape of it, the TV seemed a little far away. They either need to move it closer or get bigger TVs for this room. Additionally, the food at the hotel was ok. We ended up getting room service one night because we ran out of time and our baby was ready for bed. The food wasn't what I would expect a Hilton to deliver. Since you are within walking distance from Universal City Walk I would suggest dining at the many restaurants over there. All in all we really enjoyed our stay. Would I stay here again? Definitely. The location was perfect (close to Burbank airport, Hollywood (minus traffic of course), and across the street from Universal Studios. Would I recommend to friends and family? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: msnurse
Reviews.Content: we come here for their buffet and since we come here a lot we decided to stay for our anniversary. the hotel is superb! very clean, comfortable bed, excellent customer service and very convenient if you're planning to go to universal city walk or universal studio. we had dinner in their 5class buffet then walk over to universal city walk then come back and hang out by the bar again. wish i stayed here longer...but will consider staying here again. the price is reasonable plan it ahead of time and it will be a little cheaper. and you can self park or valet your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Great Tour”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireDruid
Reviews.Content: Hilton Universal City (HUC) is right outside the entrance to Universal Studios (as is the local Sheraton, the only 2 hotels in walking distance). Easy to walk from "ballroom entrance" to the Universal Studio entrance in 5 minutes using a pedestrian over-bridge. Hotel was usual corporate, and a local wedding venue as well. Great buffet for breakfast, best OJ we had on holiday and good service, the only other "eatery" is a small take-away Starbucks-type coffee shop near the back lobby. But US City Walk has dozens of eating places from fancy restuarants to snacl carts and is great fun. Overall hotel is fine for Universal, and the City Walk but not ideal for Hollywood or Downtown LA. There is on-site car parking. There are no nearby amenities other than Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay close to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: 1873KB
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as it was handy to Universal studios (a 7 minute walk, although there is a courtesy shuttle that also picks up and drops off) and as we were just finishing a 3 week trip in the States, we thought it would be great to spend a few days here prior to flying back to NZ. We were not disappointed with the hotel, which is definitely in a great location. It's also very clean and tidy and we went to the seafood buffet on Friday night. The food was delicious and proved to be excellent value for money - we'd definitely recommend that. My one minor complaint was that we had a room with an adjoining door. This meant that you did get a bit of noise from the room next door. My wife and I both had coughs, as did whoever was in the room next to us. We probably all annoyed one another at some point during our stay! Right next door to Universal Studios is the "Citywalk". This has lots of shops and restaurants and is really handy if you don't fancy eating in the hotel. There are a variety of food outlets there, from fast food to restaurants. We enjoyed the Mexican (complete with very large margaritas of course!) in particular. We also took in a tour of Los Angeles, which was worth it (booked via the concierge at the front desk) as well as deciding at the last minute to take in Disneyland as well. My personal views are that if you are only going to visit either Universal or Disney, I'd opt for the former - although the Indiana Jones ride at Disney is excellent and worth heading for early! Neither of the theme parks were too busy, given that kids had just returned to school, so we did not have excessive waits for any of the rides. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. It's good value for money. And you know what you are getting with the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “True Definition of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on Sept 9-12 (celebrating our anniversary), I was a bit skeptical after reading some of the reviews but we decided to give it a try (we travel quite often). First from the time we checked in the staff was very professional and friendly they recommmended excellent restaurants and also walked us to the elevator, we checked into our room and it was everything I expected and also a beautiful view of the city (we were on the 19th floor king alcove room) next they gave complimentary fruit baskets which was a nice gesture. We took advantage of the concierge which was extremely helpful thank you so much kia and jennifer they were awesome!! We used room service which also was prompt and professional. My husband and I overall were very pleased. The Pearleys

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Maldenis
Reviews.Content: We based ourselves here because it's safe and handy to universal studios. We booked a king alcove room and it was very spacious and had terrific views. The hotel would certainly suit couples and families who want to be close to all the tourist attractions by either taxi or public transport or if you want to be able to go on a host of tours (there is a great tour desk at the hotel). Universal studios is walking distance and Warner brothers studio, Hollywood, rodeo drive and all the other tourist locals a short cab ride. It's not the place to stay if you are after a hotel in the nightlife district.

Reviews.Title: “steps away from universal studios, clean, and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: fortmac_eric
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our L.A. trip becasue of its location. It's a 2 minute walk to the entrance of universal studios. It's also close to hollywood and highland, beverly hills rodeo drive, and santa monica. The alcove room with a king bed was spacious. The mini fridge inside the room came in handy for our bottled waters that we needed everytime we go out of the hotel. The restaurants in the lobby seemed fine although we didn't had the chance to try one. Our room was clean and was properly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: gtate20000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the family who wants to vacation at Universal Studios however I wouldn't really recommend it for the business traveler unless you are part of a convention being held on site. There just isn't much of a night life in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne_11
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed everything about our stay at this hotel. As our flight arrived from Australia at 7 am, we arrived at the hotel very early but were instantly shown to a room. The room was very comfortable and spacious, and was within easy walking distance of Universal and CityWalk. The metro station is just down the hill from the hotel, and one stop later you're at Gruman's, Madame Tussauds etc. The staff was very efficient and friendly and always ready to help with any requests. The breakfast buffet was superb and catered to all tastes... I could not fault this hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Stevec418
Reviews.Content: We went to LA for my nephew's wedding over Labor Day. This hotel was very accommodating . The only minor problem was that because it was at Universal City there was no free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Atlez
Reviews.Content: We had plans to visit Universal Studios. We stayed at the Hilton on the 23rd floor in a suite. Beautiful view and the service was perfect. It was great to have the shuttle to take us back and forth from Universal to our hotel. We had dinner one night at the hotel restaraunt and ordered the Sushi platter - great choice. We also ordered a pizza pool side and really enjoyed that! The suite on the 23rd floor is a must try! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlEJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for a business trip. The location was very convenient to Hollywood, which is where our meetings were. Check-in was a breeze at the Hilton Honors counter. The attendant even walked us to the elevator. When I got up to my room, the door was ajar. I realized that it did not close easily and had to actually be pulled shut. Nothing was amiss in the room, and I did not complain about it. I did make sure I closed the door tightly throughout my stay and locked it when in the room. I had no problems. The room (king sized on 19th floor) was spacious. While the decor was modern, including flat screen TV, it did show some wear. A metal fitting in the bathtub was loose and the carpet was clear worn at the room entry. However, it was clean and everything worked fine. I realized shortly after arriving that I forgot my cell phone charger. I called the front desk and hotel security was able to quickly provide me a charger (for free) for the duration of my stay. Apparently, the retain chargers that guests leave behind in case something like this should happen. That was super helpful. I used the hotel's fitness center once. Although it's on the main floor, it is way back in a secluded corner. I was the only one in there at the time. While it required a room key for entry, there was no attendant, so it was a little creepy. I kept an eye on the door while I was in there, but no one every came in. I think they should have an attendant (or at least a handy way to reach a hotel employee) in there for guest security. Overall, I was happy with the hotel and would stay there again if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: LesT52
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this Hotel for value for money, quality of service and location. The location is perfect as it is away from the bustle of central LA yet only a short drive to the many attractions. After a long day site seeing this hotel offers a relaxing atmosphere to swim and chill out. Big bonus is that Universal City Walk is literally two minutes walk away with a huge array of family friendly eateries and shopping. Hotel food and drink prices reasonable. Pay when booking for the buffet breakfast which is brilliant value for money and should set you up for the full day. Only thirty minute drive to Disney and even less to Hollywood and Beverley Hills. Driving in LA is no problem and parking can be found for $10 a day with most public car parks offering the first two hours free. Buy a map showing the houses of the stars so that you can choose which ones to visit.

Reviews.Title: “FRONT DESK STAR...STUART GOMEZ”
Reviews.Author: rizzzo2
Reviews.Content: After being stuck in LA due to IRENE the one bright spot was the super service we recieved from the front desk attendant STUART GOMEZ.. He was able to extend our stay, calmed our concerns about getting out and was helpful with just about every aspect of out extended stay. The Hilton needs more people like Mr Gomez who is obviously trained and exceeds all expecatations. The night staff there could learn from him. If you need anything while there...go see Mr GOMEZ he will make your trip worthwhile and the HILTON should be proud.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but we'll find a different hotel next time. Still working out the kinks...”
Reviews.Author: TexasMom2boys
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we wanted to be close to Universal. It's a great location as far as that goes. Checked in and went up to our rooms - Whoa! It was occupied!! AND reeked of cigarette smoke. Immediately went back down and told the front desk. We were given another room. Checked into our new room - noticed a red stain on front entry hall of room. Ew. We didn't want to complain again, plus we wanted to head out of for the evening and unwind. Quickly showered and changed clothes (nice light up mirror and nice selection of soaps, shampoos)... son (8 yrs) used bathroom, closed the door behind him after exiting and it locked. We were on the phone with the front desk at the time who was nice enough to call and offer us free breakfast vouchers for the room mix up (problem was, I had already paid for the bed & breakfast package online, so instead, they comped our parking and gave us a free in-room movie). They sent security up to open lock, she couldn't do it and had to call engineering. 30 mins later engineer came to unlock door - quickly did that and left - as soon as he departed, we checked the door and it was still locked! I turned the handle and the doorknob came off in my hand. We tracked down the engineer again before he got on the elevator and he stayed to fix the door while we headed out to dinner. Used the Metro to see the Walk of Fame - don't need to go back there again. Were tired and wanted to just eat dinner so we decided to eat at the hotel lobby bar. BIG mistake. Worst food I think we've ever eaten. Inedible hot wings (ridiculously hot and I like spicy food), strange, congealed sauce on nachos, over salted burger. Kids ordered juice ($6 PER GLASS!!!! - we had beer at a bargain $5 per glass). Ugh. Lovely waitstaff though - very friendly and accomodating. Just horrid food. Went back to our room - watched the free movie and crashed. Comfy bed!! Breakfast buffet the next morning was lovely - REALLY GOOD FOOD - quick service and very nice variety. We quickly ate up, got ready, and headed to Universal - didn't wait for the shuttle as it is a very easy walk up the hill. The staff did everything they could to make things right, it was just quite unfortunate that sooo many things seemed to go wrong. It's a lovely hotel, great location too. Just not everything seems to be up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent indeed!!!”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeML
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and had a wonderful time, very good location to LA's main attractions. The room is Hilton AAA Style! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Lorniesan
Reviews.Content: Although they provide a shuttle bus it's just as quick to walk as you are right by the entrance. Rooms were plenty big enough for 4 of us. As with most chains extras were very expensive so breakfast & wifi were the most we have paid on our trip

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !”
Reviews.Author: Majito
Reviews.Content: Wow, I mean WOW !! This is a very nice hotel... The staff was sooooo friendly and helpful. The pool is beautiful and so the rooms... they are huge and have everything you may need... You can walk to the Universal Studios or you can take the free shuttle. The ballrooms are very nice and spacious too. I would stay there again for sure !! no doubt !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and new!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoyceTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and very nice atmosphere. Not sure of the age, but it looks brand new. The concierge went out of their way to help. We would vacation here again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trumelvan
Reviews.Content: one the whole this is a very good hotel, we booked this because of his proximity to unerversal studios (walkable & free shuttle bus). good sized clean rooms, comfortable beds, very nice pool with lots of sunbeds and facilities.The staff were very friendly. No resort fee is charged but there was a higher than adverage charge for parking and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: s7km4
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms, and customer service. A bit pricey though when factoring in parking +$18, but overall a nice stay for budget that is +2 spot per night

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business and for families with great room service”
Reviews.Author: peapod33
Reviews.Content: I stay here about once a month for work - as I travel to an office in the "NoHo" section of town. The location is, to me, a great central location - great for families who want to do Universal as well as for business as close to neighborhoods, stores, restaurants, freeways, etc. I always have a short wait to check in and staff is always friendly and efficient. I have noticed from time to time (when I've used Self Park) that the conference areas/ remote lobbies from the self park could use some cleaning of the carpets and a bit of a clean up. One time we came through the restaurant/ lounge/ buffet area apparently after a big party or catering event - and then it was almost dangerous - cords, spilled water & ice everywhere and the place looked trashed. I understand how much work it is to clean up after a rowdy bunch of conventioneers or partiers - but this was a bit, well, gross. Other than that I've seen nothing but clean, prompt service. I've used self park as well as valet - easy to use and find and no wait for my car. Rooms: I'm with the Hilton Honors Club so not sure if that affects the rooms I've been given - but I've always had nice clean rooms with enough room for my things. ***My one BIG complaint is no hair dryers!!! A girl needs her hairdryer and on a short business trip I'd rather not have to pack one. ***** Room Pros: comfy beds, usually a great view, flat screen TV, enough pillows and space, enough outlets for charging Iphones, etc. Room Cons:On occasion I've also had the light up magnifying mirror not light up at all..bummer. I've also had a TV where the remote barely worked - you had to try about 10 times to get a channel to change. I also received a room once on 5th floor that was bigger, but was the LOUDEST ROOM EVER! I was too tired to go to complain - but it basically was lower roof level and the entire room shook and vibrated with noise from the air conditioners and fan systems. Bummer since the room was huge with a really nice bathroom with an additional sit down vanity/ mirror area. Room service: I'm not a big room service gal - but when you work odd hours it's really nice. The food here is EXCELLENT and always served fast, hot and friendly. The burgers are cooked properly - medium rare is actually beautifully pink in the inside. The steak is great and veggies aren't mush. The desserts have been excellent and moist as well. Gift shop: Gift shop is handy but could stand to be open longer - usually assortment of snacks, drinks, OTC, etc. Business center: on main floor past gift shop - you use your key card to get in and then pay for the computer use. My big issue is I came back from late work meetings (10 pm ?) and the center was closed. If you have to use your key card I would expect you should be able to use it 24/ 7 - I had a very early flight and needed to check in & print out my boarding pass - no luck with a closed business center. *Hilton - please allow the center to be open longer! Pool: I haven't used it but many friends have and really enjoy it although I heard it's small my friend enjoys getting laps in early in the morning. Restaurant: We've used the "main buffet" restaurant for breakfast several times for groups. Very quick seating & friendly service. Wide variety of breakfast items - including considerations for international travelers as there was a section for full "British" Breakfast with beans, grilled tomatoes, sausage, etc as well as a general Asian breakfast section with fish, rice, sushi, miso soup, etc. It is a wide selection from bagels & pastries to eggs to fruit to waffles and more. There is fresh squeezed orange juice as well and the coffee is strong. Service was attentive when we needed more coffee or the cheque -as most people have to rush in the morning that was nice to not have to worry or look for the wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel when traveling with a kid !!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Close to Universal Studios, a short drive from the main attractions Hollywood Boulevard, Iris Cirque du Soleil, Madame Tussaud, Hollywood Bowl, Hollywood Sign, Warner Brothers Studios, etc.The staff is really attentive, the rooms are spacious and the beds so comfortable. We were able to maximize our stay thanks to the good advice of the concierge. The buffet at the hotel is excellent, my son loved the ice cream machine and the chocolate fountain! There is also a Starbuck Cafe in the hotel. In addition, the hotel has a beautiful swimming pool and enough chairs. I recommend this hotel even if it is more expensive in the end it is more advantageous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-good service and facilities-thin bedroom walls.”
Reviews.Author: MarkF54
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Book ahead for the price was right. It's location near Universal Studies is fantastic. The restaurant and bar areas were good. The reception desk were helpful for information and tours. The only negative comment was that the family in the next room were very noisy as their young children were screaming while playing games. Can't blame the kid's really. It's the inconsiderate parents that are at fault. I would stay here again. Clean room, good location, good bar and restaurant, ok price, what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dseattle
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Rooms and hotel are remarkably clean and sparkling. Very close to Universal Studios. A wonderful experience and great value.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: LAmom_11
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews and was concerned about cleanliness and wear/tear of the hotel but was pleasantly surprised. I'm very picky about cleanliness since my toddler runs around bear foot. At the check in desk the friendly clerk walked us to the elevator. The room was nicely remodeled (we stayed at the higher level floor), clean with new carpets. In the later afternoon before dinner time, they were taking around a cart, knocking on the doors giving out free welcome plates with fresh fruits, nuts, cheese, and a tin can of chocolate. My husband was in a business meeting and my toddler and I had fun. Will stay there again if we visit the Universal Hilton. The buffet was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: patsgo
Reviews.Content: Great location situated next to Universal Studios and centrally located for visiting northern LA area. The rooms seem a bit dated, but there was a new flat screen TV. All rooms seem to have good views. The climate controls were great despite it being very hot outside. Checked in late at night only to find that one of the windows in the room was not properly sealed. The window had clear tape on it in an attempt to seal it. It was facing the freeway and could not stand to listen to cars all night, so asked to be moved. The second room was much quieter. Wi-Fi was free to HHonors Gold and Diamond members. The breakfast was pricy, but very good. Great selection of hot and cold foods. All staff members made you feel welcome, were helpful and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time at this lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slorocky
Reviews.Content: We have took the kids to Universal Studios Hollywood during spring break,it was to our advantage to buy season passes to the studio. Our first stay at this hotel was very nice. The rooms are spacious,clean and well appointed. We had a lovely view of the hollywood hills. Our second stay was this summer. Our room faced the studios and we could see the fireworks from the Waterworld show. There is a convient free shuttle to the City Walk that picks you up right in front of the hotel. My husband had the all you can eat seafood buffet the first trip and is still talking about it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff but the furnishings are a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: tulanecpt1
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay here for a business trip. The hotel has a great view from the higher floors of Burbank and surrounding areas. The hotel lobby and conference areas feel a bit trapped in the late 80s/ early 90s which started me worrying that I was going to be staying in Jim and Cindy Walsh's guest room. Happily, the room decor had a much more modern look though only half of the furniture in the room looked like it had been upgraded. The views from the 22nd floor room were spectacular. I was in one of the alcove rooms which, I was told, was larger than a standard room. It also came with panoramic 180 degree view windows. I would say it's worth the upgrade. Valley views to the north, Hollywood Hills to the west, and Universal Studios lots to the north and east. If you're looking for the most convenient hotel to Universal Studios, look no further. It's a 5 minute (uphill) walk to the main entrance. Hwy 101 is right out the front driveway, and most of the Hollywood sightseeing landmarks are less than a 10 minute drive. If you're looking for a hip hotel that makes you feel like a movie star, keep looking. If you want to feel like you work for the accounting firm that handles the studios' accounts, you've come to the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Universal weekend and Teen Choice Awards”
Reviews.Author: kistianna
Reviews.Content: Pleased well beyond what we imagined... Have to hand it too this place. Can't beat the location. Just a 5 minute walk to Universal and City Walk but the shuttle was until 11pm in City Walk. It was just my daughters and me for the weekend. We had tickets to Universal Studios and the Teen Choice Awards. We arrived a little early, but had no problems checking in. Stewart was amazing! A really great first impression for this place. We really got an amazing room with views of Universal, the Hollywood hills, and downtown L.A. in the distance. I also liked the Breakfast in Bed feature to the room. It really was a great breakfast, though a little pricey. I chose Valet parking and it really paid off in the end, more so when I checked out. We arrived at 1p.m. Sat. and checked out at 7:15p.m. Sun. Since we had until 6p.m. check out day to take advantage of the parking, they quickly got my car to put my luggage back in after check out, so we could continue on with our time at Universal until the show. The awards show got out at 7p.m., and we just waited for the convenient shuttle which took us from City Walk to the hotel lobby our entire stay. The valet guys were so nice, the extending hour of parking was not a problem for them, and within less than a min., my car was out and ready for us to go home. Most definitely pleased with our stay at the Hilton. Though I didn't get a chance to check out the buffet, which looked amazing, there is always next time!

Reviews.Title: “King corner room with view.”
Reviews.Author: conrad1
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the top floor in a corner room with a great view of universal studios. The staff is excellent. There was a problem with the room. I contacted the front desk and was given a new room; the fruit plate and chocolate was a nice touch. The Brunch at the restaurant was amazing. Everywhere there was space, they set up a table of food. Next time I stay in Los Angeles it will be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for Universal Studios/Gibson Ampitheater homebase!”
Reviews.Author: rileysm0m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Teen Choice Awards. Got a King alcove room which overlooks the 101 Freeway. This room is roomy with a king size bed, desk, sofa sleeper, ref, coffee table, flat screen, and even more additional seating! We housed two adults, two teens, and a five year old for one night and it met our needs. I would say the hotel is due for a refresh as the lobby decor pays homage to the 80s. We came on a Sunday afternoon and didn't know that this was the place for all you can eat lobster tails, crab legs, and much more! It looked like there were many locals that were in the know of the Sunday event; try it, i don't think you'd be disappointed. We used the pool and I can see how you would want to cool off after a day in the park; they have cabanas, a bar, and grill down there too. There's a grassy area to chill out on and a jacuzzi to warm up in. Overall, I would stay here again but prepare to pay $20/valet and $7/day for wifi. TIP: they run a free shuttle every 10 minutes into Citywalk and Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stewart(ship)”
Reviews.Author: Maxon2511
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Hilton Universal City for 4 days and 3 nights last July 27th to July 30th. We spent a day at The Grove/Farmerâ€™s Market, a day in Universal Studios/City walk, a day at Camarillo Premium Outlets and another day sightseeing around Hollywood and Los Angeles area. We arrived in the Los Angeles area earlier than expected so we decided to check-in early. Stewart, the front desk personnel at the Hilton HHonors desk, was very professional, friendly and accommodating. The whole check-in process was smooth, quick and he addressed all the questions and concerns we had regarding our reservations. We had two separate reservations due to the hotel being sold-out and needed to contact the Hilton Reservations and Customer Care to reserve for these dates. Being a Hilton HHonors (Diamond level) member made the reservation possible. Since this was our first time at this particular hotel, he made an effort in stepping out of the counter to show us the main layout of the entire hotel lobby, the CafÃ© Sierra, Lobby Lounge, the Coffee Corner and gift shop etc. After the mini-tour of the hotel lobby, Stewart showed us the elevator going up to our room. Unfortunately, the room location we walked into was not what we expected; we pre-requested a room with Universal Studios view, not the Freeway 101. We immediately contacted Stewart to let him know regarding the room situation. I need to point out again that the hotel was sold-out during our stay. Nonetheless, he happily arranged and moved us to our preferred room later that day and called our room first thing the next morning to check if we got the room we wanted and if weâ€™re happy with it. Our stay in the property was so relaxing, enjoyable, and exceptional. The kids rather walked to Universal Studios and City Walk from the hotel due to the close proximity of the property to the theme park, restaurants and shopping. They had so much fun crossing the bridge than riding the hotelâ€™s complimentary shuttle service. Every hotel personnel we dealt with from the time we parked our car, to the lobby (front desk, lobby bar, sierra cafÃ©, bell service), to the room up the 22nd floor were friendly and helpful. We will definitely go back and stay at Hilton Universal City when visiting Los Angeles area. We had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Fraudulent Price Quotes!”
Reviews.Author: andrew411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not tailored to families with children, but to big business interests and corporate drones. Families stay away! Was quoted one price. Arrived only to find out the price was $50 more a night than I was quoted and that my Visa card would be charged an additional $150 bucks + tax + their fees + their tips. This hotel constantly tries to rip you off. I asked about transportation to the nearby Hollywood bowl. A robotic female staff member said you can hire one of their taxis @ $40 + tip each way. My jaw dropped. Are they kidding? No, they weren't. That is $80 total for a ride that lasts no more than 10 minutes each way. The Bowl is just down the street, but a little too far for a family with kids to walk. We ended up taking the Hollywood Bowl shuttle for $4 bucks, which the Hilton staff was so kind NOT to suggest to us. I'm sure they knew about it, but their goal, their purpose in life, was to RIP US OFF!!! For the money, worst hotel experience we've ever had by far. Outrageously high prices for a small 3 star caliber room and the expensive breakfast and the dinner (which are not included) are garbage. We have never encountered a more dishonest and deceitful hotel in our entire lives. A total RIP-OFF!!! Ruined our family's vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Place to Stay, mahoosive breakfasts, love to go back”
Reviews.Author: Tangokidd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, you walk in and the lobby oozes charm and sophistication. We checked in and got offered a better room, wow that room was massive! It over looked Universal and we couldn't wait to see it. The staff were happy to help but the most helpful people were the breakfast staff. We went down for breakfast at 8am and were confronted with the largest breakfast selection I have ever seen in my life. If you like to eat well before a day in the parks then this is the place for you. It took us about 10 minutes to walk round it all, whatever you could have thought about eating or drinking, it was there in abundance. Funny thing was, we were the only ones at breakfast at that time so we had the pick of the bunch. The breakfast staff took us round the room showing us everything, I left that morning feeling very, very, very full. Couldn't fault this hotel, staff friendly and helpful, room was great (bigger than my house) and was very clean. The only thing I didn't like (nothing to do with the hotel) was we got a Taco Bell from inside Universal to take back to the room, they are discussing!! We threw them out after taking one bite but the room smelt for the rest of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinRaves
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and it never disappoints. Easy on/off access from the 101. If you are a Hilton Honors member you are treated like royalty. Take the complimentary shuttle to City Walk to browse the souvenir shops and/or eat from one of the many restaurant choices. The room service at the Hilton is excellent as well. Very convenient location for all the Hollywood sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaCaryn
Reviews.Content: Hotels around Universal City aren't cheap, but this one was worth the price. It was walking distance to Universal City Walk and Universal Studios. The hotel also has a shuttle if you don't want to walk. From our room, we could see the entrance to Universal Studios. We had a suite, which gave us plenty of room for 3 kids. The lunch buffet was very good for the kids, but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in LA”
Reviews.Author: mhclauren
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton Universal two to three times a year when I visit Los Angeles on business. The location is fantastic as it's central to both LA and the Valley, and has stunning views if you're on an upper floor. It's also convenient to have Universal Studios' City Walk next door, which includes several restaurants and a large movie theater. The staff at the hotel are excellent - check-in is often fast and efficient. I also love that you can self-park your car for a fairly reasonable price. If you're a Hilton Honors member, you'll get a free upscale continental breakfast and a nice welcome tray of food in your room. Always a high point to stop here during my business travel.

Reviews.Title: “My favoriate Hilton among the three Hiltons in this area.”
Reviews.Author: B2C2V
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hilton Pasadena, Hilton Glendale and Hilton Universal, quite regularly. Among the three, my preference is Hilton Universal, then Hilton Glendale, with Hilton Pasadena the least. @ Hilton Universal, gold and diamond HHonors members are provided with complementary continental breakfast and appetizers and beverage in lobby lounge, not the case in the other two. Its breakfast has a lot of choices, including dim sum (probably more for tourists from Asia). Also, as a premium Hhonors member, I have been welcomed with a fruit basket and bottle water every stay. A small refrigerator in room can be handy at times. Not much to do in its immediate surrounding area except the Universal Studio the hotel is next to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, loved the pool area..”
Reviews.Author: CTeddie2
Reviews.Content: Very clean and elegant hotel. Pool area was beautiful and relaxing. The buffet looked great every night but unfortunately we didn't have time to eat there. Rooms were clean and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kathiMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Hilton Universal for 11 nights. We had two rooms on the Executive Floor. We were upgraded as a result of being Hilton Gold members. When we checked in, we met Stuart at the Hilton HHonors Desk. We were early for check-in, and Stuart spent a lot of effort trying to get us early check-in. One room was ready immediately, so we sent all our luggage up to that room. We asked Stuart to find another room close by to the first. He spent a lot of time and effort finding us a room that would meet our needs. He even gave a key to my husband, so he could check out the room first. We ended up only two rooms away from our daughter and her family. Check-in ended up taking some time as a result of our special requests, but it was well worth the time. Stuart put us in rooms that were perfect. The rooms were immaculate, large, and had a great view from the 20th floor. The rooms service and housekeeping were spectacular. Most days, trays of fruit and candy and bottles of water were delivered to our room. Even turn-down service was provided. If we left the room, we always returned to find fresh towels and a clean bathroom. It seemed that housekeeping came several times a day. We were also provided with breakfast coupons that included a continental breakfast that was more than enough and well-presented. For only $9 more, there was a breakfast buffet that included things like shrimp dim sum, omelets, and more. The coupons even said that they included tips, but the service was so superb that we left tips anyway. Each weekday, we received a coupon for a drink and an appetizer for each person. These were huge portions. Between the breakfasts, trays of food to the room, and coupons for appetizers, it felt like we were being fed all day. We did go one time to their evening buffet, which was elaborate, delicious, and beautifully presented. The location of the hotel was just perfect. Universal is across the street, and everything else we wanted to visit was right off the 101 highway that runs by the hotel. It was convenient to everything. We attended several events that took place in the Hilton Ballrooms, and they were absolutely beautiful. The hotel catered all the events. The beds were comfortable, and the rooms were quiet. My husband, who always says he doesn't like "long" vacations, thought that even he wanted to stay longer. We will certainly return to the Hilton Universal. Ask for Stuart at the front desk. We thank him for his part in making our vacation so superb.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Harris_of_Hollywood
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent buffet, and fantastic view at night. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “We expected more from this Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldwide972
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. We got our room on high floor with very nice view over the Universal Studios , but was a littlebit "used out". Carpet had alot of stains and was worn out on many areas, bathroom needs renovation (joints between tub tails had traces of mold, or been torn out). We got complimentary water and welcome box of chocolates in the room. At breakfast at 9am the restaurant was very crowdy. They ran out of food in main food stations ( bacon stripes, scrumbled eggs) and did not refil it in 30 minutes while we had our breakfast; they ran out of fresh orange juice from avtomatic juicer too and nobody from the restaurant staff brought fresh oranges and put them into this juicer despite getting reminder from several guests. We weren't lucky to get it, because we left after 30 minutes having very "healthy" breakfast - only cereals and fresh fruit with no bacon stripes and scrumbled eggs for a good start of the day. Asian food station ( dim sums and other food) was well stocked all the time. If we had to stay another night in this hotel we would probably cancell the reservation and stayed somewhere else. This hotel needs refresh and more effective staff in the restaurant where breakfast is served.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyHolidayzz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely heated outdoor pool and spa, great breakfast buffet. The view from the rooms are wonderful - because the hotel on a hill, there are great views in every direction. Perfect location for Universal Studios just across the road - a five minute walk or the hotel has regular shuttles. If you're deciding between the Sheraton or Hilton, the Hilton is a shorter walk. Universal Studios itself is fabulous - but definitely pay the extra for a Front of Line Pass otherwise you'll be lined up for rides in a very long queue. We went in peak summer holiday season and the wait for rides was never longer than 5 minutes with a Front of Line Pass. There are limited passes available each day so buy ahead of time. Universal Citywalk adjacent is excellent - lots of shopping, restaurants, entertainment, and open until very late. There is a mexican restaurant on the left hand side with a live mariachi band, good food and great atmosphere. The metro station is a 5-10 minute walk downhill and Hollywood is only one or two stops away, with the station being right in the heart of Hollywood - trip cost $1.50 per person. Starline Tours operates a free shuttle pickup from the hotel for its tours beginning in Hollywood. We took the Hop-on-Hop-off double decker bus tour which allows you to up to jump off anywhere along a designated route, explore, and then hop on another bus which comes along every 15 minutes or so. We visited Rodeo Drive and the The Grove/Farmers Market. To get to the Hilton, get a shared shuttle from LAX for around $20 per person - Prime or Express Shuttles - allow upwards of 40 minutes travel time, depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, worn hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Daisyss
Reviews.Content: Visited Universal studios and Warner Brothers studios with my teenager. Stayed three nights here after four nights at the Disneyland Hotel. Disappointing step way, way down. This hotel desperately needs a makeover and new everything - carpeting, paint, furniture, bed covers... Had the best possible room on a top floor (not a suite) and the windows were filthy - on the inside! Could not see out when we checked in for the filth on the inside of the windows. The bedspreads looked -well "long on the tooth" is the polite way to describe them. The staff was energetic but everyone and I mean everyone looking for a tip and I was glad I did not hire the "driver" they recommended for a tour in town since the big bus tours were just as good and 1/4 the price - clearly you need to watch out for recommendations from employees that they are making because they are benefiting in some way.... That being said - you can walk to Universal Studios and Warner Brothers is only 20 minutes away. The location is excellent. I will however, not stay there again even though it is not pricey and even though it is close to Universal. Just too dirty and too worn.

Reviews.Title: “Another Enjoyable Stay at this Hotel Property”
Reviews.Author: 3spunkytravelers
Reviews.Content: This was our family's second stay at this hotel. We decided to return because of our previous experience and we like the location. This was a good decision. The staff once again was very pleasant, professional, and always there and ready to help. If/when we find ourselves spending another vacation in the LA area, it is highly likely that we will try to make the Hilton at Universal City our base of operations again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a family”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl41643
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for business but had my son with me. Directly across the street from Universal Studios and City Walk. We were there on July 4th and had a front row view of the fireworks from our room (1968). Hotel was very clean, room was spacious, service by the pool was spectacular. Only downside was little coffee cafe - food stale and couldn't get a latte quite right. Regular restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, extremely friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nardz01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Big rooms, great service, friendly staff. The only thing I could say bad about this hotel is that unless you are planning to spend most of your time at universal studios (which you can do in 1 day) it's just a bit further out of Hollywood then I expected but that's my own fault for not doing my research thoroughly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay just north of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Tizmania
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 5 times in the past year, as I do business in North Hollywood. This is a very large hotel, but it is kept in great shape. The rooms are nicely appointed, but my favourites are the corner King rooms - they are very spacious, and have an interesting layout. I never worry about hearing my neighbours - the rooms seem well soundproofed. The pool and hot tub are great - nice ambiance and palm trees, and though close to the 101, fairly peaceful. The hotel is very well situated - 10 minutes from Hollywood, right next to the Hollywood Hills, close to Burbank and North Hollywood as well. The 101, 170 and 134 Freeways are at your doorstep as well. I've been very happy with the staff here as well - I've become familiar to them, and they've always treated me well. My only concern about the hotel is their key cards seem overly sensitive - I'm frequently re-coding them. Apart from this minor issue, I would not hesitate to stay again, and recommend to business and vacation travellers alike!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: vKenneth
Reviews.Content: First review ive been written; checkin was very smooth, ive been granted a room on top floor on my request while my hhonors profile stated low floor. My complimentary fruit was brought afterwards, very nice. Nice staff and excellent location. Love the panoramic view from the room and everthing is facilitated. I do however find the placement of the refrigerator a bit strange, it isnt really part of the room interior, but hey, who cares :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice lounge, good view”
Reviews.Author: wunderwoof
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of the King Room and Universal Studios tickets for 2 deal, which saved about $70 for the one night we stayed. Checked in late after a long flight--the lounge was still serving. Friendly waiter (an aspiring actor, surprise). We had a decent pizza. Hotel prices, of course, but we didn't feel gouged. Mentioning that it was our anniversary (it was!) in the comments box on the booking site scored us a room on an upper floor with a nice view. Very attentive front desk staff and concierge. Attractive lobby and garden. There are restaurants and a movie theater by Universal, about a 10 minute walk away. But there's nothing but Universal Studios and other hotels nearby. This is a need-a-car hotel if you're doing any sightseeing. Coffee and snack kiosk in the lobby where we got our juice and Danish in the morning rather than going to the restaurant for breakfast. Hilton's $18 self-parking fee was good till 6 pm (and includes in-and-out privileges), so even tho we checked out at 10 am, we could leave the car at the Hilton and walk to Universal for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Shame for Hilton”
Reviews.Author: healthphysic
Reviews.Content: Being a loyal Hilton HHonors member I'm sorry that I ever stay in this Hotel, customer service is terrible, we're not demanding customers, just a clean room and medicre service will be ok with us. 3rd time that we stay here and all 3 times had horrible customer service "Richard" at the front was helping a couple before us and the couple left very frustated, upon my turn he stated that this Hotel was not for "those type of peole" when I asked him what he meant by that he said "you know, dark color people don't tips us very well" I ask him (Richard) to apologize to this couple instanly. he stated that "if you don't like it your welcome to go also". Rooms are old and blood on bed covers. 289/night plus 16 to park + hate towards minorities. The Sheraton is much better choice, I will never stay here again, Shame on you "Richard"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChloderosLaclos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days (4 nights). Diamond Members. Service was flawless. The staff deserves ten-fold raises!! Part of Room/Vroom package with Enterprise. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “You expect better and deserve better.”
Reviews.Author: johnaallen
Reviews.Content: Great location for Universal park and red metro into Hollywood. Checked in found crumbs on the coffee table. Attempted to order room service on the 4th call placed order then 30 min later informed that they did not have what I had ordered. I ordered a pizza not really that hard to make. Internet is $7.95 for 24 hours. Most hotels that I stay at don't charge for Internet access and if they do it's not this extreme. The staff are friendly and professional. Parking charge too high. I can park and eat at the hotel and pay $4 but as a guest I pay $14. Tell me does that make any sense.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for wilting seafood and shady cab drivers”
Reviews.Author: yyzcupcakes
Reviews.Content: We were in LA to see a concert at the Gibson Amphitheatre and this was perfect for that. The room was clean and had a great view, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a great stay, but there were some issues: - The hotel restaurant has a large buffet, most of which is left out in the open constantly. We were always walking past it, and I found it mildly disturbing that they left out shucked oysters and other seafood (covered in plastic wrap) when the buffet wasn't even open. - We had an issue with taking a cab from the hotel. I know that this isn't the hotel's fault, but I feel like I should point it out because it was a cab that the hotel arranged (and we tipped them for!). The cab driver tried to pull the tourist scam on us by basically taking the longest route possible, trying to turn a $20 cab ride into a $50 one. We caught him with the iPhone's GPS and he became tongue-tied and it was obvious that he knew what he was doing. I don't know if the hotel cabs are doing this to others, but just be warned! Would I go back? If I was going to the Gibson Amphitheatre, yes. But I wouldn't eat at the restaurant or take a cab from the hotel without knowing where I was going.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dgoren
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is situated just steps from the entrance to Universal Studios, though it is also very close to the freeway and easy to get to other sites in Hollywood and Los Angeles. I am a Diamond member so I stay at Hilton properties almost weekly. I do not like paying for parking, but it is standard for many full-size Hilton hotels. Also, you will pay for internet as well unless you are a Diamond member, so I got lucky there, although I don't understand why a Hampton Inn offers free wi-fi. I found the hotel to be clean, quiet, and with a friendly, attentive staff. The buffet breakfast is vast and great, though not cheap (you get what you pay for).

Reviews.Title: “Bad beds”
Reviews.Author: bsweet321
Reviews.Content: The beds are only full not queens. It was very uncomfortable for our family of 3. The location and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! You Cannot go past this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewN259
Reviews.Content: Where do you start, from the minute we walked into this hotel until the day we left, everything was fantastic. The staff were some of the friendliest I have ever met on any of my travels, the rooms were a great size with excellent rviews and fantastic facilities. The pool area was very well maintained and clean and a pleasure to spend time in. What we found very good was it's somewhat central location. Close to Universal studios, and Warner Bros, a quick trip from Hollywood, and the majority of tours pick up from the hotel. Bear in mind if you intend on spending time at Disneyland its about a 45 minute trip. We actually checked into a hotel in Disneyland for the two days w were their instead of travelling. Overall the Universal Hilton is a fantastic place to stay and I have to say that the staff were the ones that went a long way to making it so good!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: skaplan1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to this hotel there were guests dressed to the 9s getting out of a limo with Chanel bags and we thought...uh oh...we are SO not supposed to be here!! However, once inside we were treated like we were those folks!! The hotel shares a parking lot with Universal Studios which was really convenient. Had a toilet problem which was fixed very quickly by a very nice maintenance man at 9:00 p.m. Room was VERY clean and spacious. Could not have been a better visit.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Universal Studios? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: BooNChops
Reviews.Content: Found it pretty easily and loads of space in the self park area, lift to reception and straight to check in with no queue. Good service from the staff and a nice open area with the buffet/restaurant and bar area. Room was great and everything you would expect, slightly annoying you have to pay for the WiFi but flip that over you get free use of the fitness centre so hey ho. Also there was a slight niggle with the iron in the room but it was exchanged no problem - they thought it was 'cute' that my Wife brought it down to reception rather than having to wait for it to be collected! The real bonus of this place though is the very short walk to the Universal Studios park and retail/food space next to it. You are there on foot in less than 5mins - we were amazed to hear and then see a shuttle bus! Why you would bother I've no idea. There was also a large event on the second night we were there and it made no disruption to regular hotel guests so that was good. Also the portions of the food at the bar are HUGE, ok we are from the UK and in the US so you expect a difference but this was massive. Like I say if you are visiting the park then its a great spot with a really friendly set of staff and nice, neat, clean and inviting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but still good”
Reviews.Author: Salman_QLD
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is perfectly situated - it's a simple walk up the hill to Universal Studios and City Walk and a walk down the hill to get to the Metro to go to Hollywood. The Transportation Desk was also able to organise a car service to take us to WB studios. My favourite thing about this hotel is the porters (bell boys). They were extremely friendly and chatted to us while we waited for car services or when we returned to the hotel from a day out. The rooms are on the older side but still functional. The ice machine on our floor broke and there was water all over the hallway floor. However, this was quickly rectified. We tried the buffet breakfast and it was very, very good. However, I wouldn't like to pay its prices every morning! The front desk staff were very pleasant and we were able to organise a late check out as well as obtain all the information we needed. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby. Unfortunately, the hot chocolate I had was not very nice. One major downside is that you have to pay for wifi. It would be better if this was included in the room charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right next to City Walk and Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: calif_laur
Reviews.Content: We had adjoining rooms with our 11-year old birthday boy, one of his friends, our 14-year old daughter, myself and my husband. We arrived at the hotel and were delighted when the valet juggled my son's soccer ball and then watched my son show off his moves. Set the right tone for us! Fidel at the front desk was awesome. Hilton should hire more just like him. He was warm and friendly and super-efficient. The next morning he called out to me by name and said hello. EXCELLENT customer service. Last time I had service like that was at a very pricey boutique hotel in NYC so i was definitely impressed. We had a double room and a king room with an alcove. Rooms were big enough to be comfortable. Enjoyed the Sunday Champagne Brunch at the restaurant. I'm not a big fan of buffet brunches, but this one was delicious! Would definitely recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: echow_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conevniently located. Rooms were okay. The location worked for us

Reviews.Title: “convenience for Universal Studio visit is main selling point”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaRock
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with two kids, 11 and 9 years old. The hotel was fine: clean rooms, quiet, nice bathroom, plenty of hot water, nice pool for the kids, all the essentials. We stayed there because I wanted to be within walking distance of Universal Studios and Universal City Walk. I have no serious complaints about the hotel, but convenience to Universal Studios is the only reason why I would stay there again. The beds are small (doubles, not queens) and ours were sagging. There is no shower fan nor can any windows be opened in the room, so by the time the entire family has taken a shower the room has become tropical. There is no way to air out the room. Internet was not included with the room fee even for a Hilton Honors member. The cost of breakfast at the hotel was high. Parking was $18 USD per day. When traveling with the kids we typically stay at a Holiday Inn Express or equivalent, and a nice new Holiday Inn Express is more comfortable and a better value than this Hilton. However, for convenience to Universal Studios it can't be beat. The only real problem with this hotel is that it has high end pricing for middle-of-the-road quality.

Reviews.Title: “slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jackbaby
Reviews.Content: We went to see a concert at HB, and the hotel was convenient to the shuttle. We got to the hotel around 1 p.m., check in was a little slow but ok. When we got to our lovely room it was quite warm, tried to adjust the thermostat, but it did not seem to work. We then called the front desk and they said they would send someone up. He arrived about 30 minutes later. He said he would have to go down stairs and do some adjustments and left the room very warm. We had to leave for our concert without the ac being fixed and when we got back the room was freezing without any success in adjusting the temperature. We hoped to get a room where the ac worked correctly, but apparently there were none available. This was my only disappointment with out stay at the Hilton, because we didn't get much sleep because it was too cold. Otherwise, the hotel was beautiful, and the breakfast buffet was very nice.l

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mlatar
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights, and the services at the front desk and rooms services is terrible. First of all, most of the time they only have one person in the front desk (imagine how much time you lose waiting, due to they have lot of people staying in the hotel), then when I arrived in the room, there was no towels, so we need to ask for them, and wait for more than 30 min to have a shower. The rest is high considering it does not include breakfast, the hotel only has 4 elevators for hundred of rooms and the are really slow!, so in the morning we waited for more than 10 min for get into one elevator. In addittion, the hotel does not have a business center with free access to internet, so if you need to connect to the web you have to pay anyway. The last thing, is now I am checking my credit card, and they add me some charges that were wrong so now I have to wait for 5 days to get my money back. If I have to return to LA for sure I am not choosing this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel easy walking distance from Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Henderson_NevadaKen
Reviews.Content: Get a Alcove room its alittle larger then a regular room.Service great nice view facing HWY 101 If you like Buffets you will love this place Buffets Vegas style.Going to Universal Studio in early April Park not crowded longest wait in line 20min. Most rides walk right on. Gets alittle cold at nite City Walk nice, lots of good rest. Only problem is if you need to use your computer theres a internet fee. Parking alittle high. But my guess is most Hotels in Ca. you pay to park at Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jstewarwt101
Reviews.Content: I would normally not complain about a hotel experience but I think this one deserves a review. My husband and I booked this hotel for two nights while we were in LA in March 2011 with intentions to book a few additional nights. After our first night we realized that this hotel was not up to Hilton standards and the two night stay was more than enough. When we arrived we began our check in process and found the front desk person to be really rude. After waiting for almost a half hour to check to our room, which we booked online, we were advised that our room was not ready and to come back in an hour. Once we returned we were assigned to our room and realized that we were given two double beds instead of the king that we requested in our original reservation. We decided not to complain after being tired from a long day of travelling and sightseeing. Needless to say that we ended up sleeping in separate beds (not because we wanted to but because their doubles are the size of twin beds) for the duration of our stay!!! The room was comfortable, a decent size but there was an unpleasant odor that seemed worse in the restroom. Every morning before 8am we would receive a wonderful wake up knock from the housekeeping staff even with our do not disturb sign on the door! We thought the additional charges were somewhat extreme (parking, internet, etc). The day we checked out we began reviewing the bill and noticed significant charges for the mini-bar which we did not consume. We went to the Front Desk to inquire about it and the lady was extremely RUDE!!!!! She refused to listen to our inquiry and just said, â€œyou consumed these products so you will have to pay for itâ€�. Rather than dealing with our inquiry she asked for our email address and advised us that she would look into it further later in the day and email us. Finally after arguing with her and having her talk to us like children, she finally called the person who was in charge of the mini-bar billing to obtain a print out of the charges. Turns out that we received the bill for the mini-bar consumption from the previous guests in that room!!!!! We were charged for two bottles of wine, a bottle of whiskey, six beer, snacks, etc.). Finally, after the Front Desk person reviewed the bill she adjusted our bill. This is not a hotel that I would recommend to anyone who is visiting LA on vacation. The hotel has a long way to go to be up to Hilton Standards and the first thing that should be reviewed is the customer service level of their hotel staff.
