The location is great because itâ€™s walking distance to Universal Studios and a short drive to Rodeo Dr., Hollywood Blvd., etc. but that is the only positive thing that I can say about this hotel experience. During this vacation stayed at numerous hotels and this was by far the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Some issues but overall recommend-able. Strange and Amazing Buffet.”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 21 year old niece to this hotel for a combo business/leisure trip. The hotel is within a comfortable walk of Universal Studios which made it very convenient, and there is a handy shuttle if you don't want to hoof it. The hotel charges for parking, which irritates me but was not unreasonable for a large urban area. One of its greatest strenghths is the Mandarin Buffet in the main restaurant every Thurs-Sun, which attracts over 800 locals per night. Everything from Lobster Thermidor to jellyfish tentacles to Korean bbq to cotton candy to a chocolate fountain to sushi to carving stations to many salads - you have to see it to believe it. All this accompanied by a very good piano-playing gentleman who covered both Hoagy Carmichael and Miles Davis. Our server, Deena, gave us tons of helpful tourist tips. The rooms are nice enough, with very good bedding. There is inadequate counter space in the bathroom if you're not alone. Two outlets on the desktop, but hotel obliged our request for a power strip so that we didn't have to crawl around on the floor to charge extra gizmos - or charge them in the bathroom. Biggest downfall is that the hotel's construction does not keep out rain - the windows in our room leaked, and the atrium was full of buckets - another grandiose architect who didn't build the thing to last. Carpets throughout were in very poor condition and dirty. However, these were the only drawbacks, and as we had a reasonable room rate ($179 I think) I would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ....Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton with family - and booked 2 rooms. Requested roll away beds so kids didn't have to sleep with a parent. Houskeeking and front desk were RUDE and denied request for roll away - BUT would supply an extra pillow - so child couls sleep on the floor!!!!! How much work could it have taken to bring a roll away bed to room??? I will not use this hotel again - as I have much better luck with Marriott . Also - to get to lobby - you have to walk trhough a buffett line . Never again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent buffet”
Reviews.Author: phillirit
Reviews.Content: again no previous booking upon checking in asked for any packages the staff offered room plus tickets to universal good value pay for everything at this hotel, aggressive for tips. nothing to complain about with this hotel we stayed one night, We squeezed in a private city tour in town car for 198.00 including tip the concierge offered us when we asked about city tours it lasted about 5 hours dont waste to much time at one place the driver showed us everything we wanted to see here in LA. Walk to universal studios.Friendly bar staff nice buffet dinner,

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: arizonamom32
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to meet family and visit Universal Studios Hollywood and stayed for two nights. Since we are Hilton Gold members we convinced the family members we were meeting to book their rooms here as well and subsequently spent the entire trip apologizing for the poor quality of the hotel. We arrived at the same time and while we were assigned a higher floor as is listed as a preference in our Hilton profile, when we gave our room number to our extended family at the front desk when they were checking in the front desk made absolutely no effort to look for rooms on the same floor. I understand that people may join a rewards/loyalty program for "special treatment," but quite frankly its embarrassing when that special treatment (which isnâ€™t all that special anyway) isn't extended to other members in your party. Please note that our room types were exactly the same and we paid the same rate. Upon inspection of our room, I found an orange slice on the floor by the windows. It was gross, but I wrote it off as a simple mistake, grabbed a Kleenex and threw it away myself so my two year old wouldn't decide to make a snack of it. Later that evening after I took off my shoes I discovered a nasty, crust spot on the carpet in front of the TV where something had been spilled and the carpet needed to be cleaned. The last straw was the next morning when looking for a pair of shoes under the bed and we discovered an opened maxi-pad under one bed and the remainder of an orange wrapped in a paper towel under the other. We asked to change rooms and were assigned a slightly smaller room on a lower floor and we had to re-pack all of our stuff and re-tip the bellman to help us move our luggage. The hotel made no further attempt to apologize for the inconvenience. Additionally, after I moved the luggage and went back to the first room to check for anything that I might have missed before turning in the old room key, I found that the staff had already "cleaned" the room including taking out the trash, restocking the toiletries, and rearranging the hotel literature placed on the desk and nightstand. Please note that I had only been out of the room for the time it took to get our bags off the luggage cart and ride the elevator back to the floor. I don't think that the staff intended to make any special effort to further clean the room (especially the carpet) before assigning it to new guests even though we'd complained about it. I later found out the our extended family members (who'd stayed at this hotel upon our recommendation of the Hilton brand) were stuck in room where the heating unit was not functioning (it was blowing cold air instead of hot) and they'd had to have a hotel maintenance man come in to fix it after freezing in their beds the entire first night of our stay. I was embarrassed to have recommended this hotel to our family and won't be staying again. Also, it was raining the morning we checked out and apparently the roof leaks. A drop of water from the ceiling hit me while walking through the main lobby and there were trash cans set up underneath the chandelier to catch the dripping water. Classy. Also, while the hotel is technically within walking distance of the Universal Studios Hollywood theme park, it is across a 6-8 lane major through-fare and slightly uphill. There is a walk-way over the street with a ramp on the Universal Studios side, but we had to carry our stroller down a fairly steep set of stairs on the other side. I recommend taking the free shuttle that the hotel provides, but the hours are strictly limited to the hours the theme park is open so you'll miss your shuttle back to the hotel if you want to stay for dinner at the Universal City Walk shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: monester209
Reviews.Content: Hotel was incredible. Service staff were incredibly friendly. Hotel is walking distance to Universal Studios. Room was immaculate with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality but nickel and dimed all the way”
Reviews.Author: Bertybign
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to this very pleasant hotel located at the top of a long hill close to universal studios. The staff are attentive and generally try hard to make you comfortable and to assist any any problems. There is a scrumptious buffet available for breakfast lunch and dinner whuch really is excellent and rooms are spacious and very comfortable with lovely views across the valley. Now the bad news: I was charged for fast (slow) internet access on a 24 hour basis using my portable pc in the room. While sitting in the restaurant for lunch I logged on using my Iphone using same name and room number. In the evenings I logged on again from the bar using a friends Ipad. At check out after 3 days I found that I was charged for three 24 hour passes per day. over 3 days this cost $80 ! I also parked my car in the self park garage coming and going several times per day and at check out found that I was charged twice per day costing $100 !

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, outdated and staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: rote29
Reviews.Content: The rooms smelled, the carpets had huge stains on them, the TV's in the rooms are about 20 years old. Hilton needs to step it up and catch up with the times. No microwave or fridge in the rooms. The only plus is walking distance to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Runner2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in March and had a fabulous time! The service was excellent and my room was great. The staff greeted me by name and were helpful with my questions. The hotel had a great vibe and is a good location to Universal. If you want to explore LA, the Metro is available at the bottom of the hill. I did not have a car while in LA and had no problem getting around. I highly reccomend taking the Super Shuttle to get back and forth from the airport. Much cheaper than a taxi or car service. If I am back in the LA area, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Very nice”
Reviews.Author: bob3660
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a regular room on the 18th floor. It was reasonably spacious, nice appointments and the bed was very comfortable. And for being on the 18th floor, the water pressure was magnificent. It had a tub/shower combination and the shower head was magnificent. One thing that caught us off-guard though, was that there were NO vending machines of any kind on any of the floors. If you wanted a soda or some munchies, you had to go down to the gift shop on the lobby floor, and there was no refrigerator in the room. Bottled water WAS available in the room for $5.00 though! There of course was a mini bar in the room, but we didn't even open it! The service was very good and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful - they couldn't do enough to make your stay enjoyable. Overall though, I'd have to give them an excellent rating. Overall though, I'd have to say that it was value for the dollar, with the exception of their over-rated buffet, but that's a completely separate review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikki721
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and rooms are very clean. The hotel staff was wonderful, from the minute you check-in to the minute you check out..The staff is extremely friendly. Had some food in the bar and it was ok. The coffee shop is not good at all. The hotel is baout 15 minutes from West Hollywood and 10 minutes from Warner bros. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great”
Reviews.Author: ugogirl07
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, rooms very clean and modern. Room not completely sound proof, could hear someone next door to our room coughing. The hotel staff was wonderful, however, concierge mixed up a few of our schedules. It was disappointing to find out friends were given a lower price for their room than what we paid. In general, the stay was great, the staff extremely friendly. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and easy walk to universal”
Reviews.Author: Poobis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with three kids (15,12 6) so we could visit Universal Studios. Picked it based on previous reviews of walking distance to front gate. About a 10 minute walk even for my 6 year old. Room was clean (eve nsmelled clean) and roomy with comfy beds. Very quiet and hardly heard anybody else on our floor! The only down side was the food. Restaraunts are geared more to adults and not a typical kid. The bonus was citywalk is right there so able to have many choices from fast food to more sit down type nicer places. Hotel does offer a shuttle to universal also. Was well worth the money and priced comparable to other hotels that were in the neighborhood but this one being the "closest". Is daily hotel parking fee too.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: centralcoastmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our son and friend to Universal Studios for the holiday weekend. I stayed at this hotel years ago. We found the hotel to be very clean and friendly. The distance to the park was a short trip across the street. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: etabe
Reviews.Content: Nice Business Hotel, efficient, clean but no character. however you don't tend to need character when you are just about to catch a flight, which is what this hotel is meant for. They have the added bonus of having a hertz rental drop-off point which is extremely handy if you use them. Staff are friendly and you won't be waiting long to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: bnsilly
Reviews.Content: Ok..so we took a spur of the moment trip to LA for the premiere of a movie (Never Say Never-Justin Bieber). It was 3 moms and our teen daughters. We flew from Dallas to LAX. My sister lives in Cali so my daughter and I have been before, but the others had not. My sister lives about 1 1/2 hrs from LA so we decided since it was a short trip (3 days) that we wanted to be close to the touristy stuff so we stayed at the Hilton Universal City. The location couldn't have been better. We were not far from anything. We went to the Staples Center, Santa Monica Pier, Hollywood & Highland for the Walk of Fame and all that stuff. It was great being so close to everything. There is also the Universal City Walk right across the drive from the hotel. It is an area where they have restaurants, shops, entertainment in a walkable little area. It is really nice and fun. The hotel itself is great. We had a great view of the hills which was nice..The room was really good sized and had an amazing honor bar with all kinds of soft drinks, water, liquor and also a HUGE assortment of snacks. Loved it. The beds were super comfortable with great bedding. That is a biggie for me. I like beds with bedding that is super thick and cozy. There was also a Starbucks in the hotel which was nice and also a really nice lobby and restaurant..but we never ate at the restaurant. Because we were running crazy busy all day we usually ended up ordering room service late each evening and it was always delicious with great service. Seriously, I think we ordered it every night..yum! There was a charge for parking. Something like $12 for self or $18 for valet. One thing to note is that my daughter has an IPOD touch and she used the wifi on it..which they charge for per day. But everytime she signed out and signed back in, it would charge us again. The were very nice about fixing the charge, but just be aware of it. They also charged for use of the computer in the business center. I loved this hotel though and the location was amazing.. Would definitely stay here again, and plan to this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Universal NEVER disappoints!!”
Reviews.Author: cynsmith61
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my son and I have stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles/Universal City Hotel and we LOVE it!! They treat you well from the minute you arrive to the minute you leave. The front desk staff are ALWAYS courteous and helpful. The bell staff are informative, nice, and ALWAYS very sweet!! The valet service is the BEST I have ever experience, the are quick, attentive and ALWAYS ask if you would like bottled water for your day or if you need any directions. AMAZING!! We have stayed in Beverly Hills and not exprienced this high level of service. The hotel is beautiful and truly in one of the best locations we have found and we travel to LA quite often. It is close to Warner Bros Studios which, by the way, offers one of THE BEST studio tours in Burbank/Hollywood!! We had a view of the studios and the WB water tower from our room!! As well as Universal Studios and the magnificent Hollywood Hills. My husband and I are travelling to Los Angeles to celebrate my 50th (yikes!!) birthday in August and YES we are staying at the Hilton Los Angeles/Universal. Trust me fellow Trip Advisor Members, I would never steer you in the wrong direction!! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, right across the road from universal . found it a bit on the pricey side but i guess you pay for loca”
Reviews.Author: wendyrCanada
Reviews.Content: awesome location. within walking distance to universal. really enjoyed that. rooms where nice but a little on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and service. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: sabreena0303
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my hubby back in May 10. After a 16 hour flight from Sydney, a 3 hour wait in customs, and being ripped off by the cab driver (he took $100 for a $77 cab ride, he didnt ask if we wanted any change!), we were exhausted and annoyed when we arrived at the hotel. But our mood changed with the great service from arrival, the front desk was always helpful, room service was great and so was the travel desk. The king room was clean, spacious and the bed was soooo comfortable. We had the buffet breakfast one morning. I think it was a little dear but well worth the money. The location was great too with a free shuttle running from the hotel to universal studios and to grauman's chinese theatre. This definitely made it easier to get around. The travel desk even arranged us on the airport shuttle which was only $20 per person. I think the only downside was that the outdoor spa was too cold. Really would have been more enjoyable if it were a few degrees warmer. Overall, impressive and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “They do a nice job, but a major makeover should be in the works...I hope”
Reviews.Author: Viking94708
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel, probably worthy of the 4 star rating that most reviewers give them. PROS: Outstanding location, better than the Sheraton a block away Food options are good Rooms are large and spacious Hilton VIP's get nice treatment CONS: This year has got to be the one of a major facelift No shuttle to anywhere like the metro stop or City Walk Rooms need some TLC in 2011

Reviews.Title: “easy stay for Universal studios”
Reviews.Author: theredcentre
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was comfortable, standard large hotel with all the comforts of a big hilton hotel. Older style, but comfortable rooms and nice pool area. Very easy walk to Universal and the freehotel shuttle comes regularly. The breakfast buffet had an excellent choice and was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Miarocls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a concert at the Gibson. Disappointed in the lack of amenities/value for price paid. Had a better experience at a Best Western in Coalinga , CA (cow country) last weekend- at least there I had free parking, free Wi-Fi, and a free FULL hot breakfast. Received none of the above at the Hilton. $8/ day for Internet? Â What MOTEL doesn't include this in their rate anymore? Â $18 to SELF-PARK my car? Â Gouge Universal Citywalk tourists, not paying hotel guests! Â Ice machine non-functional, had to go to another floor to get ice. Room Â freshener/Febreze overpowering, had to prop room door upon arrival, not exactly a secure feeling for women travelers. Â Only 3 Kleenex before they ran out in the bathroom. Â Bottled water/soda vending unavailable. Next time I'll try the Sheraton nearby, hopefully their standard of service is higher.Â

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel within walking distance to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times on business as Diamond member. I almost always get upgraded to a corner alcove room on a high floor over looking Universal Studios Park. I always get a fruit/candy basket with coupons for a continental breakfast and appetizer. I love the convenient location of this hotel. The Sheraton Universal is my close second choice adjacent to the Hilton down the Hitlon within an easy 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of a CA trip with the intention of going to Universal Studios for the day and heading out early the next morning to Burbank airport. The hotel lobby is attractive and the self-parking underground could not have been more convenient. The room we booked was great and had a wonderful view. Of course, the room was rather pricey, also. We were able to check-in mid-morning as our room was ready, which was great. Our plan was to go to Universal for the day, explore City Walk afterwards as well as having dinner and return to the hotel on the last scheduled shuttle at 8 pm. We were, however, told by the front desk staff that since the hotel had few guests the shuttle's last run back to the hotel would be at 4:30pm and we were told by the shuttle driver the same time, except he said it was due to it being a holiday. This was a major disappointment for us and really limited our time at the partk and City Walk. I would not have stayed here had I known that. Walking back up the hill to the hotel at night was not an option. We had been staying at an LA hotel that was just as nice as this one and had a great special. In hindsight, we should have stayed there and driven to Universal Studios. SInce we didn't want to venture out we ate in the hotel restaurant (something I try to avoid except for breakfast). The food was fair, the prices high and the service mediocre..

Reviews.Title: “Nice way to greet the New Year”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler25
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and our corner room offered a great view of the city. Very large and comfortable room and bath. Evening buffets very absolutely fabulous. Ezra, bartender, was quite nice and knew how to mix superb Martinis. And my Horned Frogs won the Rose Bowl!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the snacks/pop in the fridge!”
Reviews.Author: Red68truck
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice as well as the staff. I ran out of diet coke and decided to spend the money for an overpriced one in the fridge in the room. I opened it and took a drink and it didn't taste right, so I checked the date on the bottom to find it had expired months previous, not weeks, but months. After alerting the front desk and taking it down to them, they said they would take it off the bill, but they decided to still charge me for it! I checked a friends room, and the product in the fridge was only expired by only a couple months. Beware of these items, they are overpriced and many times will expire due to the time they sit there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TheButcherBunch
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived we tried to get late checkout but were told we couldn't do this til the day we were leaving. When that day came they said we couldn't as there was a wedding on and all the people were staying on that floor, as if they didn't no this before. We arrived quarter to 12 at night checking in was easy, we went to our rooms and crashed. Next morning we were awoken with the waiter bringing us breakfast, silly us just been woken up thought it was complimentary as we didn't order it nothing was even mentioned. Later we found out it wasn't free they thought we had ordered it??? Sounds sneaky to me. One day we came back to our rooms and on leaving the elevator we saw and smelt this awful vomit on the carpet floor. We went to our room and I immediately rang the front desk to report this. Next morning the whole floor stunk so bad I saw someone vaccuming the vomit I was glad to be leaving. Surely they could have attended to this the night before. Rooms were okay stains on the floor nothing special, bathroom was very tiny hardly anywhere to put toiletries. This hotel is good for Universal Studios and City Walk Shops & Restuarants otherwise you need take a town car or taxi to get anywhere and they aren't cheap. I was looking forward to staying at the Hilton as I thought it was be lush but I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, great seafood buffet, excellent location for universal studios”
Reviews.Author: Anastacia16
Reviews.Content: We chose to reside in the Hilton for a few days to avoid LA traffic when visiting Universal studios. The hotel was comfortable, affordable and within easy walking distance to the studios. We also hired a town car for a visit to the LA staple centre to see a Lakers game. The restaurant was open for meals all day and this is great when traveling with teenagers. It was quite at night and the beds were comfortable. Its also great for a visit to the universal city walk where you can eat, catch a movie, enjoy comedy and buy souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 Hotel if you are going to Universal Studios!”
Reviews.Author: nrf
Reviews.Content: I heard mixed reviews about the hotel, but it is very nice. I have stayed in first class hotels many times and this one falls way short of that, but the price and location can't be beat. Staff greeted us warmly upon check-in, there was a free mini-buffet in the evenings at the bar, rooms were clean and ready when we arrived and there was always someone there to push the elevator button for you! The hotel was not overly large, allowing a nice feeling. Also, if you want to go to Universal Studios, you can just walk there (or take their shuttle - but remember the shuttle does not leave until 10:00 am and the park opens at 9:00. There were many people waiting outside before 9 am for the shuttle and apparently did not know.) We walked and were there in 10 minutes. Perfect for coming and going from the park!

Reviews.Title: “Great Locasion for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location. Nice rooms. Free shuttle to Universal Studios. You can also take a paid shuttle ($29) from LAX to avoid the $88 taxi bill. You could also take the metro. A bit expensive to park. Also they have me breakfast vouchers for my gold status but that was for continental breakfast only and I had to pay $10 pp to upgrade to full breakfast. Nice view if you get a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,watch your room charges”
Reviews.Author: mom22chihua
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here.The location is great for visiting Universal studios.The room was nice.The bed was comfortable.The negatives was the the front desk supervisor came across as snobby and condescending.We had two rooms and parked one car.Charged for parking on both rooms.The room service was good, but again watch your charges! At check out there were many people at the desk with similiar charges issues ,as well as missing items.One guest complained of their credit card missing.We never had any problems with that.There is a safe to place valuables in.I probably would hesitate to stay here again based on the rudeness at the front desk.. I cannot understand why service oriented businesses employee rude,snobby people in front desk, (first impression) positions. Parking is 17.00 a day ,also a negative!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: pjauk
Reviews.Content: Located almost on site to Universal Studios and Walk and its stores. Taxi from LAX c $90-100 but the shuttles are chaeper but may take longer. In Theory, you could do it by subway if limited luggage is your - the subway is just at the bottom of the hill (10 min walk) Weekends feel very different to weekdays due to families/visitors for the Studios. Bit out of the way if not visiting Universal or local Burbank area.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IF VISITING UNIVERSAL STUDIOS”
Reviews.Author: Bambini08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 4 nights with my husband and son, mainly to visit universal studios. We are Hilton Honor members and this was one of the most professional and efficient Hiltons we have ever stayed in. Check in was fast, the man at the desk gave us all the information in regards to the hotel we needed for our stay, he then walked us to the elevators and sent us on our way to our room on the executive level. The room had a great view of Universal Studios, it was very clean with everything we needed. Each afternoon we would receive a tray of fresh fruit, cookies, chocolates, cake and bottled water..WOW WHAT A TREAT. Walking to Universal is pretty easy once you do it for the first time, if you dont like to walk (approx 10 mins) the hotel has a free shuttle bus. The pool was great, very relaxing, on nice lawns, and a big hot tub, tucked away for privacy. We ate at the buffet a few times, great value for money and again excellent service (the chef noticed my son looking through all the peaches..they were not ripe, so chef went out back and came back with 3 ripe ones just for him). Hilton Universal is amazing, I will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's it”
Reviews.Author: PhiloftheTropics
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days before heading home and really only picked it as it was close to Universal Studios. The hotel was built in 1983 and I don't think anything has been upgraded since. It looks very old and tired. They still have old CRT TVs in huge ugly cabinets. The first room we had the bed was broken so that you kept sliding to the side as you tried to sleep. Then what ever was broken, would squeak and clang whenever you made the slightest movement. We complained the next day and they moved us to another room. The rooms weren't very clean, lots of hair in the bathrooms, dusty and very grubby windows and curtains. The first room we had still had a dirty towel hanging on the back of the bathroom door when we checked in. The freeway noise was only a humm in the background but you could here lots of noise from the surrounding rooms. The house keepers seemed to work in pairs and were extremely noisy almost yelling at each other in spanish. We tried to have an afternoon nap before flying home late at night, but they put an end to that. The bar/lounge area in the foyer was closed more than it was open and the restaurant only seemed to do buffets, we were there over thanksgiving so maybe it was something to do with that. They also had private functions on when we were staying and these people would use all the seating in the reception area which meant we had to stand around waiting for shuttles, taxis etc. I thought this was very poor treatment for paying guests. It's about a 5 minute walk to Universal studios and City Walk. City Walk is the place to go for dinner. I'd only recommend this hotel if you are planning to go to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: capdmp11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions during our trip to California. Each night our accommodations were wonderful, especially the upgrade to the alcove king room we received on the last night. Beautiful room, big bathroom, wonderful view of CityWalk and hills. Each night we were given a lovely fruit plate with delicious chocolates. The only negative is that you have to pay for parking but that must be the norm in California as we were charged at each hotel but one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: 5tumpy
Reviews.Content: We had a rough start to this stay, through no fault of the hotel, we left the GPS in Australia we got lost on the way from the airport, 3 hours later, in a foreign country, straight off the plane, we were very, very stressed out! The staff were excellent, let me vent about our horror trip, and got us all checked in without any further hassel... We used the concierge desk for directions and information, and they were also fantastic... The bathroom was large and clean, the water pressure was excellent! The bed was perfect, soft yet firm, and the TV was a large LCD screen. The location was perfect for us, the Camarillo Premium outlets were a 40 min trip up the freeway away, Universal Studios were a short walk away, and well worth the visit, and the Hollywood walk of fame is a 10 min walk and one stop on the Metro away... This Hotel was everything you'd expect from a Hilton and really the bar pretty high for the other hotels we stayed at in our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, larger chain hotel, but rather outdated, and with weird computer system”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference my wife was attending, so the rate was not bad, but I would not pay the regular rate. The first room we got, upon asking for a quiet room, overlooked the Hollywood Freeway, but we were given the opportunity to switch to another room, this one facing Universal Studios. The hotel is semi-eloegant, especially in the lobby areas, but overall has an outdated feel, from the decor to the older, non-flat-screen televisions. I had requested an alcove room, and was to pay $10 extra for this, but this request seems to have gotten lost (I did pay the regular conference rate). Parking was $17 for self parking. Wi Fi was not outrageously priced (about $10), but to print, you had to jump through hoops, seemingly using a third party vendor connected with the hotel, with print jobs coming out in the business center, and there was a minimum printing charge of something like $3-4 each time you printed (best to save up any printing jobs or the cost would quickly add up). I went to the business center to print, but the process was confusing there, with the representative on duty unable to reach the support technician. We asked if we could check out a little late (we were leaving the last day of the conference but not until 4, when the conference ended; we hoped to leave about 1:30). The desk clerk on duty said no, without asking what time we wanted to leave, saying that we were there with a conference if she let us stay late, everyone would want to (another representative later said okay). The hotel is within walking distance of Universal Studios and City Walk (shops and restaurants). There is a shuttle from the hotel to Universal Studios and back, but it stopped about 5 p.m. (notmuch use for dining out at City Walk). There is a shuttle between Universal Studios and the bottom of the hill (from where you just need to cross a street to access busses and subway) but did not, as far as I could see, stop at the hotel. I found it fairly easy to take a bus to NBC Studios to see a show taping. We took the subway to briefly visit Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jadore101
Reviews.Content: Our trip to the USA started and ended in LA, we stayed at the Hilton, 4 nights then 3 nights on return so we got a good feel for the place. Hotel: The rooms were clean and above average with adequate amounts of space so I didn't feel claustrophobic and we got a view of the daily traffic outside the window. Service: We found the service was excellent, nothing was too hard for the staff at reception, the hotel managers were kind and helpful, we wanted to eat cereal in our rooms every morning (as we would be eating out for lunch and dinner daily) and we requested a little fridge as there was none other than the bar fridge which we said we did not want access to, the hotel manager had a small fridge sent up right away which was very convenient for daily milk storage. All in all very happy with the service. Breakfast: On the return trip we did have daily buffet breakfast at the hotel which was great as there was a lot of variety, you could either have the continental breakfast or the full breakfast which was based on an honesty system. Appearance: The appearance of the hotel was somewhat outdated however it was still in good order. Amenities: They even have a business center which came useful for printing documents and such things which we used to print our trip info. When we do visit LA again, I would definitely stay at this hotel again, simply because of the location, it is a 5 minute drive to the main tourist attractions (hollywood blvd), and its a 5 minute walk from the hotel to Universal City walk and Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in slow motion”
Reviews.Author: HongKongClas
Reviews.Content: This was the designated hotel for a conference (held elsewhere) that I attended. First impression of hotel was soured by division of duties / labour between people "greeting " you outside front door and bellman - apparently there's a difference in responsibilities and the former can't help arrange luggage to room. I was corrected by the former and dont really need a insincere 'have a good day" afterwards Room was large and comfortable, although rather dated decor. No complaints about quality of the bed though as I slept soundly. Good choices at buffet for breakfast. Evening meal was less successful with slow, surly service - if my drink had been "placed" any harder on the table, I think the glass would have broken Fitness centre is a depressing, dingy joke - looks as its just cobbled together from a few guest rooms. Couple of cardio machines and free weights, no facilities to stretch / cool down....not somewhere to get a thorough workout Booking a car...glacial, disinterested service and staff couldn't remember details during the conversation. Maybe the hotel works for leisure travellers but if you want anything in a hurry as a business traveller, don't bother

Reviews.Title: “Great overpricd hotel, but location cannot be matched”
Reviews.Author: Beachkidboy
Reviews.Content: I went to Universal Studios for the first time in many years and wanted a great experience so I booked the closest hotel for the day before and night after. The Hilton is basically 'on the lot' with the Sheraton Universal right next door, both are roughly a 7 minute walk, but the Hilton was cheaper. Arriving is a bit complicated with various freeway off-ramps and streets and signs guiding you where to go. I made some mistakes and had to backtrack but eventually found my my way to their self-parking ($17 a day). After parking it's a bit of a journey to wander through the complexity of the hotel to get to the front desk to check-in. I suppose if one went to the main entrance and was valet shuttled it would be easy, but also cost more. Check-in went smoothly and I was upgraded to a 'corner room' (not to hard as the rooms are in a tower, so virtually half the rooms are corner rooms) on an upper floor with a full view (as much as you can see) of the park. It was a wonderful room with a quiet digital climate control and I slept like a baby in the very comfortable bed. Lots of thick soft pillows which you don't find a lot. Suprising for a Hilton they still had a standard definition 27" CRT tv in the room. There was a bar/snack area which I didn't indulge in since they charge you quadouple what it costs. Also bottled waters were available for $5 a bottle. I also didn't indulge. The bathroom was stocked with Crabtree & Evelyn toilatries consisting of mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, soap, haircap, and shoe buffing cloth; no toothpaste/brush, shaving cream/razor. I brought my own anyways and was told these can be purchased, certainly at a huge mark-up. The hotel has a main bar/lounge and a restaurant which all seem to inter-mingle. There is a large breakfast buffet ($22) each morning and at night a Seafood & Prime Rib buffet which looked and smelled amazing, crab, scallops, turkey, prime rib, lamb, salads, etc... but at $46 I passed. I opted for room service but my order was delayed so much the lady I called 'comped' me on the meal which later arrived. If you don't want to drive once you park you are really stuck with Hilton or next door Sheraton dining, or go to CityWalk which is packed with crowds and not fun if you're by yourself. Overall, despite my criticims, it is a great hotel which takes care of your every need but it is expensive and everything keeps adding up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfectly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ggsnowwhite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were attending the taping of both Jay Leno and Lopez Tonight and couldn't have been more pleased with the choice that we made. From the moment we walked into the lobby, someone was there to direct us to the front desk. The gentlemen at the front desk was very gracious and walked us to the elevator leaving us feeling completely welcomed. Our room was an alcove room with a bank of large windows that gave us a beautiful view of the Hollywood Hills and Universal Studios. At night, the view was even more amazing! The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable with a small couch, a desk, armoire and king size bed. The bathroom was also very large and had a vanity area set apart from the sink which I loved. It was a great spot to get your make up done. The best part of this was that the location couldn't have been better. We were just a few miles away from the WB and NBC studios. We walked over to the City Walk for dinner or coffee and loved that we didn't have to deal with LA traffic! The only bad experience we had was with the "Starbucks" in the hotel. It is not an actual "Starbucks" cafe but it serves Starbucks coffee. We noticed the difference when we ate their moldy bagels which were also small and vastly overpriced. I would stay away from this Starbucks and walk over to City Walk where a real Starbucks had beautiful baked goods and reasonably priced oatmeal. Otherwise, I would gladly stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place to stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRW
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Universal Hilton a few times. It is within walking distance to Universal Studios and the hotel is wonderful. Friendly, helpful staff, great restaurant, and the rooms are super clean and comfortable. I will always stay here when in the vicinity!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton close to the valley”
Reviews.Author: Fenterspooner
Reviews.Content: I specifically chose this hotel because it was a Hilton and because of the location. I work out in the valley and normally stay in Valencia however I have come to like this hotel. It is close by the Universal City Walk (so so), and has the most excellent breakfast which if you are Hilton Gold or Diamond it is a great value. The rooms are very nice but they have old CRT style televisions which is a bummer and because of the room layouts, it can be uncomfortable to watch television from your bed. The room service was excellent and decently priced. This hotel does not have an Executive lounge anymore so instead you get vouchers for a free drink (limited) and free appetizer (again limited to specific ones) in the lobby bar. The ones they provide for "free" are not that good and I have found I no longer use these. I don't know why they don't just let you pick an appetizer from the menu instead of giving you the absolute cheapest/crappiest ones. I'm not sure if I will continue to stay here as the nightly rate with additional parking is only a so/so value in my opinion. It's a very nice hotel if you are going to Universal Studios or attending a conference in the very large conference center that is attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kat091
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! Very friendly and helpful customer service at the front desk. I stayed in a very clean suite that had amazing views of LA, universal studios and the citywalk. I would have liked to have spent more time in their wonderful pool and jacuzzi (the outdoor bar was also very welcome!). The only drawback was the in-room dining. The service itself was very prompt, but the food was not quite up-to standards. A part from this minor detail, it was a very enjoyable and relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great experience at the Universal Hilton, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: phoenikia
Reviews.Content: Courteous doorstaff greeted me when my cab arrived. I only stayed one night, and was pleased that I was able to check-in early, at 1 pm. I wish I had had more time to use the beautiful pool. My room was beautiful. It was on the 15th floor, with a great view, a king size bed, and a bathroom that was larger than some hotel rooms I've visited. Small vanity area, with a seat, as well as a large sink area, great shower. The King size bed was very comforatable. Room and bathroom were spotless. The nicest surprise for me was a platter with bananas, an apple, a tangerine, a candy apple and chocolate that I found when I returned to the room after the event I attended. Maybe I just lucked out? It made a nice impression, and I was especially grateful since I happened to be hungry when I got home from the event. This hotel was a great value. The hotel is convenient to US 101, but I probably wouldn't use it as a base, unless I had a car. The hotel is a $35 taxi to the Grove or Beverly Hills. That being said, the staff were very friendly. One of the doormen, Conrad, was especially courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lyn1981
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton Universal City was a fantastic get away in the perfect location! You can't get any closer to Universal Studios/City Walk and it was a great home base to see the taping of a couple of TV shows. The service was great - the people we dealt with were very helpful and kind. They did their best to accommodate our special requests and needs. The rooms are clean and well decorated and set up - no scratchy floral bed spreads here! The views from this hotel are spectacular from higher floors. Our room was low down so we didn't have a sweeping view, but it was still nice! Although we went just the two of us, we would feel confident and comfortable bringing kids here as well! We had a great time and we would highly recommend staying here! We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great week at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy52
Reviews.Content: Due to a busy conference schedule, we had room service for most of our meals. The service was very good and the food was excellent. Our room had a beautiful semi- panoramic view. We stayed a week and were pleasantly surprised with 2 complimentary platters of treats. The hotel staff was helpful, friendly and efficient. Hotel parking is somewhat expensive, but not surprising, as the location is so convenient to many activities. We watched the exciting fire and water ride at Universal Studios, from above, out our window. A quick walk takes you to City Walk which has several shops and restaurants and 'street' entertainment. The hotel offers some shuttle service as well, but we did not use it. Allow extra time for LA traffic though. We nearly missed our plane home.

Reviews.Title: “Well suited for our trip”
Reviews.Author: WalesHolscrazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with day in between spent at Universal Studios. Spacious rooms on 12th floor, huge comfortable bed & pillows, tray of fruit & chocolates a nice touch. No problems with check-in although booking made via internet 7 months in advance. LA was experiencing a spot of cool weather so on arrival we felt quite cold as the air con was still on. Booked b & b - breakfast was fine, plenty of choice, which set us up for our visit to US, at the bottom of the hill which we accessed by shuttle. Before travelling we considered the front of line pass but decided to take pot luck - glad not to have spent the extra as the longest wait for rides & shows was 20mins. Not being a ride person I was bag minder while the others did their thing -they enjoyed all but apparently The Mummy is very fast & jurassic Park very wet. The longest queue was for the studio tour 30 - 40mins but well worth it. King Kong in 360 3D is amazing, also the War of the Worlds set. We spent the late afternoon watching The Terminator show, the hype before the show is boring but necessary if you haven't seen the films. The 3D special effects, again, are unbelieveable. We last visited US in 1992 & we enjoyed it again this time, so did our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Internationalflyer
Reviews.Content: I believe they should downgrade this hotel from hilton to a lower level hotel of the hilton family. This hotel is old! And not good old. For instance elevators were not working when we arrived, we had to take the service elevator. When we asked the staff about it, they said that elevators are always a problem there, and apparently the owner wouldn't pay for its modernization. At the room TVs are old small Tube TVs, something you can expect at a motel or hostel. I usually choose Hilton because you can't be wrong with it. But not at this one. I rather stay at a 2 or 3 star new hotel then heading to this Hilton again. Pay attention if there's an event going on Universal at night you may find it difficult to get back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying here in October”
Reviews.Author: Ellie0094
Reviews.Content: If you go in October you will fight the Halloween Nights traffic. It took us over 1 hr to travel what should take 15 min. We overheard another guest in tears as he was in traffic for 3 hrs. We couldn't leave the following night because we didn't want to risk being stuck in the closed access roads to the hotel. Hotel staff was less than helpful. They need to put signs up in the lobby or send out a paper notifying guests of the road closures, best alternate routes and best travel times. It ruined our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: pickmeup56
Reviews.Content: I didn't pay for the hotel because it was for a business meeting but I absolutely loved it! the staff where very accommodating and nice. I will return for a romantic date with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: aunger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week during a family vacation in Los Angeles - and we loved it. The hotel is located a walking distance from Universal and CityWalk with their many attractions (There's also a shuttle which runs every 15 minutes between the hotel and CityWalk). The rooms are very comfortable, modern and clean. The view from the room was amazing. The only issue we had was some unidentified background noise, which the hotel staff couldn't shut down (actually, I didn't get the impression they invested real efforts in trying to solve this problem...)

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: whitepele
Reviews.Content: had three relaxing days here at end of family trip to naheim/vegas and found the room and view from it excellent, staff at the bar and the pool were very friendly and efficent

Reviews.Title: “okay, nice room and people.”
Reviews.Author: docgresh
Reviews.Content: Do NOT come here on a weekend in october unless you can fly on a broom. I had a reservation but could not get near the hotel. After trying and being locked in traffic for 1.5 hours, I finally called and asked to move to another hilton. They finally let me without a penalty because I was hilton honors. After the halloween thing was over, it became reasonable place. I stayed here because it was near my son's house. This is best for families who want to tour the universla studio. No spa nor any spa services nearby. Pool looked nice but it was cold and rainy when i was here. Mostly families and people here for conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in Service”
Reviews.Author: Pink1004
Reviews.Content: When I decided to stay at the Hilton near Universal Studios, I thought I had hit a jackpot. It was within walking distance to the park so after spending a long and tiring day, I could quickly return to my hotel for some much needed rest. What I didn't know is that their "Halloween Horror Nights", which is a huge annual event every year, was opening that night. The issue here is that traffic is a nightmare going to and from the hotel with no special accommodations for guests who rent cars and are NOT attending the evening event. Streets surrounding the hotel are blocked for buses who are transporting the THOUSANDS of people parking in surrounding areas. For a drive that should have taken 10 minutes, took me over an hour. When I brought my concerns to the front desk clerk's attention, they were nothing but underwhelmed at my frustration simply saying that there was nothing they could do nor could they offer solutions as to the best way to enter and exit the hotel. The ONLY reason I did not cancel my reservations was because i was locked in through hotels.com. When checking out on my last day, I was at a computer kiosk to print out my boarding pass but had computer issues. When I asked the front desk clerk to help, she seemed put off, annoyed and just generally not willing to help. I had to ask someone who didn't work for the Hilton but arranged travel accommodations to help. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBertie
Reviews.Content: A reliable, dependable choice in a convenient location just a walk away from the Universal Studios theme park and a 10-15 minute drive from other major attractions such as the Getty Museum, Griffith Park, Hollywood and downtown LA. A short walk from the hotel and you have the clean and reliable metro red line train service as well. The only slight criticism would be that the 1980s decor could probably do with a revamp and charges for using the business centre internet were a little steep. One of the great joys of staying here is sitting poolside sipping a Margarita on a warm, mellow LA afternoon - something I could get used to doing on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: sbrita
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. Its great for the business traveler. The hotel is big - something like 20 floors. Its right on the universal studio block. As I was traveling for business, the proximity to this was not meaningful. I had one of the corner rooms. The room was very nice - large enough to feel roomy but not huge. Due to the corner shape, the bathroom was very big and well appointed. Best things: - Food: I ordered room service as I got back late. The food is reasonably priced as is very good. I'm from NY and have and Fra Divalo before, but this was great. - Service: very polite staff. Everyone says hello. One odd encounter, during a busy spot at the bar, the bartender got into an argument with one of the waiters who came back behind the bar to get a drink. Strange they argued in front of several people sitting at the bar - Gym: for a hotel gym, this one was pretty good. About 6 treadmills, some dumbell free weights and a few pre-core machines. - Room/Bed: bed was very very comfotable Cons: - Location: if you plan to go to Santa Monica or downtown LA, prepare yourself for traffic traffic traffic. My commute was 12 miles and took me more than an hour to get from the hotel to Santa Monica. - Neighborhood: you can walk down the hill and see what is round the Universal Studio area. I didn't bother as it looked like at least a 10-15 walk to find anything interesting. Once your are at the hotel, you are there. If I had more time, I may have explored more, but this hotel is definitely not curb side to anything close. - $7.95 internet: its 2010 . . . it always bugs me when hotels charge for internet service. At $199/night, that should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent selection for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Martini 425
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just two nights with hubby and 14 year old son. Reason for selection was to visit Universal Studios and other area attractions. Excellent overall, quick HHonors separate check in area. Standard 2 double room. Very clean, very comfortable. About a 5 minute walk to Univesal/City Center - absolutely convenient. Valet parking a bit pricey at hotel, however, any time you needed your car it was brought around in just a few short minutes. Did not eat at the hotel, but did browse the Seafood Buffet. Looked really, really awesome and would absolutely have partook if time allowed. Take a walk over to Pink's Hot Dogs (was SOOO happy they just added one) at City Center. Trust me, best dog's you have ever had. Try the Mulholland Drive Dog. My favorite. About 20 minutes from Venice Beach, which my son just loved. You have to see it to believe it! Would stay again, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed from the 15 to 17 September, very...”
Reviews.Author: go_soward
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 15 to 17 September, very impressed with the room. Easy walking distance to universal studios. Short drive to hollywood bvd. 7.95 per access wifi was disappointing, but overall would Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Mozart59
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel interior is dated by 2010 standards our 48 hour stay was pretty good. The location re proximity to Universal Studios is brilliant.. We arrived from Australia at 10:30am. Check in immediately (no waiting) and our room was ready! A stroke of good luck for us. The room was modest in size with 2 double beds my only complaint as we were on the premium floors. it included a generous continental breakfast. The pool area was gorgeous. Again modest but well maintained with a beautiful garden, lawn, and cabanas. For our brief visit it was quite good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MatsiNacka
Reviews.Content: Execellent service, really nice rooms. Walking distance from Universal Studios. Nice pool area. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Star Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Zanyzenny
Reviews.Content: I rarely stay at what I consider a nice hotel. Usually because I'm not there very long, but the Universal Hilton really had me spinning and in a good way. They made me feel VIP. The location is great for walking over to Universal Studios and the pool area I'll be dreaming about for weeks to come. It was a nice end to a long summer. I hope to have many more experiences from the Hilton from now on, I'm hooked. They're Sat night buffet was pricey, but if you love seafood its the place to be. Make sure to check out the menu because if you don't like most of the selection its not worth it. I wish I could have also tried the bruch buffet. Room service was great and fast!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ....review for a reward stay”
Reviews.Author: FordTraveller
Reviews.Content: On my Pacific Coast vacation with my 2 teen boys (16 and 17), we drove from LV to LA. I had a lot of free nights with Hilton (up to category 7 hotels) and was looking for a very nice hotel to stay. I passed on Beverley Hilton as it did not have rooms with 2 beds. I settled on Hilton Universal City, and I was very glad that I did. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly during our check in and remained so for our entire stay. When we got into our room, the room was smokey and the staff found out another room with the same view (hills and the Universal studios). They ensured that I was able to change my myWay Hilton preferences to get free internet during my stay. I was welcomed with a place of fruits which was delightful. The front desk staff, Robin was very helpful in getting us the mini bananas which my younger son loved. They gave me free breakfast for all of us (when usually it is only free for 2 people), and I also received free appetizers at dinner. Yes I had to pay for parking but there isn't a hotel that has free parking along the Pacific Coast. We got the universal pass from the hotel and we got a free second day visit. My teens thoroughly enjoyed the stay. We walked to universal and again the next day (although we were leaving the same day). I would DEFINITELY stay here again the next time I am in LA. What great staff, service and a lovely property. Thank you Hilton for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Jame69
Reviews.Content: As many previous reviews, the location of the hotel is great. I stayed 3 nights here. The room I had stayed was very clean, modern with comfortable bed. The bathroom was large. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Everything was good overall and met my exprectation.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a Hotel that will meet your every need, look no further.”
Reviews.Author: GlennEpps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on our trip to California and they went our of the way to make our stay one to remember. First our room had an air conditioner problem they tried to fix it but we had to move, they send a bellman up an moved us right away. Then they had a fresh fruit tray in our room that night when we returned and a note saying they were sorry we had a problem. The thing that impressed me the most, and I travel for business several weeks a year, was how friendly EVERYONE was, and I mean the guy driving the shuttle gave us a coupon for Bubba Gump Shrimp, the resturant was over the top in service, the front desk would ask as we walked bu was everything fine and could they do anything for us, the valet parking never took more than 5 minutes and this hotel is across the street from Universal Studios. The Starbucks coffee in the morning and this hotel is super quite and is only 20 minutes to the beach in Malibu. We will stay here every time we are in the area and you should too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: powellfamily2010
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great place for a family visit. Hotel is very clean and attractive. Pool area is secure and spacious. Universal boardwalk is minutes away and an easy and safe walk even at night. Subway to hollywood quick and easy. Transportation offered by beckter enterprises via the hotel. Completely reliable, safe and helpful in putting itineries together. Cheaper to be chauffered around than hiring a car for our group and a lot less stress thsn driving and parking in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Grassy23
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in a great location for Universal Studios. Generally the hotel could not be faulted. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Universal Studios but not for anything else.”
Reviews.Author: Italianprincess85
Reviews.Content: First stay here if you are only interested in going to Universal Studios and City Walk. If you want to see other places in Los Angeles/Hollywood then go somewhere else. We booked the hotel because it is a Hilton and did want to visit Universal but we also wanted to see Hollywood, Beverly Hills, take a walk etc. It was a hassle to get anywhere else from this Hilton, yes there is public transportation which we did use but to get to the Metro station you either have to take 2 shuttle buses or walk and then get on the Metro to Hollywood and Highland. Thankfully we got our rental car on Friday (we arrived on Wednesday) and drove ourselves around to visit Santa Monica, Beverly Hills etc. The hotel is spotless and the staff is very friendly and ready to help with anything. We did eat at the buffet a couple of times. My husband loved it because of all the sushi/shashimi they had but I am not fond of that so I found the buffet to be just mediocre at best. In my opinion I have been to better buffets for less money. There was also a huge religious group staying there while we were there and they became very annoying. Apparently it was some kind of convention for them and I am all for freedom of religion (I am Roman Catholic and go to church regularly and pray) but these people are in your face about believing the way they do and preaching the bible while you are waiting on line for coffee or inviting you to services in the elevator and if you say no they again start preaching. We couldn't wait to leave because it made it very stressful because we didn't want to be rude to them but they just wouldn't stop. Our room was nice but the TV is very far from the bed and old which made it hard to see (we wanted to watch the news shows). I was disappointed that we didn't receive the welcome basket that everyone talks about but didn't complain about it, maybe I should have. All in all we had a good time at Universal Studios and enjoyed ourselves more after we got our car but we wouldn't stay at this Hilton again mainly because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for families”
Reviews.Author: seeg64
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at Universal City is a weird combination of great and not so great. The rooms although a little dated where very big and comfortable, with great lighting. Very clean and comfy beds. The restaurant is ok but the buffet is way over priced, and do not be taken by the glitz of the all you can eat seafood buffet. The food was not that good and unless you eat a huge amount of food the $44.00 price tag is not a great value. The Seafood at Bubba Gumps on City Walk was much better. Just a few minutes walk to Universal and the City Walk. The City Walk offers food, entertainment, and shopping. It is a fun way to end the day. The true shinning stars of this hotel are the Bell Service Desk staff. These men and woman are friendly and happy to share their knowledge of LA. The helped us steer clear of traffic and had great suggestions for "local" restaurants, shopping , etc.. The concierge is fine for buying tickets and setting up tours but it is the Bell Service that is really in the know. This is a big busy hotel that offers a comfortable, clean, roomy place to come back to after a day out seeing the sights of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: RGYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Located 10 minutes walk from Universal Studios and City Walk this Hilton is in an ideal location for visiting this part of LA (there is even a shuttle bus to Universal for those who find the walk too difficult!). The Hilton is also about 10 minutes from a metro station - convenient to take you to Hollywood Boulevard. However, the hotel is about a 45 minute to 1 hour drive from Los Angeles International airport (although Bob Hope / Burbank airoport is a lot closer). There is plenty of car-parking on site but there is a daily charge of $17. Check-in was efficient but not effusive. Rooms are large and well equipped with a good writing desk and tea/coffee making facilities. Overall whilst the bedroom was comfortable it was beginning to show some signs of age. The one downside of the accommodation was the long wait for the lift (although there appeared to quite a number of them). During our stay there appeared to be wedding receptions each day (as well as a number of conferences). Our sleep was disturbed one night by the constant banging of bedroom doors but this was dealt with by hotel security. There is a large restaurant and a small coffee bar (selling Starbucks) and also a large bar with friendly and efficient service. Overall this Hilton provided us with a comfortable room and, most importantly, the ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful! Must stay here if in L.A Area!”
Reviews.Author: luisvoguecolon
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel deserves 4 stars and I'm happy that before I even wrote this review I could agree with most people (1) THE VIEW: This alone is worth the price if you get a high view; On My first stay back in August of 2009 I received a room on the 22nd floor with a nice breathtaking view of the Hills; i must say I felt quite "fab" as most of my friends would say. My second time (Earlier this month which is why I'm writing this) the view was of Studio City and a large amount of California as it seems because I could see beyond the horizon (My Gosh) (2) THE CLEANLINESS: I normally do not write about cleanliness because its normally at least a little to average of what I expect. This Hilton property is CLEAN! Everything is completely clean and fresh for you! They even supply you with bath robes and extra towels that make you feel amazing. The Decor was a tiny bit outdated but still looked new which I liked. (Its like having a clean looking jukebox from the 50's) (3) AMENITIES: The Hotel has an amazing pool and jacuzzi with bar outside that honestly made me want to just stay all day ( but we eventually had to go which was sad ) There were a lot of families but this is typical because you are right next to Universal so its fine. I mean come on...we were all kids at some point in our lives. Also the Hotel has a cozy bar and restaurant which I liked and quick coffee with their version of starbucks. (4) OTHER: The Service was very good and i found it easy to communicate at check in and with the maid. Overall everybody was pretty real; I even had a chat with the maid about California and what her life was like (I know unnecessary but interesting) She was actually pretty nice. (5) WHY NOT 5 STARS? AND JUST 4? Well 4 is pretty amazing but 5 has to be superb. 5 I would place on that perfect hotel which I am waiting to see. This hotel charges 17.99 for parking and 22.99 for Valet. I found this quite ridiculous and this is the reason why i did not give this property 5 stars. Why should a hotel guest have to pay to park at somewhere where they are already paying for other services? Also, The Internet was 9.95 a day in 2009 and when was came back earlier this month it was 4.95 a day which I was happy to see. Other hilton Owned Properties manage to give away free internet and survive and thrive, What is the problem here?I know, cheap but come on, Your a hotel guest! Get treated like Gold! Thanks For Reading! - Luis (Photos of View Attached)

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: dbs1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in August, 2010. Great location for Universal and Hollywood. Nice pool, good service, breakfast in hotel restaurant was good. LA traffic is a nightmare at all hours which makes you want to stay close to the hotel and stick to the citywalk. Also, Miceli's restaurant, a few minutes from the hotel, is great italian food and very kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steelered42
Reviews.Content: We drove in after 3 hour drive, we enjoyed cocktails by the pool. Walking distance to Universal Studios and City Walk. Also, Hollywood and Griffith Observatory. Service here excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: Flight421
Reviews.Content: I visited in June 2010 and had a very nice, relaxing stay. Checking-in was a breeze, the bellhop escorted me to my room even though I only had 1 small roll-away, and I love that they upgraded my room for simply being a loyal Hilton Honors member. The requested snacks were delivered to the room shortly after the bellhop left, and the staff was courteous and helpful whenever I called to ask questions. An array of snacks is available in the standard room, and there are plenty of beverages as well. Wireless internet was $5, but that's better than the $15 other hotels charge. Internet connection was always good - never any delays of interruptions. The gift shop downstairs is stocked well with clothes, souvenirs, snacks, drinks, toiletries. If you'd prefer that the bar snacks in your room be refurnished via delivery, they're happy to bring what you want as well. Late dinner was ordered the evening of arrival and they delivered in about 30-minutes. They graciously pickup the tray afterwards instead of just picking-up from outside of the room. Breakfast ordered via doortag the night before was delivered the next morning right on time! And all special requests with the food was followed to the T. Supposedly this hotel has some of the best steak and seafood selections - I'm vegan so I didn't explore this option. But the selection is available in the restaurant in the lobby, or through room service. The pool is relaxing and staffed, so you can have lunch/appetizers/drinks delivered outside. As mentioned, though it was the peak of tourist season, the crowd was quiet and relaxing. Parking is available in the garage below the hotel and I REALLY like that self-parking was available within the same structyre (I usually valet if self-parking is in another structure - laziness =P ). I couldn't have had a better travel experience. At first I was uncertain about the stay considering it was the middle of June - the peak of tourist season around Universal Studios. But the busy season wasn't a problem at all and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Checking-out was just as simple and I would easily stay here again. The only reason why I gave a four-star rating was because one of the staff tried to open the door and proceeded to knock, even though the Do Not Disturb sign was placed outside. Other than that incident, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nice Breakfast Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: MissJasmine
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, after a transatlantic flight, around 5pm. The bellman met our car and took care of our luggage right away. Check in was almost empty and there was only one guest checking in before of us. As Hilton Honors Diamond members, we were upgraded to an executive room, although this hotel sadly, no longer has an executive lounge. In the absence of the lounge, we were given vouchers for our buffet breakfasts and for canapÃ©s in the lounge. The canapÃ©s vouchers were only valid Monday to Friday, so as we were staying Friday and Saturday, one set was useless. We went up to our room, which was really nice, great views over the Studios and nice and quiet. In out rook was a welcome basket of fruit and snacks That evening we used our canapÃ©s vouchers, which included a soft drink or tea and coffee. The presentation of the plates was very nice and so was the waitress. That evening we walked across to the universal city walk, where there are plenty of shops and places to eat. At breakfast the next morning, we used our free buffet vouchers and paid a small supplement to have the hot breakfast. We were glad we did. There was a huge selection of all the usual foods, as well as an egg an omelette station and even dim sum. The hotel has a lovely pool at the back of the property and a 20 person hot tub. Our afternoon was spent having a drink, snacking, sitting by the pool and in the hot tub. The bar server at the pool was really great, checking up on us every so often to see if we needed any more drinks etc. That evening, we ordered room service. This came promptly, was nice and hot and was reasonably priced. In summary, I am impressed with this hotel. The staff are very friendly, the food and drink is reasonably priced for a Hilton and the facilities are excellent. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Kim P
Reviews.Content: After much research we decided on the Hilton at Universal City for our accommodation close to Universal Studios, great location and excellent service, fantastic views. We nearly booked the Sheraton but so glad we didn't when we got there and saw it. Don't waste time looking at to many places this will meet all expectations also handy to Hollywood and getting to Six Flags Magic Mountain

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Universal - Nice place to stay for an LA vacation”
Reviews.Author: Steviek49
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day/7 night Los Angeles Vacation. We are a family of 4 (2 daughters ages 20 and 18) from New York. We came to get an LA experience and wanted an upscale hotel in a safe area and not too far from the attractions. We had considered the Hilton and Sheraton Universal, Rennaisance Hollywood, Hyatt Century City and Andaz Hollywood. After checking out each hotel and it's location we were glad we chose Hilton. We carefully planned out this vacation so that we can get the most out of LA. WE flew in from NY on Delta and picked up our car rental (compact SUV) from Fox CarRentals. I was pretty concerned renting from Fox because I almost always rent from Avis, Alamo and National and never had a problem. But the price difference was significant so we tried Fox. Although it took a while for us to find a shuttle from LAX and a shabby looking office and a jeep that was not new/ had 53,000miles on it and with manual windows- we had no problems. WE needed the Jeep because the 3 females in my family always pack enough luggage for a months vacation and it would not fit in anything smaller. It was about a 40 minute drive to the hotel. We planned to seeing an LA Dodgers ballgame ( got our field box tickets on Stubhub weeks before the trip), taking a tour of the stars homes/Hollywood/Beverly hills tour on Starline tours, a day at Santa Monica Beach, see a taping of the tonight show with Jay Leno, and visit Universal Studios Hollywood.( we bought a 7 day unlimited pass to Universal on line for the price of one day). We were able to do it all as well as see Mark Whalberg get his hollywood walk of fame star (with friend Will Farrell) and take the rest of the day to personally visit hollywood and Beverly Hills. The hilton was convienently located no more than 15 minutes from where we needed to go. More importantly it was in a safe area and a short 5-7 minute walk to Universal Studios/City Walk. Since we had a 7 day unlimited pass we went to Universal Studios almost everyday for just a few hours, We ate at City Walk 4 nights (Mexican, Wolfgang Puck, Steak house and Tony Romas) and walked around late at night without safety concerns. Upon check in we had reserved 2 rooms and were given a huge King Alcove room for my wife and I connecting with a 2 double bed room for the girls. Our room had huge windows looking over LA. Linda checked us in and upon seeing I was a HH Gold member gave us cuopons for free continental breakfasts/ free afternoon snacks and drinks and free wifi internet connections each day. In addition, twice during our stay they delivered to our rooms complimentary water bottles and snacks. The free continental breakfasts in Cafe Sierra were very good. It included everything at the buffet except for smoked salmon and the hot items. If you wanted the full buffet you can upgrade for $9 pp. We did not feel the need to upgrade. The snacks/drinks coupons included a choice of 5 or 6 items which include a cheese basket or fresh fruit platter or 2 hamburger sliders w/ chips or veggy platter or a fish sandwich plus a non alcohloic beverage and it was served in the lobby lounge. It was enough for a nice free lunch or late night snack. It was good from like 11am to10 pm. This Hilton had a nice pool and hot tub and a business center with airline boarding passes computer available for printing (free). The center also had computers and printers available for a fee. The hotel itself had an upscale feel and service was professional. This Hilton, unlike some others we have been to, had most of it's act together. Housekeeping was fast and efficient. Service in the Cafe Sierra was also quick. Bellhops and Car Hops were ready to help. Concierge was mostly helpful. Front desk services were top notch. We had a small problems during our week stay but within minutes they were resolved. If I had to nit pick- the waiters in the Cafe Sierra should all be told the rules concerning the continental breakfasts together. Each had a different set uf rules. On our first morning we were specifically told that we can self serve anything from the buffet except for hot items. 2 mornings later they said we could not have the smoked salmon- no problem. On our last morning, the waiter said we could not go around the buffet but instead he would bring us a plate with several items on it. Each time we faced this we told the waiter what we were told and they didn't have a problem but it was embarrassing to have to explain this to each waiter. Parking was expensive @ $17 per day self parking or $22 per day for valet. We self parked. My final small pet peeve was with the internet access.
