WE were given free access but instead of just waiving the $4.95 per day per room fee they said they will remove it at the end of the stay. This happens in alot of hotels but I wish they would just not charge it in the first place because there is ALWAYS a problem at the end. We did have it removed but after a few phone calls and explaining the situation. Overall we recommend this hotel for an LA vacation especially if you plan to visit Universal studios. I went to see the Sheraton Universal and found the Hilton to be much nicer with a more upscale feel. Yes, it had more of a business feel to it but it was much newer/nicer and a shorter walk to Universal. Better yet, the Hilton was priced considerably lower in all room catagories. We are also Starwood members but we liked the Hilton better. The hotel was never more than a 15 drive to NBC studios, Hollywood Walk of Fame, KodaK Theater, Beverly Hills and even Dodger stadium. Finally it's in a safe/ theme park environment with lots of security and City Walk for restaurants/shopping and strolling. I was very comfortable with my daughters going to City Wmalk on their own without concerns. I hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Universal studios around the corner”
Reviews.Author: jsberlin
Reviews.Content: It's neither pretty nor spectacular but If you plan on going to the Universal studios and city this is a great place to stay for 2 or 3 nights. You can just walk over ... Everything else is Hilton standard. Sunday brunch however is remarkable. It is truly an oppulent feast and attracts a lot of local residents.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Location, hotel showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Choccilover
Reviews.Content: We came to this Hotel to be close to Unviersal on the last day of our holiday in LA. Room good, no great view. aranged room service which was fine. super cold airconditioning in hallways.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HILTON I HAVE EVER STAYED AT...”
Reviews.Author: Ravens4ever
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. You canâ€™t beat the location, but it is the rooms and amenities that are the real star. The rooms are modern, comfortable and well appointed. They really have a high end feel. Also if you get a high enough room, you will have a great view. The staff was extremely accommodating and the hotel has a lot to offer (multiple restaurants, a large store onsite, shuttle to Universal, great pool, etc.). I really have no idea how some other recent reviews questioned the accommodations. I found them first rate. This is by far the best Hilton I have ever stayed at. Donâ€™t hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “A big watch out for everyone. Both the...”
Reviews.Author: DavidFoodie
Reviews.Content: A big watch out for everyone. Both the website and when I called reservations state a " Multi-million dollar renovation, etc...". This is completely disingineous. This hotel has not been touched in many years. Feels old, dated, and worn. I cannot believe how the advertise themselves as renovated and contemporary. Just beware. This is no 4-star or 4-diamond property. Maybe was at some point, not now. You may still want to stay here. Good location for Universal Studios, service is pretty good, and the rate could be good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MLSOLTIS
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for visiting Universal Studios and CityWalk and LA/Hollywood in general. Staff very helpful. Talk to Concierge and get directions/maps from them to Hollywood sign, etc. A must place to eat off premises............PATYS.......10001 RIVERSIDE DR., TOLUCA LAKE, CA 91602.......PHONE: 818-761-0041..........great food..........great prices........great service.........an ABSOLUTE MUST for a good meal and inexpensive too!!!........less than 10 minute drive from Hotel to Patys!....The Concierge recommended to us and wish I had found this place at the beginning of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but geared more towards tourists than business people”
Reviews.Author: alexander_lakey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 17 nights in July 2010... yes a little too 'Alan Partridge' (the brits will get it) for my liking. The hotel is very good, some great service (Stewart on the front desk was particularly attentive and helpful). My room was a King Alcove, very roomy with a comfortable bed, great view (see photo) and a good bathroom. I worked in my room for much of the time, so started to get sick of it, but all in all it was very good. The TV was a quite old 4:3 CRT but worked fine and provided a decent range of channels... fine by me. My room was on the Universal studios side of the building, which gets sun in the morning.. the rooms on the other side got the sun all afternoon and can become a bit warm (one of my colleagues found the AC in his room on the other side had issues with the solar gain through the picture windows. generally I was very happy with the room and would recommend a King Alcove for comfort and size. The restaurant is pretty standard Hilton fare - the hotel loves its buffets (Thursday thru Sunday nights were very well patronised) - and the room service food (especially the chicken sandwich) is very good and prompt. As ever, eating in a hotel is not cheap, if you stay here for any time and fancy eating across the road in the Citywalk I can personally recommend the Saddle Ranch - great steaks and ribs for the carnivores amongst you. The rest of the food in the Citywalk was poor - especially the fast food which was universally (no pun intended!) bad quality imho. The pool at the hotel is lovely, the 101 is nearby but hardly bothers you - lots of space by the pool with a lovely bar and spa pool (which was a fabulous temperature). I can also heartily recommend the weekend poolside BBQ food - very good. One final thing, the Wifi has recently been dropped in price to $4.95 per device per day... it works OK but annoyed me that every device has to be paid for separately... but at least it is $4.95 rather than $14.95 like some hotels of this rating. All in all a good place to stay - but no proper lounge for Hilton business users, so if you expect this you will not find one here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel if you're planning on visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: scottish_scrooge
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel as we were wanting to see the universal studios. The hotel is in its own grounds and a single tower block. The car park, complimentary guests, is directly underground. check in was pleasant and we had a corner room with great views. The room was very clean, great quality bed and facilities (did I mention the view??). Overall very modern hilton room. The other hotel facilities were good, with a small kiosk for coffee/croissant in the morning. There's a bar which doesn't have a great atmosphere as it's in the middle of the hotel atrium and is a little soulles although the staff again were very friendly and very efficient. The downside and the reason this hotel didn't get full marks is because of the location. This hotel is the closest to Universal Studios, hence the reason we stayed there (unless you were visitng the park I'm not sure why else you'd stay here). The problem is although it's only 5min walk away it is the most difficult 5minute walk you will make. It's as is the hotel want to make a challenge of it for you! There's no signs in the hotel as to which exit to go out of. (For info go out via the conference exit). You then have to walk through the car park - of course there's no pedestrian walk-way. Then go up and cross the bridge (again, there's no signs). Then walk behind Citywalk (past the bins and other rubbish) and then you're there. Try and do that at night and you're much better people than we were! Overall would stay here again but they could make so much more of it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate with large rooms and decent pool”
Reviews.Author: vacaygurl
Reviews.Content: We didn't get to the hotel until almost Midnight, but we still got our adjoining rooms as requested which was great. We also got a rollaway last minute and they gave it to us at no-charge. One of the rooms however smelled like cigarette smoke, but that late at night with a 5 year old, we didn't feel like dealing with trying to change rooms. (We never did change rooms and we stayed there four nights. We were all too settled in and didn't feel like dealing with moving everyone.) The rooms were very spacious. We got a large king with a sofa and a room with two queen beds. Our view was of the highway, but I didn't care about that since you aren't supposed to be in the room much on vacation. The shower leaked a little as well as the sink and the room never really got that cool. It was kind of humid and damp feeling as well. Great, great location if you are going to Universal Studios, however we didn't go. We walked to the City Walk one night for dinner and that was very convenient and a lot going on with a ton of tourists milling around. Fun atmosphere, though. The pool was very nice and heated with a very large hot tub. The hotel staff was very hit and miss. The front desk staff was not very cheerful. The majority of staff here was not very friendly. The guy at the cabana bar by the pool made some STRONG drinks! (made up for the not so friendly staff!) All in all, I'd stay there again b/c the price was good, I felt it was clean (minus the smoke smell in the room), location to highways was great for getting around the LA area and had a nice pool which is surprisingly had to find in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nesabay
Reviews.Content: We were only there for two days, but the experience was wonderful. We asked for a room with a view. We had the view of the San Fernando Valley and of Universal Studios. It was beautiful and definitely worth the little extra money. There is a shuttle that takes you to City Walk from 9am-10pm. We wanted to leave earlier than 9am so we walked a short walk across the street to Universal Studios. You just need to cross over the bridge and you are practically there. There was a buffet inside the hotel that seemed very popular. We did not try it because it was mainly seafood and kind of pricey, but for what they seemed to serve may have been priced correctly. Instead of the buffet we tried the coffee place they have next to it. It serves Starbucks coffee and the regular donuts, muffins and pastries you could find at a coffee shop. Overall the service was great, the room was fantastic and the food was good. I really have no complaints about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: AZFamilyOf4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our two teenagers while visiting Universal Studios and enjoyed our stay greatly. We loved being able to easily walk to Universal Studios, or take the free shuttle bus which runs every 20 minutes or so. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. We had a nice view of the Universal Studios entrance and City Walk, which was beautiful at night. The double beds were soft and comfortable, and bathroom had a nice shower head with varying settings. We were a little surprised to find an older standard definition TV in the room, but that didn't really matter to us. The only minor confusion was how to self park as you need to register first to get your room key prior to entering the parking garage. There are other hotels which are more centrally located to other Hollywood attractions, but if your main focus is Universal Studios this hotel is a great value and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service IS a priority”
Reviews.Author: Melevans68
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to California on vacation with plans to visit the Disney resorts and Universal Studios and the attractions nearby. Rather than staying on the Disney property for the entire visit, we decided to move to a more central location, and based on the high ratings on TripAdvisor, chose this hotel. We arrived at 1:30, the hotel had an atmosphere of chaos as there were a ton of news vehicles parked outside and there was this buzz of preparation in the hotel. When we checked in, we were informed that our room wasn't ready( no biggie at all), but we could leave our luggage and when the room was ready, it would be sent up. We also verfied that we had upgraded our room to an executive floor which included a continental breakfast. They tagged our bags and sent us on our way. My husband had parked in the garage which had come and go priveleges, but the desk hadn't given us a pass so the attendant had to look up our room; she told us our room number and sent us on our way. When we returned at 9:30 that night, we went to the desk to get our room key. There seemed to be some confusion as to where our bags were, and there was nothing in the system about our upgrade;the bellman that took us to our room, assured us that he would check it out. Again the hotel was absolutely hopping and very busy( It turned out that the Republican candidate for governor had her election party there that night). We were delivered to our room tired, frustrated, and feeling like noone really cared about a simple booking- we didn't even have a key to the mini-bar. My husband went down to check on the vouchers for breakfast and was told that since we booked online, Hilton was not responsible for the mistakes in our room booking; we would have to take it up with the third party booking service when we got home. I then called downstairs when he returned to clarify that we didn't use a third party agency like Hotwire or Expedia and that we made our reservations on the Hilton website; the lady on the phone said that there was no proof in the system, and wanted the name of the person that told me otherwise. I couldn't remember the name of the woman who checked me in, so I was then told that there was nothing that she could do, but if I wanted to continue, she would get a manager. I agreed and I was put through to voicemail. Argh! I left a message explaining that I was really frustrated. An hour later....I called back, ranting that this was not like any hilton where we had stayed before, and I felt like we were being dismissed...the person on the other end of the phone, calmly explained that she was not the person that I had spoken to before, and that she wanted to hear about our day. I have to tell you, just feeling like someone was listening helped tremendously. After I explained, she introduced herself as Pamela, the manager, and said that she wished she had known earlier. She said that there had been some breakdowns in service and to make our stay better, she would upgrade our breakfast to the buffet and move our room the next day to a park view. This was so very nice and just having someone make us feel like we mattered was huge. We spent the day at Universal Studios- it rocked and Front of the Line pass is the way to go. When we got back to the hotel, I got to meet Pamela. She told us that she had two rooms available-park view and a suite- which one would we like? We choose the suite. When Danny, our bellman took us upstairs, this was a suite with more than just a couch; it had a dining area, bar, extra bathroom-it was gorgeous. Pamela had the staff bring in separate beds for our kids so that they didn't have to sleep on the fold-out. AND she sent up waters and snack platters for each kid with fruit and chocolates and candied apples. That was the way that we were treated for the rest of our stay. This location is gorgeous, the food is fabulous, and the people that work there do recognize how important the client is. The visit started shaky, but it finished strong-way above expectations. Thank you Pamela, Danny and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Excellent Staff Service”
Reviews.Author: 3spunkytravelers
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I can't fairly rate the "value" of the hotel, since we used Hilton Honors point to pay for the stay. (It was an excellent value in terms of points used per night.) This hotel is conviently located to Universal and the City Walk area and has an efficient and reliable shuttle if you don't want to or can't make the relatively short walk. The pool area is also nice. While the overall hotel amenities are great, the friendliness and willingness of the staff to answer questions and address problems made the stay one of the best we have had in a hotel. The only exception to the great staff service was the wait staff in the hotel lounge area. While they were generally friendly, they were not very efficient in dealing with the customers at the tables. We visited the lounge several times during the stay so we had 3-4 servers and consistently the service was slow. I'm not sure what the reason was, but the staff literally (I timed it while waiting for attention) spent more time at the cash register than they did out serving customers. Before reading the rest, be aware that I don't blame the hotel for the noise issue I mention and I complement the staff (security and hotel mgmt) for being customer-focused in dealing with the situation. About 2AM on our first night in the hotels, the guests in the adjoining room arrived and were exceptionally loud and using plenty of four-letter words that we could hear clear as a bell. I called hotel security to make them aware and they promptly arrived to address the issue. This worked for about 20 mins until someone else arrived to visit the "neighbors" and once the voices got loud and the language got pretty spicy. I called hotel security again and they promptly arrived to warn the guests again. This time it worked. In the morning, I went to the front desk to make sure the manager was aware and she was and had already started the process of relocating us to a new room that was an upgrade to a two room suite for the remainder of the stay. Overall, one of the best Hilton properties and best hotel stays we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: donnamay
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, this is a great location for Hollywood and Universal studios and the staff was very helpful. The view of the hills was very nice and the pool location facing the hills was nice as well. There is a sizable buffet but the breakfast that is sometimes included was pretty lame- hard bread and a few sorry pieces of fruit. The buffet was extra money. As far as the room- even though ours was on the "executive level"l it was on the small side, had an ancient tv, smelled kind of musty and the carpet seemed pretty worn. The bathroom was pretty small especially for 2 people and the vanity didnt give you much room in terms of shelf or drawer space so that felt crowded too. The lobby looks dated and it seemed like many of the carpets were stained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: lawheel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my 2 12 year olds. The place is very clean, the staff is very courteous, friendly and helpful. We got a free upgrade upon arrival and had 2 double beds on the 17th floor with a view of Universal. The beds were very comfortable and I loved that we could walk to Universal. There is a bridge that goes from the hotel to Universal but you need to ask the staff how to get there, it's kind of confusing if you've never been there before. The walk is 7 minutes from hotel to Universal. We did take the shuttle a few times, but it would have been faster to walk! We ate at the hotel for breakfast at the coffee corner, where they have starbucks coffee and muffins, danishes and donuts. We did eat one meal at the buffet they have at the other restaurant, but I about gagged when I saw that it was $34 a person. My daughters hardly ate anything, but I guess that's what I get for not asking the cost ahead of time. Needless to say we did not eat there again during our stay. The only negatives I can think of was that our hot water went out one of the mornings we were there and I couldn't' shower until later in the day which was incovenient, but they did fix the problem fairly quickly. Also, you have to pay for your wireless internet, $4.95 a day, which I thought she have been included. You also have to pay $17/day for self parking, but the parking lot is very safe. We came back one night around midnight and I felt completely safe and secure parking and walking to the elevators that led to the lobby of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: superstarintheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for many nights and we totally loved the hotel. It is located very close to the Universal Studios theme park ( there is a free shuttle to go there every 10-15 minutes or you can walk till there in 5 minutes ), the hotel is located on a hill so you have the car or you can take another free shuttle from the them park entry or you walk for about 10 minutes. The staff is very nice, the doormen helped us with the bags, the check in was fast and the room was very nice and clean. The beds were big and comfy, the bathroom was clean and the room was big, it had a television ( quite old model ), the iron and iron board, a free safe, the wordrobe, and a great view on L.A. The hotel has an outside pool too, we went there once and it is very nice, you can't bring outside food or beverage in the pool zone but order there can be expensive as well in the inside restaurants. They gave us a coupon for a free dinner for the first night ( for a 20 dollars value ) and they brought us many times a free dish with goodies and two little bottles of water. You can book tour from the hotel but they did not know much on how to arrive to some places we asked them about. You can book there a shuttle or a taxi to go everywhere you want. The location is the best if you want to choose this hotel because you are going to visit Universal Studios theme park ( close to the entrance of the park there is Universal City, the entry is free of charge and there are restaurants, shops, events, cinema...), anyway if you want to be in the real center of LA and, above all, if you don't have a car this is not the best place to stay since can be a long journey to reach by public transportation some of the most famous places in LA ( anyway, is just one subway stop from Hollywood ). In general, is a good hotel, we found a cheap rate on booking.com so we were happy comparing the price to the service. ps: if you have a car remember that there is a parking fee ( we think is a little expensive ) and if you need to use internet they have wirless access ( you pay something like 5 dollars for a day ) or you can use the business center but is expensive. Remember to bring your credit card, since they need it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Inverdeen
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel.The room was spacious with large bathroom. Free shuttle to the Universal Studios and City Walk. You can also get the Metro from the Studios. We also found the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: oribie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5 minute walk from the Universal Studio or you can take the free shuttle is youâ€™re really lazy. The hotel is very clean and spacious. The bed room was very large and comfortable with a great view of the Hills and the hotel swimming pool. You can book many tours from the hotel if you havenâ€™t planned one already. There are loads of restaurants and bars around the corner on Universal City Walk (not all good and a bit dear tho) but youâ€™re sure to find something youâ€™ll like. My partner and I had a really good time and would certainly come again. Iâ€™m really glad we decided to stay there rather than in Downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Univeral Studios”
Reviews.Author: Rover82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good choice if you are going to Universal Studios. The room are large and ok, while the bathroom was quite spacious. Check in staff were polite and courteous as well. Note: while this hotel is next to Universal Studios, dont try walking there or back, as there is no straight walking area between the 2 places

Reviews.Title: “Handy if going to Universal”
Reviews.Author: Sable808
Reviews.Content: Room was large & clean. Bathroom was also large & clean. Couldn't understand why the coffee maker was in the bathroom but it was a quirk that was amusing. Location is handy for Universal Studios. Parking a car at the Hilton is costly but driving is necessary in LA if you want to get around. Location was close to public transport but connections in LA seemed difficult. We stayed & drove to Disneyland. The restaurant we felt was overpriced & the food wasn't that great. There is a much better diner at the bottom of the hill & around the corner that was fantatsic for breakfast. The service that we received on the front desk was great - even when we had to check out in the middle of the night to get to the airport at 5am. We stayed as we got a promotional rate & we thinking we might do Universal. If you want to go to Disneyland probably better to stay out there. Handy though for the Hollywood walk, etc.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: sukidsntravel
Reviews.Content: I was worried about booking this hotel based on some of the reviews on here, but luckily i went with my gut instinct and the photographic evidence. I am so glad we did. When we arrived we were a couple of hours earlier than the check in time, but no problem here i went to the hilton honours desk and Stewart (Cant forget his name same as my husbands), was outstandingly friendly and professional. He checked us in and even walked us to the elevator - what a touch. When we opened the door to our room we were more than pleasantly surprised , we were on the 17th floor with a view overlooking the studios. The room was spacious, extremley clean and modern. There was a welcome tray of fruits and snacks as seen in other peoples photographs! My kids loved this. The pool was great - plenty of loungers and a spa. There were lots of weddings this weekend (Memorial weekend) which was lovely to see. The evening buffett looked fantastic though we sadly did not eat there as we were using all this time to visit the park and hollywood etc. We did have a buffett breakfast and i tuly believe it is the best assortment and freshest buffett breakfast i have ever had. Please do not hesitate to stay here, it is perfectly situated for the studios and that was the main reason for our visit - we walked there and back each day (Sometimes twice a day) with two young boys aged 10 and 7 - so it is easy. But they do provide a shuttle service. It is very close to Hollywood, Griffith Observatory and Santa monica - well to everything touristy ! We had a Fab stay - would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sevice”
Reviews.Author: AdamMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a business meeting nearby. The staff were excellent, from front desk to housekeeping. The hotel is the usual high standard, but lacked personality as with all large hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: symfanizane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for memorial day weekend, and we went to universal studios and the city walk. When we came back to the hotel later that night, the room was still dirty, music was put on real loud, THEY WENT THROUGH OUR STUFF AND TOOK A BAG OUT OF MY SUITCASE, and left a dirty robe on one of the beds. When we talked to management about it, they were super rude to. I definitely won't be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Business hotel. Good location, Great views. Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: doogiehowser_md
Reviews.Content: It was a toss up between The Sheraton & The Hilton, I chose The Hilton purely on the look of the exterior compared to the Sheratons. Was glad I chose the Hilton, stayed in a twin Club room. Nice tidy rooms, comfy beds (however they were 2 doubles and not 2 queens!), Great views, Large in-room dining menu with quality food at reasonable prices, good service all round, short comfortable walk to Universal Studios and City Walk (no need for shuttle, shuttle service finishes at 8pm). Starbucks on site, Great buffets in Sierra Cafe, Made to order Sushi and Sashimi, Good bar, Nice pool area with heated pool, jacuzzi and cabanas. Couldn't ask for more! Walls were a tad thin and try avoid a room with interconnecting doors as the sound can come thru. Had a muck up with or Limo transfers but The Hilton fixed it all up, so top notch service. They also tried to satisfy all my requests and check-in and gave me the choice of checking in early. Definately stay there again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to see universal studios”
Reviews.Author: Neil_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after running around universal for the day and it was perfect for purpose. Good clean big rooms with nice bathroom as you'd expect. Parking is $17 and the studios are a 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Universal, Warner Bros and Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: sgh1
Reviews.Content: Had a 7 night stay here in May as part of a two stop vacation (had 5 nights in Anaheim/Disney area as well) Check in was courteous and smooth, we even got walked to the elevator. As we were staying for 7 nights we were offered a complimentary refrigerator. Upon entering the room we were pleasantly surprised at how spacious it was. The large windows really made an impact; we could view Universal for the corner of our windows. There was a complimentary pack of fruit and candy which was a nice touch. On the whole though it was an impressive room. Some things in the room are a little dated, the TV for example. However on the whole we loved the room. The bed was huge and very comfy. The bathroom was very spacious with great mirrors and generous amount of plug sockets. The shower itself was not very good, in that there was no power behind it at all. CafÃ© Sierra the main hotel restaurant was a bit pricey; we did eat there 4 times during the course of the week, would have used it more had the price been a little more reasonable. The breakfast buffet was 22 Dollars per person (includes drinks) plus tip. It was an extensive buffet and very nice but well over priced. I think there should be a discount for people staying a week and over. There are individual Breakfasts available from their menu as well but again these are overpriced. You can also walk over to City Walk to get a more reasonably priced breakfast. There is 24 hour room service but this has additional charges to the menu prices. Certain days of the week CafÃ© Sierra have an early bird 3 course dinner between 4-6PM for 17 dollars plus taxes and tip. This is well worth it if you are able to eat at those times. The early bird meal we had was good quality and very filling. We also ate from the late night menu in the bar area again not the cheapest but not bad food. Having a Starbucks on site was great for morning coffee and a light breakfast. One bad point I have to raise is the charges to use PCs to access the internet. The charges were extortionate. In comparison to other hotels the charges to use an internet terminal are a disgrace. Also only limited hours for the business centre, more and more hotels have these facilities available 24 hours and at sensible rates. The location is good and in particular for Universal Studios as you can walk there in less than 10 minutes. I personally think they could design a quicker walkway to the bridge that takes you over there but they do have a shuttle that takes you over for free while the park is open. If it is city walk you want in the evening you will need to walk but itâ€™s not that bad less than 10 minutes and you are there. We did not have a car so relied on buses, the metro and cabs. The Metro Station is about a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction to Universal and you can get a day pass for 5 dollars which you can also use on the buses. Hollywood Walk of Fame Area is only 1 stop on the metro. There you can get the movie stars home tour etc. The hill leading down to the station is a little steep which is not too bad on the way down but is a little harder to walk on the way back up. However you can get the free shuttle across the road to Universal and walk from there. Staff were all polite and always said things like welcome back when we returned from a day out. Concierge were helpful. We used them to order a transfer from the Hotel to Anaheim/Disney Area. We opted for a private transfer which was 132 dollars including tip. But there were cheaper options such as Lux Bus America. I recommend the Warner Bros Studio tour, fun and interesting. To get there in a cab from the rank outside the hotel it only cost about 15 dollars. Plus they have a nice restaurant to grab breakfast or lunch before or after your tour. If I was to come to this area again I would stay here. From what we saw guests here tended to be mainly business people more then people on family holiday. I did like the idea of staying in both the Universal/Hollywood area and staying in Anaheim to cover Disney and other local things to that area. We stayed at a sister hotel of Hilton in Anaheim The Doubletree Guest Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Some booking issues thru hotel, but GREAT service upon arrival, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were attending a wedding at the hotel and it was more convenient as we took our 1 year old with us. We had a nightmare trying to book the room under the wedding rate and difficult time dealing with people on the phone (central reservation line) however once I spoke with hotel directly and after arrival, we experienced great service from very friendly/ attentive staff. From the check-in, valet, bellhop, room service, waitstaff -- everyone was great! We had a room w 2 doubles and had room to set up the pack n play. Hotel offers pack n plays but we had arranged rental of a stroller, pack n play and bucket of toys from Russell @ LA baby gear rental so we wouldn't have to lug it all from the East coast. Would also rec'd Russell's services! Very nice plate of fruit, nuts, water and snacks was in our room upon arrival and refreshed a few days into our stay. Nice touch from the hotel. Location is great if planning on a visit to Universal Studios/ City Walk. Within walking distance which was great. During our stay, we had a rental car and visited local sites - Hollywood sign, Hollywood, Rodeo Drive/ Bev Hlls, UCLA, Mulholland Dr and Santa Monica Beach & Pier. All within an easy drive. Pool is very nice at the hotel, location on the grounds is not the best, but nice none the less. pool bar and cabanas and plenty of chairs. Was not crowded at all during our stay but the weather was in low 70's. The hotel is about 30 minutes from LAX so keep that in mind if flying out of LAX and traffic times. If your flight is anywhere near rush hour, you may want to reconsider staying and driving from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and panache”
Reviews.Author: krickey7
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant visit at this property. The views on the upper floors are astonishing, and I found the rooms in general to be generously sized and quite comfortable and in good condition. It was easy to get to most parts of town from here, even in LA's notorious traffic jams. Service was properly attentive and I thought the hotel was actually quite reasonably priced. This is a great base for exploring the LA area. Not every stay is perfect, so I'll note the deficiencies. The property has few amenities on-site, and those it has are unimpressive. We weren't tempted by the sole restaurant, never even saw the pool or exercise facility. The property in general is due for a renovation in the next 2-5 years, I'd say--it's getting tired in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “The View!”
Reviews.Author: Deelynn
Reviews.Content: Great location....can walk to Citywalk for dinner and entertainment,Â  makes driving easy where you want to go.Â Â Â  Sits high on the hill and the views from the rooms are fabulous.Â Â  Didn't expect that many windows in one room.....fantastic day and night views.Â Â Â Â  Dining room was convenient and a step above "hotel restaurants".Â Â Â  Staff accomodating.Â Â Â Â  But, again the main feature is the size and view of rooms.....just did not get much sleep because I couldn't close my eyes to miss the night views!

Reviews.Title: “A GEM with fabulous staff and views to die for....”
Reviews.Author: toothfairyRI
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here because it was close to wear my son lives. Have been to LA many times, but this was our first visit here. We will NEVER stay anywhere else. Our room wasn't ready for check-in, (we were early)..the Asst. Manager overheard the conversation with other staff and found us a room on the same "Executive Level" floor.but this new room was an upgrade..It was so huge...and the views out the wall of windows on the 21st floor were amazing. There was complimentary water, candy,fruit and nuts waiting for us, and was replenished everyday. Didn't mind the daily valet fee..they were so acommodating and gave us water every time we went out. The only downside was the $10/day internet fee...when spending this much money one would figure it would be included. The hotel is immaculate,the staff extremely professional and friendly...I have to give it 4 1/2 stars...DO NOT MISS OUT ON THIS ONE!!! Other comments have said that the pool area is small for the size of the hotel....it was fabulous, with poolside food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: killercaribou
Reviews.Content: I guess my only complaint is that you feel like they are nickel and diming you for everything but I'm here on business so I'm not really paying for it. First off, the beds are EXTREMELY comfortable, almost to a detriment. Their breakfast buffet is vast and their Thursday through Sunday buffet is so vast it's ridiculous. I thought it was a great location because even if you don't really feel like doing anything, you can take a walk to Universal City Walk or hang out at the pool. I also adored their weight room. Quality Precor machines with LCD screens.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: kkekert
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, expansive rooms, lovely views, amazing staff and excellent food! Loved that Universal Studios/City Walk is just around the corner, too. Location, location, location, this is definitely my hotel choice if I plan to visit LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: melbatoast5
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. The room was large, with an awesome view of the San Fernando Valley. It was almost panoramic because the windows are angled and the whole back wall is windows. We asked for extra pillows and blankets and they came right up immediately. We ate dinner in the large lounge area and everyone liked it so much they wanted to eat there the next night! When we got back to the room they had given us a tray with fruit and cookies etc., for no reason! The only improvement they could make would be to add more chairs around the pool. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good Hhonors, location mixed”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: About Me: Non-refundable pre-paid room booked on Hilton site for $144 per night as a Gold Hhonors member. Staying 4 nights. Good Items - Great hotel if you are going to Universal Studios because you can walk over there in less than 5 minutes or take a shuttle if you are lazy/ can't walk it. - All staff were uniformly friendly and helpful from the first valet attendant who opened the door of my shuttle to the last valet attendant who wished me farewell in my return shuttle. - Received an upgrade to the 22nd floor Tower room, which was HUGE and very spacious and included a nice welcome gift of 2 bottles of water and a large snack platter with fresh fruits, chocolates, pastries, and a chocolate dipped apple. First time I have received a welcome gift in US as a Gold. Also received coupon for free continental breakfast every day in the hotel restaurant and 2 coupons for a free $10 appetizer in the lobby lounge. I don't believe there is an executive lounge. - Very comfortable bed/ pillows and nice working desk. - Very nice bathroom amenities which were refreshed daily and a complimentary coffee/tea maker and supplies which was also refreshed daily. - USA Today delivered for free every morning and complimentary Financial Times available on front desk. - Bar food and drinks were surprisingly affordable. After trying in vain to get a seat anywhere at the Universal CityWalk, I came back and was able to get a large Alaskan Amber for $5 and a really nice burger with fruit tray for $10. Much cheaper and less crazy than CityWalk. - I didn't use it, but they have a LARGE pool (much bigger than Sheraton next door) and looks really nice. Negative - Wireless Internet is $9.95 per day but atleast it is 24hours from purchase so you can time your purchase to maybe cover 2 days. - Old 1980s CRT TV in the rooms. - First time I have was not offered the full buffet in the restaurant as a Gold member, kind of annoying they try to upsell you the $7 every day. - Toilet was always running and randomly turning itself on and off, even when I hadn't been in the room all day. - Temperature in this hotel isn't great. All day in meetings I would freeze and then go to my room and find it very warm. No controls in the room. - Traffic noise from highway even all the way up on 22 was noticeable. Didn't particularly bother me but know my significant other wouldn't have loved it. - Location isn't great without a car unless you are only doing Universal. There is nowhere to walk around here at all as it is up on a hill. I paid $10 one way for a taxi to Radford Studios for CBS show taping. Paid $20 from LAX on SupperShuttle one way. This is further impacted by the fact you are going to pay $22 a DAY if you want to park here (and you pretty much have to). - Lastly, and the most annoying, the elevators. SLOW, SLOW, SLOW. Really, this hotel was not full at all and never more than 1-2 people on at a time but I swear I never waited less than 3 minutes and often 4-5. Not sure where they sit, but they need to be adjusted. OVERALL - I really had a nice experience here and felt I received good value for my money. I was here for a convention at the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to do it again as the staff were superb and the hotel is pretty well maintained and treats HHonors members very well. If I were only in LA for vacation and seeing many number of things, I might consider somewhere where parking is free and more attractions in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty unpleasing hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Franky069
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Hilton Universal in California. we got a room on the 22nd floor. this room is very dirty. we would never stay here again. we had to take cold showers due to boiler be broken.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: coasttraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights at the beginning of April. The location of the hotel is excellent being 5 minutes walk from Universal Studios and Universal Citywalk with a great selection of restaurants. There was a complimentary shuttle as well. Our room on the 17th floor had a view over SF Valley, the mountains and the freeway. It was interesting watching the heavy traffic at 3am in the morning. The room was spacious with a complimentary fruit platter and quality bathroom products. There is a free shuttle from Lankershim Blvd going to the metro for trips to Hollywood and downtown LA. A day pass on the metro is excellent value at $5. Room service was excellent. The only small problem was the wait for the lift in the morning,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel /staff could be a little more helpful”
Reviews.Author: couturegal0818
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days and 1 night and upon arriving i was greeted and being a hilton honors member i proceeded to check in and the lady in the front desk was not the frendliest she could have tried smiling now i am used to when u check in u get a room key and a mini bar key well no i actually ask the women if i could have a mini bar key and she said in a i could care less tone oh it should be in the room or if it's not then call down. I mean what's up with that i get to the room and guess what no mini bar key i had to call the front desk and they said they would send it up and 45 minutes later nothing i had to call again and they told me very politely that it would arrive well 20 minutes later it did. I believe they shoul teach their staff to be more courteous to their customers overall the hotel beautiful the staff not soo great

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, probably great if you like Universal City”
Reviews.Author: daniellescm
Reviews.Content: Universal City is cheesy, and unless you're into that sort of thing, you're not going to LOVE this place. That said, the rooms are nice, contemporary and the bathrooms are roomy. Room service and desk staff were good. A co-worker and I tried to grab a quick bite from one of the little cafe areas off of the lobby. The poor hotel employee was trying to prepare food in the closet-like kitchen for about 20 minutes. My co-worker is a vegetarian and the worker had to go to the main kitchen to find the veggie option that was on their menu. It turned into quite an ordeal. Other dining options close by are in Universal City. The Wolfgang Puck restaurant was good, and probably the least packed-to-the-gills with screaming kids (I don't think I saw any kids there at all). The sushi restaurant was forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel/ Great service”
Reviews.Author: MPLSguy78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 1 night. All employees were very nice and said hello when you walked by. Rooms were very clean and the bed was very comfy. Hung out with Miley Cyrus in the hot tub. Overall, you pay a little more, but it was a short walk to Universal Studios and Citywalk. The parking fee is $17.00

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Hoff-dk
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Hilton - you can't really complain but it's not very charming either. It is located right next to Universal Studios with shuttle busses making it even easier. We didn't go for the breakfast or the buffet since we found it a bit overpriced, but with a Starbucks located inside the hotel and Universal City located next to the hotel, there are plenty of other possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “If you like smart 'business style' hotels, this is your place...”
Reviews.Author: Penguinis
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hilton Universal City. Overall, the experience was pretty average, but it does serve a purpose. Our experience was slightly marred by the fact that we turned up and they'd lost our reservation - then charged us a higher rate than we'd originally been quoted. They did put us in a lovely room with a great view of the studios and the hills. And it's very convenient for visiting Hollywood. But all in all it's a fairly soulless place - and very expensive too. You have to pay for parking on top of your room, room service and telephone calls are extortionate and you have to pay for breakfast as well! It all adds up to a pricey trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: lovemedo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, however.....one warning to handicapped travelers. We asked for a wheelchair accessible room and I assume were given what we requested, but the room was not very wheelchair friendly. Upon entering the room there was a narrow hallway leading to the main living area that is impossible for anyone in a wheelchair to turn around in and the bathroom did not have a shower seat, nor were we offered one upon check in. The hotel is beautiful, great buffet, well stocked gift shop and excellent service. We had the best room service meal we have ever had...excellent food, delivered quickly and piping hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location and affordable! Best Buffet in LA.”
Reviews.Author: wywk
Reviews.Content: The the rooms were clean and spacious but a bit outdated, could do with some refurbishment with new carpets and colours, but overall it was a great experience. We had a room with view of the Hills which wasn't very pretty but we didn't spend much time in our room, so it didn't bother me too much. It took us about 45mins to get to the hotel and a $90 taxi fare, but once we were there, everything else was very conveniently located. Only about 15mins to downtown Los Angeles, all tour buses pass by the hotel and Universal Studios is next door! The staff were all very friendly and courteous, I couldn't fault their service. Check-in was fast and efficient. They even gave us a room before normal check-in time. We used the travel desk service and they were super efficient. The Concierge and Bell Desk were great, they always remember you and make an effort to ask you about your holiday and if there was anyway they could help. This hotel has one of the best Dinner Buffet I have ever been too. It was Seafood and Grill extravaganza...I have never seen so many dishes in my life. They had a range of seafood, Crabs, Lobsters, Mussels, Prawns... they had a sushi station. And the roast meat section...the selection was unlimited. And it was well worth the price US$42/person I think it was. This hotel is great if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of LA and yet stay at a location that's convenient and nice. Universal studios and City is next door...5mins walk. We took a tour bus that took us downtown LA and sightseeing..and dropped us back at the hotel afterwards, it was easy.. As a Hilton Honours member (It's free to join), I got complimentary basket of fruits, snacks and bottled water which was a nice touch! It was an easy and stressfree experience for us...would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “not a hilton i would expect”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: no upgrade offered, asked for univeral view but got hill view. Restaurant full of people, waited half an hour for my drink but got the wrong one.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BritCanuk
Reviews.Content: Traveled here in Sept 08 wanted to explore LA and see the sights is located oposite Universal Studios Hollywood 5 min walk you will be at the entrance or hop on the free courtasy bus and hope on a trolly down the hill to the subway station where its 4 stops to Hollywood and Highland to see the sights the room was masive the lobby area was comfortable and lovly and has a great little shop and the pool area is just what you need after a busy day seeing the sights or going on the rides

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalaurelle
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It had alot of amenities. Very, very nice. Loved the valet parking since I was with my daughter, we felt more safe. This hotel was very close to Universal City which is why we chose it. Great service, rooms etc.... I would go back here anytime....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: bogobogo
Reviews.Content: Good service. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Decent gym. I would recommend this hotel if you're planning at trip to LA. I stayed in the tower floor (Executive King) and when I arrived in the room a fruit basket was waiting for me in my room. The room also came with continental breakfast with pastries, fruit and yogurt - a solid meal to get you going in the morning. Distance wise, it's a little ways from the downtown area but you need a car in LA anyways, and it's right next to 101 and Universal Studios. Plus, there's an In and Out right down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but otherwise mediocre”
Reviews.Author: rljaco
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold member and stayed on a 2 night pleasure trip. The rooms are nice, spectacular view on upper floors, great housekeeping, nice and quiet except for some distant freeway hum. But charges for everything: internet, valet parking, even per minute charges if you use the computer at the business center. Very poor service at the restaurant for breakfast. Slow front desk service. Strange short sheeting on the beds, you have to re-do them if you are tall. Odd location up the hill, convenient for Universal Studios but that's about all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Common Area Needs Updating, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler926
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times for business. The rooms have always been spacious but ever since staying here first in 2006 the common areas have needed updating. It's outdated in general. The hotel is situated up on the hill by Universal Studios and in terms of sites and restaurants, is only accessible by foot to City Walk. That area in general is very touristy. If you want to park a car and drive to see sites each day, I'd say the hotel is very well located. It's a pretty quiet area. If you have a high-up room, the view is also pretty good - depending on the side you are on. The rooms are large with big windows and the bathrooms are very spacious and mostly marble and stone. The rooms are clean and well-maintained, although the bathroom sink was clogged and I kept forgetting to call down about it, but you'd think the cleaning staff would have done something after 4 days. The lobby, on-site restaurant and meeting space is all outdated and slightly dingy. There's a lot of muted colors and brass. The staff that worked the conference were very nice and the service from them was generally very good. The banquet food wasn't bad either, considering it was banquet chicken. If you want to stay in a hip, modern hotel near unique restaurants and walking distance to anything other than chain restaurants and movie theaters, this isn't the hotel. If you want to drive to see the sites around LA for a few days, this is a good location...it's far enough away from a busy street that you don't feel too crowded but it's close enough to major roads for easy access. There's a metro line nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: jlcaj
Reviews.Content: Room was just right for 4, plush and modern. Restaurant in lobby looked upscale. Walking distance to attractions, would stay again for the convenience to citywalk and studios. Parking fee, internet fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; terrible food; service avg”
Reviews.Author: Georgia_Dawg7
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec 30-Jan 3 for Rose Parade & Bowl. Rooms nicer than expected. Cafe' Sierra food less than average - mostly geared toward Asians. Seafood stays out 24/7. Odor overwhelming. Service just average. Concierge not nearly as helpful as other Hiltons. Great location. Easy to get to Hollywood, LA, Beverly Hills. Room service took almost 2 hours. Hotel is surprisingly ill-equipped to handle large capacity. Would stay there again, but depend on eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a visit to Universal City/ Burbank, with reliable Hilton hospitality and onsite parking”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Universal City Hilton is next door to the theme park. I stayed in an Executive Club room (worth the extra- it includes a good quality buffet breakfast). The room had a superb view over the park. If you are visiting Universal, this is probably the best place to stay- it's the closest hotel to the park, so you don't waste time travelling to and from the park, and the hotel offers good quality accommodation with reliable Hilton hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellers774
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel. We arrived early on our arrival day to be greeted by Linda at the front desk. She was more than helpful and actually arranged for an early check in for our two rooms. Much appreciated after a 13hr flight with three children. Beds are the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. Great location - close to Universal Studios , City Walk and the Metro into the city. Best buffet I have ever seen. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to LA.

Reviews.Title: “My LA Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBJPortland
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is my LA Hotel of choice, particularly as a Hilton Honors Silver Level - they go out of their way to provide the best room available.

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressed”
Reviews.Author: leeharveybf2
Reviews.Content: I spend lots of nights per years in hotels traveling for business. That being said, it is tough to impress me or to even break out of the norm. The Hilton Universal City did both. I arrived early but my room was ready. The food in the Sierra Cafe (had the chicken & sausage alfredo) was terrific and the service from the front desk, to the dining room staff, to the gentleman who just dropped off a basket of fruit in my room, has been outstanding. Very attentive and overly helpful. After spending 100+ nights in hotels this past year (2009) this one really distinguished itself and has totally earned my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location for going to Universal.”
Reviews.Author: njmom4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week before Thanksgiving for one night before going to Universal the next day. The location was perfect if you are going to Universal. We were able to walk to and from the hotel. The rooms were very nice, actually nicer than I expected and the service was great too. The breakfast buffet was overpriced so we asked around and got directions to the Good Neighbor Cafe a short drive away and saved a ton on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: kittenjd2b
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel. It had all of the amenities we needed. It was a great location - across for Universal City Park. The staff was very attentive. We had a gorgeous view from our room. The room was large and comfortable. The bedding was relaxing. The bathroom was large and elegant. Everything was spotless. We had a comfy couch, cocktail table, and useful desk in our room. Price for internet was kinda high, but Hilton is known for charging a lot for internet use in your room. Overall, I loved this hotel. I wish we would have stayed longer! But the parking was $17 - more than what I wanted to pay, but what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: LisaH8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK. The facilities were nice, but the amenities were bare bones for a 'luxury' hotel. You could tell that they were cutting costs. Expected a bit more from this class of hotel (no robes, mouthwash, only provided two towels per room, etc.) Food was good. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Rooms were very soundproof and of adequate size. Front desk was a bit disorganized and canceled our reservation that was prepaid for the night before we arrived in order to guarantee an early check in so that we could get ready for an event immediately upon arrival (actually they resold our room in order to make a little extra $$).

Reviews.Title: “Loved our alcove room”
Reviews.Author: pharmertoo
Reviews.Content: Opted for the discounted room upgrade and loved it. Largest hotel room we've ever stayed in. Loved the added touch of the welcome gift!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel right next to Universal Studios Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: thejournalist
Reviews.Content: I don't drive so this was the perfect place for me to stay when going to Universal Studios for a visit. You can use public transport and get really close to it using the underground metro system in LA. I stayed for 3 nights, and was really impressed with the standards at this Hilton. Although there is no longer an executive floor, they do still have a great bar near to the lobby. I had an executive room which was very spacious and overlooked the interstate and the San Fernando valley area. The sound insulation was good at this hotel, and I didn't mind the view too much as I was not in the room very often. The hotel has a pool which I didn't use, but it did look very good. The staff were very helpful, and were able to provide information on what activities there were in the area. This hotel also has a travel desk which can book various trips and tickets for you. I mentioned the bar already. They always had quite a few people in there and some live piano music and singing. The bar tenders were friendly and helpful. However they did hand me a leaflet about tipping rules when I was paying once, which I though was unnecessary. I've been to the US many tmes, and am fully aware of the culture on tipping which exists there. There's a small shop at the hotel which is pretty good for essentials, but may be a little overpriced. As a Hilton Hhonors Diamond member I was entitled to a free continental breakfast. It wasn't great at this hotel, and I would suggest maybe heading up to Universal City walk for something a bit more interesting. In terms of value, it was a little expensive, but I guess that's more down to it's location than anything else. All in all I was happy with my stay at this hotel and would return to it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location...out of the hustle & bustle of LA”
Reviews.Author: carmie74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here between 13-17 October and we were so happy we did. The location was fantastic, our room was 5 star (it was so big and plush) with stunning views and walking distance to city walk and Universal Studios. Every night we would walk to city walk and have dinner in one of their restaurants and then walk back to the hotel. The hop on hop off bus even comes to the door of the hotel I think every 30 mins and drops you right outside the Chinese Theatre and the metro is just a short walk down the road and one stop to the Walk of Fame. This was our first time to LA and we loved every minute of it. We would definitely be recommending the Hilton to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to be close to most of LA's attractions”
Reviews.Author: DaN1Wk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were due to stay in this hotel for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon however due to an issue arising from our next destination we remained in Universal City for an extra 4 nights. On our arrival we were immediately upgraged to a King sized room at no extra cost! The hotel is perfect for visiting Universal City by day and the Universal CityWalk by night were there are many restaurants, shops and cinemas to keep anyone entertained. During the second half of our stay there we hired an vehicle from the ever so helpful conceirge, Dora (who treated us like a mother away from home!) and found that we were close to most of LA's tourist sights, such as Hollywood, Farmer's Market, Rodea Drive, Santa Monica, Long Beach and Malibu. Great service, the breakfast is good if only a bit on the expensive side however this is to expect from Hilton. Would definately stay there again especially because of the service provided by Dora!

Reviews.Title: “A gem and a fave but be careful which rooms you get”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: A de rigeur stay when in the area. while the rooms are showing their age the staff and amenities make up for much. First night was in ROH standard room. blech. Though upgraded to the executve level (meaningless as theyve removed the executive lounge in 2008 so just a high floor) the only benefit is a special continetal breakfast room included, which is already included in my frequent property guest program level ive attained. . added a stay and I checked back in the next day using a kiosk- never used them so thought id try it, and after entering all the info etc had to go to desk anyway. Front Desk staff "Linda' (reminds me slighltly of Karen from WIll and grace) was fantastic, friendly, helpful and upgraded me to a king civer room. She was so helpful and described every amenitiy, property points of interest and servcies. Highly recommended. In fact in all my previous stays was upgraded to this type of alcove room. Typically they included a decent welcoem basket but apparantly now that was only if you pre reserved that type of room. Spectacular views abound. Nice layout. Mini bar is acctually reasonable! 1.50 for a coke rather than 6.50 plus service, plus fee at Beverly Hilton) A good assortment of exotic goodies, and things you might actually need and use. Nice to see logo jars back, theyre always a nice gift. Has a problem with the act another guest had my exact name (uncommon) and was handled poorly on phone by a male at the front desk, however Yoschika at front desk corrected same and is pleasant and professional. @ male staff on earlier were inept , and either ill informed or were deceptive with me. I could not stay in the exact same room, as they were "out of king rooms", hed 'do me a favor' and "grant me a 1:30, well ok how about a 2pm departure", (my guest card level grants a 4pm) and when a double was open i could occupy same. Now he did call housekeeping to 'rush a double' on the same floor which i requested. a Nice show.....When i went up to my room to make future res, I forgot to chaneg dates and found a king alcove was available that day, reservable and guraranteeable for 13.00 more . I went down and said of you need the 13.00 that much ill give it to you and a 20.00 tip for your trouble but I dislike being mislead and his condescending attitude. Michelle W and the supervisor corrected it promptly and I stayed in the same room but it wasted 3 hours of my day, first waiting for my room to be changed, then checking back etc. Plus the bad experience with the same name occupant. SO it REALLY put a damper on my experience Restaurant is buffet based, and has an ala carte menue. Fairly priced. ROOM SERVICE is REASONABLE essentially same price as dining room wth a small delivery charge and gratuity included. There is a small starbuck like outlet with coffe sandwhiches and desserts. Aslo the lobby bar has happy hour hors deouvre and gold diamond hhonors members get a free selection from a pre designated menu. A full menue is available but you cannt apply the certificate value unlike with breakfast coupons. Of course this leads one to drink alcohol but the quesadilla was hot flavorfull and had great guacamole- and im not a big fan of guac. Pleasant informed waitstaff. My Random RANTS. SOME road noise may be heard if youre twd the 110, and universals occaisional production shows can be heard a bit during daytime, but not annoyingly. The bell staff is almost as informed as the concierge, who is great; and the bell staff is eager. 90% of employees seem truly aiming for your satisfaction and enjoy their job. PERFECT location for universal with free shuttle service to the studio tour and universal walk entertainment complex. Pet friendly. Several pools and jacuzzi. got a GREAT rate at link page at miamiscfi.com so Im going back in a few days

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MemoryCamera
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Staff was excellent. Rooms were clean and well appointed. I always dislike paying for internet, even though it was only $10 per day. Coffee stand was small but service was great every morning.

Reviews.Title: “LACKING IN STAFFING”
Reviews.Author: ServiceTech
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, but unfortunately they seem to have cut corners with their staffing. When I checked into the hotel, there were only two people at the Front Desk, and this was at 8pm! The morning was a little better, with three people there to help out, but I still feel that they were skimping on service by not having at least four people to help hotel guests during a busy time. The room service was quite good, and the attendants in that department were professional. My only other issue was with the connecting doors between rooms. I didn't request a connecting door, as I am traveling alone, but it didn't seem an inconvenience so long as the door lock was secure. Boy, was I wrong!! There seems to be absolutely no insulation or sound-proofing between connecting doors. One would think that a HILTON could afford to spend some money to make sure that noise doesn't travel freely between rooms, even if they are connecting.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: yadwiga
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The location is exellent for visiting Univeral Studios and Citywalk (a 5 to 10 minute up-hill walk), visiting Burbank and Warner Brothers Studios or NBC, or visiting Hollywood, with easy access to the freeway. The views from the hotel rooms are fantastic and the staff is very friendly. Just be aware that there is no longer a lounge or dedicated concierge for Executive Level stays, only the free continental breakfast in a room adjacent to the cafe on the main floor. Also, it is a long walk inside the hotel, to get from the self-park garage to the main elevators. The rooms are typical Hilton Hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: PerthOperator
Reviews.Content: Had two nights in LA with my 13 year old daughter. Hotel is your typical well presented Hilton with great service, a few extra touches thrown in and good quality but overpriced food. The views from the hotel were fantastic and the pool area was in a lovely garden. The location is fantastic- while no hotel in LA is central at least it was just a short and easy stroll to Universal Studios and the adjacent shopping precinct. We didn't use the train - but the station is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay I Want To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: trulove
Reviews.Content: My husband and i was celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary and being a young couple wanted to go to Disney and Universal coming from England i did not know what to expect but had reviewed this hotel alot before travelling .We stayed for 5 nights The location was great and the decor was impresssive the fact the shuttle did not run late from Universal was not a problem for us as it took only 5 mins to walk , we was on the 16 floor with views of the hills and Universal amazing!! the room was extremely clean and the beds was very comfy we had a king and my husband slept soundly the bathroom was bigger than i expected overall great food fantastic cocktails friendly staff and a wonderfull stay we was sad to leave . The only downside was the pool was quite cold , but the poolside was loverly and the hot tub was hot hot hot .... with attentive poolside bar staff i would strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: perplewater
Reviews.Content: I had reserved and paid for (up front) a twin (non-smoking room) 4 months in advance. Our flight was delayed, and we only arrived at the Hilton Universal City at around 9pm. I was however told by the front desk that they had given away our non-smoking room and they had no other option but to give me a smoking room (this despite the fact that I am a Hilton VIP member). The smoking room they had given was so filthy and chock full of smoke particles. The ventilator the hotel staff placed in the hotel room was of no use. One of my children (who is asthmetic) had breathing problems, and chose to sleep in our car parked in the Hilton's basement carpark instead (thats how bad it was). The bedsheets and bathroom were also filthy. We even spotted a cockroach running along the walls outside our hotel room door.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bbr2996
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because we were planning a trip to Universal Studios and it was walking distance to/from the park (it is the closest hotel to the park). It was amazing! VERY clean, the nicest staff I have ever dealt with and really beautiful rooms. I arranged for some amenities to be placed in our rooms prior to arrival and it was there as promised when we arrived- no having to call the front desk to remind them like I've had to do at other places. I also like the option of paying in full at the time the reservation was made at a discounted rate (the only downside is that you can't get your money refunded if you change/cancel your reservation) but it was a considerable discount - worth it if you can commit. We traveled with our older teenage sons and everyone treated all of us very well - every single employee smiled and said hi - even if it was 2 am when we got in! I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but beware of their billing department.”
Reviews.Author: slb1206
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and the hotel room. My daughter and I were very impressed. We had a lovely room and for being a Hilton Honors member we even received a free fruit basket and two bottles of water. Please beware however and always check your bank account for any additional charges. We had used my daughters credit card to hold the room but asked for my visa debit card to be charged for the final amount. We were BOTH charged for the room and it took numerous phone calls to receive a credit. We were also charged for several additional charges that we should not have been. The billing department was extremely rude as we called them numerous times to get the matter straightened out. As for the hotel I would highly recommend it and also for it's wonderful location and shuttle. I just didn't appreciate the cutomer service afterwards and the fact that it took me so long to get the matter taken care of. Just be very careful looking over your final billing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay if go Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: yyfcloud
Reviews.Content: It is located at just 5 mins away from the Universal Studios. So if your destination is the studio, it will be a perfect choice for you. Shearton Universal is just beside hilton. The room is good and the bed is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kathman
Reviews.Content: Nice location for business or tourist travel. Parking is $17

Reviews.Title: “If you expect an answer..forget it...”
Reviews.Author: ansingh
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for business. what a waste, should have stayed at the sheraton next door if it wasnt under construction. ordered breakfast, french toast came back UNCOOKED...dripping with egg. ordered nachos at the bar downstairs and it came with unmelted kraft slices, disgusting. the bar servers were so nice that i just felt bad. there was maybe one person max at the front desk which is ridiculous, much less another person standing at the hilton honors desk area. if you have to stay here the rooms are fine but don't go around looking for top notch service...

Reviews.Title: “Was told to have our kids sleep on the floor!!”
Reviews.Author: NavyCPOwife
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with two double beds. The night befor we arrived we called and sked if we can put a roll away in our room. They said that it would be a $35.00 charge. So when we arrived we were checking in we requested a roll away bed. The lady at the front desk said "Im so sorry we can put a roll away bed in a double room." Then we told her that we had two teenagers and a 8 year old and we need to a roll away. So she went back and spoke wit someone and came back and told us have a king room with a sofa sleeper and we can comp you a roll away." So I asked her it has a sofa sleeper bed? And she replied "yes". So we told her ok. She called and ordered the roll away. Come to find out we could NOT put a rollaway in our room and it do NOT have a sofa sleeper. When we called down we were told to have our 3 kids sleep on the floor. what the??? Ordered room service hot dog was like rubber bun was torn. The Calamari was ice cold. We could not take it anther nite. We checked out early and the lady was flat out rude to us. Never once said sorry. We are a military fam and we look forward to what little time we have together. On a good not some of the staff was friendly and the room was clean. Just be carefull if you have more than one kid.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Find Fault”
Reviews.Author: YoungCloughy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hilton Universal City for 6 nights in September 2009 and to be honest this is a superb Hotel. From the friendly very efficient Staff, the beautiful rooms to the magnificent food I could not find any fault what so ever. Would gladly stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Way Too Expensive For Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: roadtripgal77
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Universal City Walk/Studios in early July 2009. Here is my review. I'll start with the good: service. I have to admit that service throughout my stay was absolutely amazing. Check-in staff was super-nice and helpful. Cleaning people and room service were friendly and helpful. Also, the room service menu had some nice healthy extras that you don't normally find on other Hilton menus. I sampled several different salads and fruit dishes and was impressed. Now for the bad: the room. The first room I got was on the 14th floor. It was hot upon my checking in. So I turned the AC down. Almost immediately upon checking in, I left the hotel for an excursion. When I returned a couple of hours later, the room was still hot. I called downstairs and they sent a maintenance guy up. He was unable to fix it. Meanwhile I was hungry and wanted to settle down and order room service. So after a lot of hoopla, they transferred me to another room on the 17th floor. Now, I had actually ordered one of the deluxe rooms. I was disappointed to be presented both times with a standard room although they assured me it was in fact an upgraded room. Anyway, I settled into the new room. By the next day, the AC in the new room was having problems. It just didn't get cool enough. Instead of complaining again, I dealt with it. The wireless internet access was sporadic in that room and half the time the connection would be lost. The water that the maid left behind one day had a lid that wasn't even closed, yet I got charged for it. And speaking of charges... I'm a Hilton Honors Gold member, yet they didn't include one special in my stay. All the other Hiltons do. But this one charged for every single little thing. The bathroom was nice and big. The bed sheets were very nice and comfy. Upon checking out, I mentioned the problems I had but didn't get refunded or comped. Honestly, I probably won't be staying there again. Way too expensive and the room quality was not worth it. Service, however, was impeccable and impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - Just A Couple Of Strange Things”
Reviews.Author: Mutley251
Reviews.Content: All in all we were really happy with this hotel. We walked up and received a pretty good rate. We booked an Executive Level room. NOTE there is nothing special about these rooms, apart from a high level. There is no club lounge. You get breakfast vouchers, but they put you in a room next to the restaurant, you can pay extra to upgrade to the main restaurant, I found this whole thing weird!! The room was great, great size and we had an excellent view down to Universal Studios with LA to the right. TV was old, but watched very little. Beds and pillows were super comfortable!! Pool area was pretty good and almost empty. 5 min walk across to Universal with plenty of choice of dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTA_9
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review, but I thought this hotel was just great for going to Universal Studios and touring Hollywood. A nice surprise. I wish it were located next to Disneyland.
