The free shuttle was right there when we needed it, and it saved us the parking fee at Universal We had a beautiful panoramic view, and the hotel food was good too. We also saw a Disney celebrity on our floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bennyray
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I was pleasantly surprised, go across the expressway and check the staff's recommendations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find....great hotel...!!!!”
Reviews.Author: whitt1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our 3 week trip in the USA. To be honest we were not expecting an awful lot from this hotel and so we were surprised when it turned out to be a fabulous visit. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are a great size,with plenty of amenities.The maid even came round in the evening to see if we wanted anything topping up.A basket of fruit/biscuits were left on one night. The staff on the deak were a little frosty in my opinion,but all other staff in the hotel were very pleasant. It is a great hotel if you want to use Universal Studios with a regular shuttle service to the park up till 8pm..perhaps that could do with running a little later. Would stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Uffabug
Reviews.Content: Pro: Modern, efficient, walk to Metro station and walk to Universal Studios. Con: Expensive self parking.BEWARE! Nice and upscale.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: jkap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights and were very pleased with it. The lobby and restaurants are bright and cheerful. Our room was good size and comfortable. It could definitely fit a cot, but we were told they didn't allow them. We had a room on the 20th floor with a great view of the mountains. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub area and found them not busy late in the day. The continental breakfast was in a separate room from the large buffet which was a nice change. The main reason to stay here is it's vacinity to Universal Studios and Citywalk. We ate most of our dinners at Citywalk. There is a great variety of restaurants to choose from (Hard Rock Cafe, Buca di Beppa, Wolfgang Puck bistro, sushi). You can take a short walk to Universal/City Walk for take the shuttle from the hotel. The shuttles run very frequently, but my only criticism is that they stop at 8:00 p.m. If you eat at CityWalk or walk around at night you have to walk back to the hotel. That is when you need the shuttle the most. The hotel is very convenient to the different highways and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Skyline2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Couldn't be better positioned if you are visiting Universal Studios - superb location. Hotel very clean and efficient in that corporate way, which can be a little clinical lacking that personal touch. Other than that - cannot complain in any way.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top picks for an L.A. area hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBroadwayFan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in July for an adult industry trade show. I must say that the staff treated us very nicely and respectfully. We were treated to a room on the 22nd floor facing the theme park and the view was amazing. We ate several meals in the main restaurant and the lobby bar and the service was very good. Their continental breakfast was not the best I've seen, but the food was fresh and the staff was attentive. As most of the other reviews mention, it's a short walk to the theme park and Universal City Walk, which is a great place to eat and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and location.”
Reviews.Author: Paulguyinnj
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property that is within walking distance of universal studios and the city walk. The surrounding grounds of the property are beautiful and its location on top of a hill is unbeatable. The view from our high floor room was magnificent. The public areas are tastefully designed and clean. Check-in was quick. The staff was friendly. My only gripe was being told to pay 8 bucks more for a buffet breakfast when as a hilton honors diamond member, it should be included for free as it is at other hilton sister properties. Also, the elevators were quit slow for a building that has 25 floors. The reason I gave the property only 3 stars is due to the fee for internet access (I never understand why Hilton must gouge their customers to use the internet when sister properties hampton inn and garden inns manage to include it for free) which should be free for all diamond members. Also, the parking was quite expensive at 17.00 dollars a day. Again, this is something that should be comped for diamond members as it often is at other hilton properties. Overall, this is a beautiful property with a good location to visit in LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: spasterfield
Reviews.Content: Found the service excellent for quite a big hotel - I arrived very early after a 14 hour flight & although they were unable to accommodate a very early check in the staff were very helpful & set up a key so I could sit by the pool. Our room was a very good size with a 2.5 seater lounge. The bed was very comfortable. The room was also very clean & quiet. Excellent location for Universal Studios just a few minutes walk across the road. The metro station was 5 minutes down the road & we did use public transport (two buses, approx 1 hour travel time each way) to get to Santa Monica & Venice Beach. The pool was nice. We used the restaurant a few times, & although I feel the food was of a high standard it was not really to our liking. The prawns looked amazing but were tasteless. There were numerous dining options at City Walk as well. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great room and superb location for studios”
Reviews.Author: TokyogirlManchester
Reviews.Content: As soon as we checked in, we were made to feel welcome. We were given a great room on 17th floor with a fantastic view of the Universal Studios park. Our room was spacious and bright and the beds very comfortable. The bathroom, although not the most modern, was perfectly adequate, clean and a good size. Staff were always efficient and helpful. The pool was nice for a spot of relaxation although it's not huge (with noisy, clanging gate) and poolside food is very expensive so beware getting over enthusiastic with the menu! The evening buffet is very over-priced and definitely not worth the money - especially, if you are a family with children eating small - normal sized meals. Some guests really made sure they got value for money! The hotel's proximity to Hollywood was pretty good (with a car) and we enjoyed a superb meal at a fantastic Italian restaurant in the mall from where it's best to view the Hollywood sign. All in all, we had a truly great stay at the Hilton and would return should we want to revisit that part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations and location”
Reviews.Author: tracelene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in a King Executive room on the 21st floor. We LOVED it! The room was very spacious, had a table and two chairs and a sofa with coffee table. The King bed was very comfortable with soft bedding and lots of pillows. The only cons about the room is that the TV is old and not a very good picture and there is no in-room refrigerator. There is a cabinet for the coffee maker and we thought that was the fridge, but nope, seems like they can turn those into mini-fridges. We did have a safe in the room and one robe was provided in the closet. We also had a park view room and we loved looking out over Universal and the surrounding area. Overall, it was a very nice room! We opted for the breakfast package and received 4 breakfast buffet tickets to have breakfast for two mornings. Their breakfast buffet is excellent, a large variety of breakfast items and drinks. It is normally $20 per person for this buffet at the Sierra Cafe restaurant. The room next door to the Cafe is the continental breakfast room and it seemed to have a nice variety of pastries and small breakfast items. Both rooms were very nice and had an elegant feel, even though you can arrive casual! We also had dinner at the Sierra Cafe one evening and the food was very good, especially their bread basket with a plate of butter, oil and olive dips, very good! All of the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming during our stay! There are more than enough employees for your every need and all very willing to assist you, that was great. There is a shuttle from this hotel to Universal Studios that runs every 10-15 minutes. It only went until park closing though, so if you stayed later to walk around the Citywalk, you would have to walk back to the hotel. It's not far at all from the hotel, however, it is on a hill and although a close walk, we preferred to take the shuttle to avoid walking up and down the hill. Parking is $17 a day to self park or $22 a day for valet parking. It is also $9.95 a day for internet, we were hoping for free wireless, but no such luck. The pool and spa area looked very nice, although small. There is 24 hour room service and we ordered dinner on our 2nd night and it was very good and plenty of food! It is the closest hotel to Universal and very nice, inside and out! We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Closest Hotel to Universal but not Executive floor value”
Reviews.Author: capedoc
Reviews.Content: The closest hotel to Universal. There is a shuttle bus to Universal but it's really not necessary as it's so close. Stayed on the Executive floor but there is really nothing that special about it. There used to be a lounge but it was cut out as"too many friends of guests were using it" according to one of the receptionists. Nothing to do with cutting costs then? They could offer internet as a perk but I guess it never crossed teir mind to ffer it as a perk to the exec level? $17 for self parking or $22 for valet. Yup, a couple more extra charges. And here's where it gets strange: You get coupons to have an ok continental breakfast which you can upgrade to a more comprehensive one. It's really weird how you sit in a room next to the main breakfast one in a separate breakfast ghetto. Reminds one of the Woody Allen film where he looks out of the train and everyone seems to be having more fun next door. I mean in the next room there was a piano playing, for goodness sake, while we had piped drek. And we were paying more? Positive things: Really nice outdoor pool area, with spa open till midnight. Very close to Universal (5-10 min walk). . Nice rooms with unfortunately old style TV's. Ice buckets and machines. The Sunday brunch looked extremely good but we were late for it. I managed to get tickets to the Tonight show which is based down the road by queuing from 7h30am (yeah, not really anything to do with the hotel except in relation to it's position.) I would re-stay if visiting the area as it is very conveniently placed, but I wouldn't go for exec floor necessarily as it just isn't worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: person1234567890
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a minutes walk from Universal Studios and there is a free tram which you can use which stops at the hotel. I was on the top floor and had a view of the themepark, which was good. The normal breakfast is ok. It has fruit and toast and basic breakfast items, then the other breakfast (additionall charge) has cooked food. I normally never ever eat in hotels as I don't really like hotel restaurants but I actually gave this one ago and returned again which is extremelly rare for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: emjay1968
Reviews.Content: Very friendly valet/bell/house staff - can't say the same for reception who were businesslike and uninterested. We had a wonderful room on the 15th floor with plenty of room for messy teenagers and a lovely bathroom for me to hide in. We overlooked Universal and could watch much of the WaterWorlds show - cool! Breakfast was extortionate, outrageously huge and unecessary... but maybe not if you're American!

Reviews.Title: “If Universal is your goal, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Helenoma
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at Hilton as it was the last leg of our West Coast trip and we were more interested in Universal than Disneyland. We checked in quickly and were a bit disappointed in our room location as it was right by the lobby and the elevators - however, this didn't result in hardly any extra noise at night. Our room appeared to cater for the disabled but the shower chair might come in handy after a big night! It was a nice size room just overlooking the side of the hotel, no view to speak of but I don't worry about that if there's no balcony anyway. The bathroom didn't have much shelf space but that's the only downside, and for some reason our bar fridge was glued shut!!! We also couldn't make local calls which was annoying, and reception couldn't seem to figure out why. We didn't try the surf and turf buffet although all you can eat crab is usually my idea of a good time - we ate at the Cantina Mexican restaurant at Universal which was good, authentic Mexican with nice cocktails. We did however spend a few hours at the Hilton's bar, drinking their excellent cocktails made by very friendly waiters. We slept well and the late check out of midday suited us perfectly after all those cocktails the night before - although housekeeping couldn't wait to get in the room they just had to! The room service menu was simply amazing - didn't use it, but really wanted to... Things to do: obviously Universal. Didn't go on the Jurassic ride due to an expensive camera and the amount of water, which was disappointing - but the Terminator 3, Special Effects and Backdraft were all good. House of Horrors - yawn, and I'm a big chicken usually (tip if you're listening, Universal: let people go through in their small groups and make the next group wait a few mins - much more fun than just trailing through in one long line with bored actors waiting to 'pounce'). We went to Sunset Plaza for dinner but that was a big disappointment; it should be re-christened Dogsh*t Plaza and who wants to eat dinner whilst inhaling car fumes? The 20% service charge on top was a bit steep at the Cafe Med and the food was ok but nothing special. If you're celebrity obsessed then it's probably the place to go but being unimpressed by that aspect doesn't help your overall view of LA - however, some lovely houses in Bel Air and Beverley Hills. Our friends drove us in a tour of LA and walked by the Chinese Theatre etc. which was fun. Do the touristy bits then get out to San Francisco or San Diego - that's my advice!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: ELC94
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the grandest hotel i've ever seen. The first impressions are amazing and with a red carpet leading to the hotel from valet parking it makes you feel like royalty. The room had amazing views and were clean and quite. the beckfast was a bit pricy but worth it. There was a small cafe which served starbucks which has the most amazing pastries ! The pool didnt get much sun so no sunbathing and you could hear the highway noise. The views from the 9th floor was of universal studios and the hollywood hills which looked very nice in the dark! the bathroom was very big and had an amazing mirror and work surface with sink.

Reviews.Title: “Before you book...”
Reviews.Author: nicople
Reviews.Content: I have not checked into this hotel and I am already very dissatisfied. Before you book this hotel, I strongly recommend visiting the Universal Sudios website for special package deals. I just went on to purchase my park passes (for 1 day) and noticed a special deal with the Hilton Universal City. I could have gotten two, 7-day passes ($67 per person/per day), free hotel parking ($17 per night), free hotel breakfast, free transportation to and from the park, and, of course, hotel at discounted rate. This would have been over a $300 savings for us. You think there would have been some advertisement on the Hilton website when booking...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: aycarumba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Universal studios and Hollywood. We looked at several options in Hollywood but they were very expensive. The location accross the street from universal studios is great. You can also walk over on an evening for a meal at citywalk. Just a 15 drive into Hollywood to see the sites etc. Having now visited the Hollywood area I'm glad we decided not to stay there. The hotel is kept very clean and the rooms are spacious for a family of 4. The pool is large and very quiet when we used it. My only complaint is the parking charges which I think should be free, given what you are paying to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Pembsskier
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel we have stayed in the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel room overlooked Universal Studios (19th floor). No noise at night not like other hotels we have stayed in. Secure underground self car parking available which was so easy to use we just swiped our door card. Cleaniness was excellent and the location was just 5 minutes walk away from City Walk with loads of shops to entertain the teenagers and Universal Studios. Warner Bros was only 10 minutes in the car. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, and we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: qwanta
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good views, right next to universal city, helpful concierge, free gym. Had a very pleasant experience overall and wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansJohnM
Reviews.Content: Made reservation for a Tower floor, the amenities were not there. For breakfast you have to go down to the lobby restaurant, no Lounge on the floor. Room is old and small need renovation, old T.V with limited channels. You can hear the quests talking from the next room. Last day no hot water. Left a comment card did not response.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, perfectly acceptable, chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fridaygeorge
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of June. We got upgraded from a basic room to a corner room on the 10th floor. Your have fantastic views over LA from this hotel because its right up on a hill. The room was large and clean, the bed was amazingly comfortable. The pool area is nice and clean but as usual be careful when you order drinks by the pool because they are horrendously dear. It is a busy and bustling hotel. The restaurant is nice, (the buffet breakfast is good value). Overall a good spot to stay, its not too far away from the centre of town (about a 15 min drive away) but 5 mins walk away from Citywalk at Universal. My only downer from this hotel was the valet parking attendant could not organise a taxi! After waiting for 30mins he told me to book it myself. Not impressed.Apart from that would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Scousebell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of Universal Studios/Citywalk. Also only 1 tube stop from Hollywood Boulevard (walk of fame & chinese theatre). The hop on/off bus connects from the hotel to other bus routes. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: DanoNJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children stayed at this hotel for four nights to attend a family function and do a little "tourist stuff". The rooms are clean and comfortable and the location is convenient for most LA attractions (notwithstanding the traffic!). The restaurant is decent and breakfast buffet is plentiful. People are friendly and helpful as well. Only two complaints - (i) $22/day to park the car is outrageous, and (ii) housekeeping needs to get their act together to clean rooms earlier in the day. Two of my four days the room was still not cleaned when we returned to the room mid/late afternoon. If this is important to you, be sure to request that Housekeeping come early!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for universal studios/city walk”
Reviews.Author: seablu
Reviews.Content: On the Hilton 800 number, we reserved a package with 2 Universal studios tickets and breakfast tickets. We were told the first nite would be at the higher rate, the 2nd at a AAA rate. At check-in the front desk said our rate was the higher rate for both nites. It was fixed after I questioned it. We requested extra pillows and towels ahead of time on the Hilton Honors site. We had to call housekeeping to get these. They said that they were full and could only bring 2 pillows. The room only had 3 bath towels, we had to request extra each day also. Our reservation was for 4 people. The room was clean and looked like the hotel web site pictures. The carpet was very worn and spotty. It did feel clean though. The TV was small and older. The double beds were comfortable, sheets and towels soft. Room service was excellent, fast, and for room service, a good value for the money. Everyone from the front desk to valet were friendly and helpful. We stopped at the concierge to get information on additional Universal tickets. After explaining various ticket types and finding out what we needed, she gave us a coupon to use at the gate for a $15 per ticket discount. Breakfast buffet was served until 11 a.m. At that time the buffet was changed to lunch. It was all fresh and had great variety. The omelet /crepe bar even stayed after 11a.m. to make us wonderful omelets and crepes. The pool area was clean, had plenty of towels, and nice grassy areas. The pool was on the cold side though. We would stay at this hotel again. It was family friendly but not over-run with screaming kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: l_brink
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an excellent location for visiting Universal and for hitting the Hollywood sites. The rooms were very nice, large bathrooms. The staff was very courteous and attentive. They brought a basket of fruit our first night, which was nice. I only have a couple of complaints: the prices in the restaurant and the wait for elevators. We did not eat at the Hilton as there are more reasonable places to eat at CityWalk across the street. We did buy coffee in the coffee bar and it was great. It took an especially long time to get an elevator. There may have been two elevators inoperable, not sure, but we never saw them working.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at beautiful hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: rajnitya
Reviews.Content: Hi friends, This is the first time I have stayed here and I love it. The staff are friendly and helpful, the food is good, and I found room service quick and good value. It's near to shopping, food, and Universal. It's also close to the Metro, for Hollywood, Downtown and Pasadena. The only downside is, I wouldn't pay extra for the executive floor. If you go early for breakfast, you're pushed to get a seat, if you go later, the choice is limited. On one or two of the days some of the bread products and cake were a little stale. Can't wait to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “loved the place!!”
Reviews.Author: hemantvelury
Reviews.Content: i love to enjoy my holidays! and Hilton makes it even more intresting

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel within proximity of Univesal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Rupak
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and found it to be quite impressive. The hotel is located in Universal City, North Hollywood and is within walking distance of Universal Studios. It takes around 30 mins from LAX to the hotel. One way taxi would cost around $50 while a shuttle van would cost $ 20 per passenger. The Red Line Metro station is around .6 miles and can easily be walked upto. However since the hotel is located atop a hill, the uphill walk from the station/ bus stop to the hotel can be pretty tiresome. As a solution one can take the free shuttle operated by Universal Studios from the bus stop to Universal Studios. However it needs to be kept in mind that this shuttle runs only till 4.30 pm everyday. All the major Hollywood attractions are only one stop away on the metro (one needs to get down at the Hollywood/ Highland station). The area around the hotel is peaceful and seems to be quite safe, even at nights. As for the rooms, they are quite spacious and clean with all the basic amenities. The interiors are also very well done. The hotel offers room service and also has a couple of restaurants besides a Starbucks outlet. One can also get a wide array of choices in Universal City Walk which is just a short walk from the hotel. Overall a recommended hotel if one intends to be near Universal City/ Hollywood rather than the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: newbieAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel on recent visit to the USA. We choose this hotel because it wasn't too far from hollywood and close to Universal City. We were very happy with our stay here. Everything in LA is spread out so no matter where you stay you pretty much need a car. We caught the complimentary shuttle bus to Universal city which was great. There is some great shopping there as well as great restaurants. We had a lot of tours in LA we did the stars home, Tijuana Mexico, Disneyland and we had a shuttle bus pick us up from our hotel which made getting around very easy. We stayed in a king deluxe corner room and we were very impressed with the fit out as well as the views, the room was stunning and the housekeeping was excellent also. Our room was kept in immaculate condition during our stay there. We ordered room service a few times and the food was fantastic as well as the service. The only complaint would be that the travel desk doesn't know too much i knew more and im from australia but besides that overall the hotel is fantasic, would definetly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: NevadaSteven
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the UC Hilton for the past two years, and my experience has been consistently good. They consider themselves to be a four star hotel so they strive to achieve it. Guests are escorted from checkin to the elevators, a welcome fruit basket is delivered to your room, towels are large and fluffy, etc. The hotel faces Universal City, so if you're going to that theme park you just walk across the road. The hotel food isn't bad (and they feature special priced sunset dinners), and their wines are well priced (much better value than at the Sheraton down the street). The rooms are a bit faded with older, boxy TVs, but they are large and clean with picture windows; the alcove rooms are even larger and have a wall of windows across them. The health club was recently renovated with all new Precor machines and a new weight room, and is free to guests. There's a great pool area as well. For the money and experience, it's well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Customer Service but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PDXreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights using Hilton Honors points. Self-parking was $17 per night, which we expected given this is L.A. The hotel location was convenient to the highway system and also the original Big Boy restaurant in Burbank, which was on our list of places to eat. Pros: The room was clean and quiet. No highway noise though our room faced the highway. Complimentary fruit basket, happy hour appetizers, and continental breakfast were much appreciated. Cons: Front desk check-in clerk was brusque with us. She also neglected to give us our complimentary breakfast and happy hour appetizer coupons. We only learned about them the next day when another staff member called our room to tell us they were waiting for us at the front desk. Elevators seemed to take a long time to arrive. Upon checkout, we discovered a mistake on our bill for a $11 mini-bar charge we did not make. It took nearly an hour for the front desk staff to sort it out and credit our account. When the credit card bill arrived a month later, there was an unexplained separate $5 Hilton charge. When I called the hotel to ask, their billing department had closed for the day (4 p.m.), so I gave up trying to track it down. My advice is review your bill carefully upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and location, especially for Universal studios”
Reviews.Author: hjrsa
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say this was a good hotel though a bit pricey. Then again, perhaps for where we were staying, it was to be expected. The room was great and the service friendly. Parking was available though we had to pay for it ($17), as well as the Internet ($10 per day and $1 for each page to print!). There was a fabulous brunch on the weekend and I definitely recommend anyone staying there to go for it! We had a great trip. It was our first time in LA and our sole aim was to check out the main amusement parks around. Six Flags and Knotts were both about 40 mins drive away. We were staying here for a week and had bought the Southern California City Pass (also available at the hotel desk). Because we spent 3 days at Disney and also drove to San Diego for Sea World, we did wish we'd picked a better place location wise as the latter drive was too much for us. On that note, maybe staying somewhere at Anaheim would have been better. However, Universal Studios was right next door and you could either walk to the park or wait for the hotel shuttle to take you which went every 10-15 minutes. It was also easy to drive to Hollywood Blvd and even to Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: AsianVista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton LA on April 20. It was our first stay ever in a Hilton hotel. We chose this hotel because of the close proximity to Universal Studios. Though a shuttle is offered, we made the 5-minute walk. Our room was clean. The fruit basket was well appreciated. We had a view of the 101 freeway and partial view of the golf course. Next time, I'll have to remember to request a view of Universal Studios. My only complaints is regarding the cost for self-parking ($17) and the breakfast buffet ($20pp). In addition to that, the hotel charges $9.95 for internet, which all hotels should include as a free service. Other than that, we'll likely stay here again when we return to Universal Studios this time with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cynsmith61
Reviews.Content: My son and I visited LA a couple of weeks ago and were fortunate enough to have chosen the Hilton Universal City. The staff is friendly and helpful. The valet parking is the best I have found, fast and courteous. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to families. The room was spacious, clean and pretty. Our view of Universal Studios and the hills was amazing. We plan to return in the fall and have already booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to most things”
Reviews.Author: rycour
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Saturday April 11 at 1 pm. Our room was ready and we checked in. Our room faced Universal Studios. Los Angeles county does not allow a rollaway bed so we were stuck with two "full" beds for four of us. It was tight, but we managed. Nice pool area and great breakfast buffet for $20 pp. We walked to the park and City walk and ate most of our meals there. Take the subway for $1 to North Hollywood and visit the Kodak theatre and Chinese Theatre. Great staff and even got a nice fruit basket on our second night. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lemon63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with wife & 2 sons (17 & 20) and were very happy with it as a base for sightseeing LA. The hotel & room were very clean & spacious and found staff all extremely friendly & helpfull, we often had to ask for travell tips as we were using public transport and found the staff very good, they also had free facillity to check-in online for return flight. The room was qiuet in the nights so no problems sleeping and also had ironing facility, inet access & hairdryer. It's a 5 min walk to universal studios & city walk or you can use the hotels free shuttle bus. There's a metro red-line station at bottom of hill short walk from hotel or you can use the shuttle from Universal which goes up & down the hill all day. Food in hotel was very good - breakfast had all you can eat buffet for $20, which was great start to day but a bit pricey at the mo for us brits. Outdoor heated pool also great for relaxing after hard days sightseeing or for waking you up in the morn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and as close as you can get to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: LAFUNCa_
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Universal Studios I would highly recommend this hotel. You can't get any closer. The rooms were very nice and ours looked recently renovated. We had 2 adjoining rooms on a high floor and it worked out great. Views of were also great. You won't be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need renovating”
Reviews.Author: livewireworld
Reviews.Content: We were greeted about seven times before we actually were off to our room. From the staff opening the door to your vehicle, bell staff, concierge staff, front desk staff, and staff that was just standing around, all were more than friendly to welcome you to the hotel. While it's hard to fault this, it was a bit overwhelming and tiring. Then we stepped into the room and we could see the hotel focuses on service instead of room quality. The carpet in the room was worn thru to the pad in several spots. Several dark blotches in other spots. It just gave an impression of uncleanliness not typically found in a four diamond hotel. No air was flowing in the west facing room which had its drapes open in the sun on a 80+ degree day. It was hot!!! It took 4 hours before the room cooled down. Old box-style TV, no flat screens here. Bathroom was clean, but wallpaper was peeling in a couple of spots. Too tired to go through a room change after a long day of travel, we stayed put. There is a restaurant in the hotel that we didn't try, but the buffets looked pretty good, although expensive. The Starbucks is small and limited in it's offerings. Room service was very typical, mediocre overpriced food, but tolerable and convenient. Obviously, the location next to Universal Studios Hollywood and CityWalk are a big reason to stay at the hotel. There is a hotel shuttle (I presume provided by Universal) which was nice, but they stopped service at 4:30PM. If you stay until Universal closes or spend an evening at CityWalk, I'm afraid you'll have to walk back and sidewalks are few. This hotel may suit business travelers better, but I that's kinda strange considering it's location next to a family attraction. I guess the area studios have reason for a hotel such as this near Universal, NBC, and Warner Brothers. Anyway, don't think I'd stay here again unless they renovate these rooms. Hampton Inn rooms I've stayed at in the past year have all been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: mikenick
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our son who is studying for a semester in LA for 4 nights. We had a beautiful large, very clean, king room with 20 feet of windows looking out on to the Hollywood Hills, it was a fantastic view. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and eager to answer any question we had. The location is a quick walk to Universal Studios and City Walk where there is a variety of food options. It is also a short distance (although LA traffic is a nightmare) to all major attractions. The parking rate is high but seems to be the norm in the areas we visited in Southern California, so just be resigned to fact there is not much you can do about it. My husband and I are both in the hospitality business and it is very refreshing to go on vacation and receive the quality of customer care that we give while doing our jobs. The staff at the Universal Hilton was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Belvidere
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at this hotel. After reading the rave reviews on Tripadvisor we were a little disappointed. Yes the hotel is in a perfect location for visiting Universal Studios and the Universal walk but there is no "wow" factor. Parking is pricey. Food also. Rooms are clean and comfortable but dated. Typical Hilton layout. Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel within walking distance of Universal”
Reviews.Author: jmpage
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits high above Universal Hollywood Studios. We drove up to the valet parking area (valet parking is a pricey $22/day but self parking is not much better at $17/day) walked into the beautiful lobby area and proceeded up to our rooms even though we were a few hours earlier than check in time. We had booked two rooms. The couple in the other room noticed a stain on their sheets. Housekeeping immediately changed the bedding and the management send up two complimentary fruit baskets. The best thing about this hotel is it's convenience to Universal Studios and Citywalk. There is a shuttle, but you can also easily walk to the park within 10 minutes. The rooms were quite comfortable. The views were incredible of both the park and the hollywood hills area. There's a secluded pool area with a large whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: AussieGalBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hilton! It was very clean and the location couldn't be better for Universal. The area is beautiful and the staff were very friendly and professional. As long as you are aware of the parking fees upfront and incorporate them into your budget, then we didn't find that there were any surprises. The food in the restaurant (like any hotel) is expensive, however for only a short distance you can go to many other locations for food too. Beds and everything were super comfortable! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, staff, service and food”
Reviews.Author: GAColson
Reviews.Content: We traveled primarily to visit Universal Studios. The location couldnâ€™t be better. The parking fees are fully disclosed and actually are a great deal compared to the surrounds and with the convenience it provides. Pay the extra money and use the valet. The room was clean, spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful; every request for help was pleasantly received and delivered. The concierge even located and provided directions at our 13 year old daughters request to find a â€œmost haveâ€� souvenir. Weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and value”
Reviews.Author: cruisejp
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. The hotel is a short walk from Universal Studios (or take the free van) and 15 minutes from Burbank Airport. If you are going to the Studios or having a company meeting or incentive this is the place. The facilites are tops. I am a Hilton Diamond member and was treated very well. However, if you do not have HHonors status you will still be treated like a king. The hotel has one of the best buffet breakfest I have every had for under $20.00. They also have a $15.00 meal deal from 4pm to 6pm midweek. I had Seafood Soup loaded with seafood, Prime rib with veggies and potatoes, and Cheesecake for only $15.00. I have to say...I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbs969
Reviews.Content: I am a picky traveler and am used to staying at top notch hotels for work. During a personal business trip, I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during the Oscars weekend. It was in a great location - close to everything. The room was clean and HUGE, and the beds were so comfortable. Wish they had free wi-fi and better parking costs. There is a hefty charge even for Self Parking. You cannot park on the street as there is nothing around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a stonethrow away to Universal”
Reviews.Author: SimbaK2K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February and choose the hotel due to its closeness to Universal as that was what we really wanted to do in LA. We got an upgrade to an executive room on the 20th floor and it was very nice indeed. The room had a huge bathroom, desk, sofa and king size bed which was very comfy. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel instead opting for Universal Citywalk but had the buffet breakfast and room service and both were very good. The buffet breakfast was a little steeply priced at 19 dollars each + tax but the selection was huge and had plenty for everyone. Views on the 20th floor were really good overlooking universal and the hollywood hills and was very quiet. Walking took about 4 minutes to Universal Studios and Citywalk and theres a bridge to cross the main road which cuts a lot of the walking out.

Reviews.Title: “Return customer still likes this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: islandmap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 years ago and the hotel has pretty much stayed the same. Very friendly, warm staff that really seemed to like the customers. Rooms were clean. Beds are not queens, as stated on the website, but full size. Location is great for trips to Universal. Only complaint was the elevator delays that could take almost 15 minutes to travel up/down the floors. It appeared mechanical since the hotel was not even half full. There was a charge for internet, which is one of my pet peeves. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose the Hilton Universal!”
Reviews.Author: vacationplanner1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 9 day trip to California. Based on a recommendation from a friend in LA, we chose the Hilton Universal City for our LA base---even though we never even went to Universal Studios (aside from CityWalk 2 nights). Most of the things we needed to do were in the North Hollywood/Hollywood area and the hotel couldn't have been more convenient. It also provided very easy freeway access to Santa Monica and other side trips. The hotel staff was notably friendly, courteous, and helpful. Special shout out to Stuart at the front desk, who was wonderful and handled a couple of minor issues promptly and professionally. The hotel itself is beautiful and the guest rooms are very attractive, contemporary, and clean. The beds were amazingly comfortable! If it had been warmer, we would have used the pool. I did use the gym, which had everything I needed. There are only two issues that prevented me from giving 5 stars: As noted by others, there are some real elevator problems. Surely, engineering can fix the issue. Waits were very long at times and sometimes the elevator would go down when the only button pushed had been for up. Also, on our check-out day when we were especially rushed, we had a problem with hot water. They sent someone to our room and it was more a matter of fiddling with the faucet handle than anything else, but it was annoying. Still, I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting LA looking for an attractive, quiet, safe location that's close to so many things. The positives far outweighed the minor flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Once Bitten”
Reviews.Author: Onthegovalleymom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Valentine's night at the Hilton. The room had a beautiful view and the staff was very nice. However, I woke up the next morning with bug bites on my body. My lucky husband only found a couple of bites on his body. The hotel took a report and apologized. That was it. Right now I'm in the process of washing all the clothes we wore. I hope we didn't bring home whatever bit us. Even though everyone was nice, I'll never go back there again. I have traveled a great deal, and this is the first time I've ever encountered this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Universal studios”
Reviews.Author: Honeym00ner_86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it is close to Universal studios (it's a 10-12 minute walk). We found this hotel was quite comfortable, although it is a little noisy in the morning as it is right on the highway. The breakfast buffet was really good with a wide variety of things to eat. The parking is a little on the expensive side, and they seem to discourage guests from self parking. Other than that, a good hotel if you are visiting Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton TOP stay”
Reviews.Author: mjp66
Reviews.Content: Sourced this Hotel from Expedia and even though it's not in the "heart" of LA it was certainly an excellent choice. We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 days and had a fabulous room looking out towards Universal Studios - very impressed with decor, room amenities, comfort of beds(awesome),cleanliness of room, size of bathroom, Crabtree & Evelyn bathroom amenities,coffee maker etc. This was one of 14 Hotels we stayed in on a recent world trip and it was by far the best for the price. We ate breakfast most mornings and had the evening buffett (available over weekends) twice. I have never seen so much food, the variety of culturally different dishes, the presentation of the food and the quality of ingredients were exceptional. The service was also pretty good in the restaurant and the staff were pleasant and accommodating. The Hotel was only a short walk to Universal Studios/City Walk and if you didn't feel like walking there was always the complimentary shuttle service. We also walked to the subway station - all down hill which was fine. After a short wait and only one stop on the train we were on Hollywood Blvd walking on the famous "stars" and enjoying all the hand/foot prints at Grauman's Chinese theatre. There were also some great prices on tours once in this area so we enjoyed a 3 hour Hollywood Hills/Beverly Hills/Rodeo Drive Tour - great way to spend the afternoon. Caught a cab back to the Hotel which was reasonable at USD $14 for a family of 4. Also hired a car whilst at the Hotel (we had to source the company ourselves as we wanted to drive to Los Vegas and leave the car there). Hotel can assist with day car rental (by means of a phone in the lobby to a specific company) but were no help at all despite several calls to their transport/concierge department for other car rental places. This was probably the most frustrating part of our stay - the lack of interest shown by this department! The Front Desk staff were OK - they weren't too interested in the guests as people rather they just wanted to check us in/out and be done with it. Always felt like I was "intruding" whenever I went to the desk - compared to the F&B staff this area of Front Office along with Concierge could really do with some decent staff training in Customer Service. SMILE guys-we are paying your wages! Maybe it's the "tipping" thing in America - those that get cash tips go out of their way, those that don't become a little complacent! When will the US pay their service staff properly - that's a whole other debate I guess. So...all in all impressed with the Hilton. Kids also had a great stay and were fully accommodated with specific children's menus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb86Ireland
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night and had a very pleasant stay.hotel is gorgeous, buffet breakfast is great, very good selection.The staff in restaurant, valet parking and the lobby were extremely helpful but the lady on reception was quite rude and was in very bad humour. But overall this is a great spot i would definitely stay here again especially for anybody going to universal studios as the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl_london
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Very clean and very convenient to Universal Studios. We went to the theme park for a while, walked back to the hotel, then back to park. The restaurant food was good and the staff very helpful. We loved not having to drive in LA (we only went to Universal Studios).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and an ideal base away from hustle & bustle of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: kirsty1704
Reviews.Content: As the title says - 'Very nice hotel and an ideal base away from hustle & bustle of Hollywood'. 10/15 minute walk to the red line subway station with the Hollywood and Highland Centre (metres from the walk of fame, graumans etc) being just one stop away. Hill can be a bit of a pain and extremely tiring especially with luggage but there is a complimentary shuttle that takes you from the bottom of the hill up to the hotels (hilton + sheraton) and onwards to Universal Studios which is worth waiting for but its not 24 hours - it stopped around 5-6pm when we were there. Hotel set in nice grounds with fountains and nice greenary. Bit of a pain if you're not hiring a car to get to the hotel either from Universal or the top of the hill (unless we just went the long way around all the time). You enter the site of the hotel at what i would've called the front (off the main road) however you have to walk all the way around to the back of the hotel to actually get in. I'm not sure if there was another entrance or a cut through but we couldn't find one. Arrived at 9am and explained i understood if we were a little early to check in but could we leave our bags because we wanted to go to Universal. The very helpful lady on the front desk started looking on the computer - she said they had some rooms available. I decided to try my luck with the 'upgrade' Q..... i managed to get us what i think was an executive corner room (1564) for an extra $20p/n which I was more than happy with paying. Our rate had already dropped about $50 p/n from when i originally booked so was still in theory in pocket. The lady at the front desk showed us to the lift and also gave us some maps and things to look at with regards to nearby places of interest. We entered the room (after a little bit of difficulty with the key!) and WOW !! The room was amazing. So spacious, clean, tidy, modern - everything you want in a hotel room. Sofa, television, wine (obviously not free!), massive bed, massive wardrobe and a desk to work on if necassary. The bathroom was humongous with plenty of amenties and towels. Then came the drawing of the curtains - WOW WOW WOW !! What a view !! We overlooked Universal. Seeing that and the hills in the background made it a $40 very well spent !! Didn't get room service or anything however it did seem reasonably priced to be honest - well it would've been less the gratuity, delivery charge and another charge they wanted to add on. Second evening there we got back to the hotel and there was a nice basket of fruit, with bottles of water and chocolate biscuit type things. Didn't know if they were free or you had to pay so partner only had one of the chocolate bar and a bottle of water. I see now on my credit card though that there's $4 having been charged to it care of the Hilton but because we paid up for the room on leaving i'm guessing it probably for what he ate. Maybe worth asking if its free or not should you receive one before you dive into it !? For some reason the hallways were extremely hot and i mean hot - they were sweltering however was pleasantly surprised that whatever was happening with the heating out there wasn't effecting the heating in the room. Was very easy to control - never got too hot nor too cold. Overall i'm very glad I picked the Hilton up at Universal City and should we ever head back to LA and the North Hollywood area I will most probably stay here again - its in a quiet area ideal for Universal Studios, its not far away from the subway as previously explained and the freeway that takes you down to the centre of Hollywood should you want to explore using a car. We went down to the Hollywood/Highland area and it was madness - i honestly don't think i'd have been able to stay directly on Hollywood Boulevard. It was very busy and as i have previously said the Hilton took you away from the hustle and bustle into a world of your own in effect but meant you were still within one subway stop should you want to check out graumans etc. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Soft beds and huge buffet”
Reviews.Author: Sue2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night when going to Disneyland and Universal Studios. We were meeting friends early at Disneyland, so we needed to check in before 11am. Although we didn't call ahead or make special arrangements, the hotel had no problem checking us in early. The front desk even walked us to the elevator while explaining the hotel amenities. Unfortunately, they didn't say which way to walk to get to Universal. It should have been obvious, but somehow I didn't easily find it and ended up taking a round about way. While walking thru the lobby, I saw an enormous buffet. It wasn't just big but had upscale food. The day we checked out was a Sunday and the large buffet was there again for their Sunday champagne buffet. In the room, the beds were nice and soft as were the pillows. Even the lounge chair was soft. We were on the 12th floor and had a great view of Universal and the entire area. After staying out late, we slept in and forgot to put out the Do Not Disturb sign. The cleaning person knocked on the door around 10am. As usual for me, the heater didn't seem to work well. I tried turning it up to 80 degrees, but it just seemed to blow cold air. Room service was pretty quick and quite good. The hotel charges $14 a day for self parking, but let us stay until 6pm on the day we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PV_Fubar
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel located next to Universal. Walk or take the shuttle. The room on the 12th floor ( we got an upgrade) was very nice with a great view. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: SCVTravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and parked in the self parking...I believe it was $17 a night. We took the elevator up to the lobby. However, the lobby was a long walk from the elevator and there were no signs directing us. We checked in with a very friendly young man who obviously expected a tip. When one is expected, we tend not to give one. We entered our room and were pleasantly surprised by the size and nice appointments. It was an alcove room, which was an upgrade. The far wall was all windows. The view was incredible. The only time I heard another guest was from our restroom. The bedroom was extrememely quiet and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the linens were just as amazing. Check out was a breeze. My only complaints were the distance we had to walk from the elevator and that the water pressure in the shower was very low. Also, the tub drained too slowly. We have stayed at the Sheraton which is next door. The Hilton was far superior!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: lochness11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last October for 5 nights. The overall experience was great. We had a room on the 21st floor and the view was awesome. We booked this hotel from the hilton website as we found better rates. The location is also great. There is a shuttle bus that runs every 10 minutes to Universal City Walk which we found good. The room was always clean and the furniture is nice. Out of 5 hotels we stayed in during our holiday, this is probably the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrlTampa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles/Universal City the week of November 17, 2008 for a business trip. My initial impression of the hotel was favorable, as the staff were very courteous, the room was spacious and I received a complimentary fruit basket on my first night there. However, upon waking up the first morning, I found bed bugs in my bed. This was a horrifying and unwelcome surprise at 5:30 AM. I immediately called the front desk and was put on hold for 10 minutes, after which I explained the situation to the night supervisor and requested to be given another room immediately. During this conversation with the night supervisor, at no time did she apologize, although she did agree to provide another room by 6:30 AM. Upon moving to my new room, I inspected the bed carefully and found that while the sheets appeared to be clean, under the mattress, on the dust ruffle and around the headboard there was a great deal of dirt, dust and human hair. It was obvious the full bedding had not been changed or cleaned in some time. I did try to reach the hotel manager, and he did try to contact me during my stay, but we missed each other as I was in meetings most of the time there. I will follow up with a letter to him about the situation and give him a chance to respond, but as of right now, no discount was given to me on my bill and the only apology I received was from the front desk clerk when I went down to exchange room keys. My recommendation is that if you stay at this hotel, you should carefully check the bedding before going to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here- We had a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: christin975
Reviews.Content: We had 5 rooms, the keys were just given out and our parents did not get the large room the requested, instead it was given to one of our guests and they didnt want to be rude so they kept the smaller room. The air was not on in the room and our thermostat read 90 degrees, it took hours for it to cool down. My bf sat on the bed and the bead was broken, the box spring was split in half. we called the front desk and they said they could put us on another floor which we did not want to do b/c we were already unpacked and had booked our rooms next to one another. They said they would send someone up to exchange it, never happend. So we just slept on it. One of guests went to get into the bed and a nasty bottle of lotion was in the sheets- obviosly the sheets were not changed. she requested her sheets to be changed and someone came up and gave her the sheets but he said "I dont do sheets" she had to change them herself. This is all on day 1- next day we woke up for early morning plans and there was no hot water- no one was able to shower until that evening. Just a bad experience with no compassion for our inconvienances from the hotel or staff. We might as well stayed in a hotel 6. Thats what i would compare this hotel to

Reviews.Title: “great!!”
Reviews.Author: ant0923
Reviews.Content: we stood here in oct and it was very good ,room and staff was also very good to us not a problem .i would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hilton”
Reviews.Author: daniel1008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here cause everyone was raving about it on trip advisor. Seriously, there is nothing special about this place, except that it is a short stroll from Universal Studios. The place is quite dated, the type of hotel lobby that was nice in the 80s, but needs an upgrade. It's OK- well equipt, but seriously nothing special. Stay only if necessary, otherwise, keep looking! PS really bad location if you are wanting to see other sights in LA. So far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - couldn't have asked for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: tcmnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 3 children just recently stayed at the Hilton in Universal City whilst we were visiting the US. The hotel was fantastic!!! Best location for visiting Universal studios and for seeing the sights of LA (we did have a car though). Universal studios was across the road so we had no worries about trying to get through the LA traffic to get there on time. Universal City was next door and that was fantastic for dinners, lots of child friendly restaurants and shops and we felt very safe strolling through the area at night. There was a free shuttle back to the hotel if we wanted to use it rather than walking, we did take advantage of that on a few nights after we had been walking all day!! The room itself was great - large, clean and great views! We were worried as we had two rooms and wanted interconnecting but that was no problem which was a great relief. We stayed on the executive level which included a free continental breakfast each day which was fantastic! Nice and healthy - fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, toast, yoghurt etc..Great start to the day. I was really happy that we stayed at this hotel it was the first hotel we stayed at on our holiday and we returned to it on our last night before leaving the US. Would highly recommend it to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Refund Given!!!!!!!!!!!!! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent-Flyer-Four
Reviews.Content: Don't book with HILTON !!! I booked this hotel because I needed to run the LA Marathon. The LA Marathon moved the date two weeks earlier. I called and emailed Hilton to see if I could change my reservaton. Multiple calls and emails later, they still said No, sorry, can't modify or cancel your reservation even though it was a month ahead of time! Beware! If you are staying in this "caliber" of hotel anyway, book with another chain, and avoid the Hilton chain and its affiliate hotels. In the past I have had great cusomer service with Hyatt Regency. In fact this is the worst service I have ever encountered even with less expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more accomodating”
Reviews.Author: mskbelle
Reviews.Content: Decided to attend my High School reunion being held at the Sheraton, but liked the Hilton better, so decided to stay there for that night. I needed a double-bed room, as I needed to bring my disabled mother (whom I care for) and we need to have our own beds. The hotel was very busy that Saturday, and when we checked in, the desk clerk said they only had a room with a king bed..".NO WAY! I had reserved a double bed room!," I explained, as I pointed to my mother waiting at the side in her wheelchair. The desk clerk "got my drift," and was very understanding. She began punching in buttons on her computer and making calls, and "wha-lah," a recently vacated room popped up. Yeah! The only complaint is that the air conditioning did not seem to work...could not adjust cooler or more fan circulation. The bellhop said he could try to get us a fan (accomodating and extremely nice man), but apparently, none was to be found. I ordered room service for Mom and then talked with the desk. They said that if I left them my cell number, they would call me if Mom needed me, and that they would alert security that there was a disabled person in our room (in case of emergency). So nice! After I left to attend the reunion, Mom's dinner was delivered (that person was helpful with getting her to the table and helping with her food preparation), and they later did a physical check-in with her, with a complimentary fruit basket in hand, just to be sure she was O.K. That was above and beyond the call of duty!!! I was so gratefull for their attentiveness to our needs, and that because of that, I was allowed to have a carefree night out (which is seldom, when you are a full-time caregiver!). Everyone, including the bellman who kept Mom company while I retreived our car upon leaving, was exceptionally kind, friendly, professional and accomodating! Thank you, Hilton Hotel!!! KB Edwards Porter Ranch, CA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ranj1979
Reviews.Content: We had booked an executive room & were upgraded to an Alcove Executive Room upon arrival. Check In was over in less than 5 mins & we were shown to our room on floor 21!! As soon as i entered the room & got to the huge windows I was gobsmacked the views were amazing. We stayed here for a week & went to Universal Studios which was next to the hotel (there is a free shuttleservice every 15 mins from outside the hotel as its located on top af a steep hill). Went to City Walk every night for dining & shopping (again using the shuttle). Went we spoke to the conciege about other site seeing they asked us to hire a car but me & my husband were not confident driving in the USA. Instead we saw many sites by using the LA subway (Metro). Went to Santa Monica Beach - Long Beach - Downtown - Walk Of Fame all using public transport & was very easy!! So do not listen to the conciege when they insist on hiring a car as it can all be done by the metro & bus. Wouls have gone to Venice Beach if we had time as well. We had access to continental breakfast & Drinks & Snacks between 5-7pm every evening on the executive floor which was handy. The rest of the time was spent in the Pool & Hot Tub. As we went when there was a heatwave the temp of the pool was not so bad but i can imagine is being cold if the weather is!! But the hot tub at the end of the day was amazing after a day of site seeing!! Overall a very enjoyable stay & I will highly reccomend this hotel, book executive room if you can!! TIPS Can go to walk of fame & see Hollywood Sign by subway (metro) only one metro stop (hollywood & Highland) from Universal City. Also Long Beach by Metro (can take 45 minutes) but you only have to change Metro once at 7th Street to Long Beach (Blue Line) Santo Monica we got off at 7th Street (Macy's) & got the Big Blue Bus to Santa Monica beach which took just under 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Geraint Jones
Reviews.Content: This is the only place to stay if you're visiting Universal City and Hollywood and make sure you get the Executive rooms as the lounge with breakfast and afternoon snacks is great. Everything about this hotel is good - food/room/pool/bar/parking etc. We ate at the bar on two nights and it was great and very reasonable with excellent service. Buses to Universal are regular and convenient and we did a hollywood tour by bus from the hotel as well. This really is 5 star with value for money. Oh except for the phone calls - don't use the room phones as international cell phones are cheaper!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfirtable”
Reviews.Author: SusanC80
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if going to Universal and sight seeing in nearby areas. The valet parking is reasonable and just fantastic. The welcoming staff were lovely. There is a shuttle bus to and from Universal City Walk. Our bags took a little longer to follow us up to our room, but that was it. Other than that the staff were friendly and conscientious. Our room was spacious and clean and our bathroom was also spacious. The our door pool looked fab with alot of cabanas, but have to admit I did not use it. Overall a lovely experience I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JEMCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel especially for visiting universal studios. Great interior to hotel, very nice rooms with very interesting views of LA including lots of mansions on the hills. Attentive staff and excellent breakfast. Nice pool. Takes two minutes to walk to universal and city walk. There's lots of resturants to choose from at city walk. Can't think what its called but we ate at an American steak house type resturant (closest to the hotel when walking to the studios) it was very nice (and cheap of course). Oh and the SImpsons ride was really fantastic at universal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: BenandAli
Reviews.Content: Can't argue with the location (short walk to Universal Studios, short drive to Hollywood and downtown), or the room which was massive and comfortable with a great bathroom. Price for room was pretty good and they were able to extend our stay by a day (you will need time to explore LA). Only downside were the exorbitant charges for even short local phone calls and internet access. Everyone knows hotels love to charge for any extras, but their prices were outragous and we simply couldn't avoid them due to crcumstances. Breakfast was nice and reasonably priced (extra to cost of room) Overall, pretty good, just a shame they feel they have to rip off tourists who need to make urgent calls.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the place to stay at Universal City... as opposed to the Sheraton. We arrived late and left early, so I didn't really see much of the hotel. There is a $17 self-parking charge for the garage, as with many places. A couple of snafus during my stay: The remote control for the TV didn't work... maybe the batteries were dead? Normally this would be a big deal, but it was late and I was tired, so I just read e-mail and went to bed. Then during the night, staff slid a hotel receipt with no numbers under my door... then replaced it with a receipt with no letterhead. Turns out the night staff had printed out the receipts before doing the audit (according to the beleaguered morning clerk) and so we had to go to the desk to check out in the morning. Frankly, the morning clerk could have been a bit more personable and less grumpy. The room was fine... I'm sure I'll stay here again despite the quirks. It's nicer than the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of the holiday.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Beaumont
Reviews.Content: LA was the last stop on our holiday and we stayed for 5 nights at the Universal Hilton. I do not have a bad word to say about this hotel. Easy to find - follow Universal signs from freeway and then hotels (Sheraton and Hilton) are signed. Self parking was never a problem - plenty of space. Straight into elevator which took us to lobby. Check in was a breeze - staff very helpful. Rooms were really nice - executive floor. Has wonderful views over the pool and Universal Studios. Executive lounge was a godsend - breakfast every morning, complimentary soft drinks and coffee all day. Shuttle bus from hotel to park was very reliable - every 10 minutes or so. It is an easy 15 minute walk to the park although easier to walk back as downhill. Citywalk is great for places to eat - Hard Rock Cafe, Bubba Gump, Tony Roma's etc. Also good for shopping - Abercrombie, Fossil etc. Hollywood Boulevard 5 minute drive. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Goulz
Reviews.Content: The closest hotel to Universal Studios, Hollywood, lives up to the hype. The Hilton is only steps away from the main gate, and we got our tickets to U.S.H. thru a package we bought on the Hilton website, Check-in was quick, and we had a room ready although we arrived at 10:30AM. Went directly to the park. When we came back, we were greeted by a basketful of goodies, including two bottles of water, fruit, cookies and the likes. Did not use the restaurant on-site as we walked to CityWalk for dinner. The hotel was experimenting elevator issues on our way back but they were fixed by the morning. Overnight, the air conditionning made the exact same sound as if someone on the upper floor was flushing a toilet, everytime the motor kicked it. Were awoken by that a few times. The wired Internet connection never worked. Had to go to the lobby for the wireless to be within range. Might be because we had a corner room. Parking is affordable (17.00$ self with in and out privileges)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: jimstan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Hilton Universal City the last week of August, 2008. The hotel staff was fantastic, from the pre-arrival dialog and accommodation scheduling to the stay itself. The hotel was busy, but we never had to wait for anything. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and accommodating, helping us with a minor room annoyance and a room upgrade. Try to stay in the executive towers floors 22-24 to take advantage of the lounge with complimentary breakfast, papers, snacks, etc. Concierge was very helpful, checking on locations, printing directions, and making reservations with a smile. Room was a real treat, very pampering and relaxing, cozy but roomy. Great restaurant with superb buffet...fantastic!! The pool and exercise room was great, clean, not crowded and well staffed. It is located a very short walk from Universal Citywalk and the Universal Studios Tour and Park-rides...VERY NICE!!! All of LA is a short drive away, the traffic can be bad so plan ahead. (The only bad part of our vacation to LA was the rental car...DO NOT rent from Dollar...esp the LAX site. Management was extremely poor and non-responsive, vehicle was not well maintained)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for LA”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel! We booked through their website for $161 per night (AAA rate) and opted to choose our room when we arrived. This was a great idea, as we ended up getting a MASSIVE room overlooking universal studios, with a seating area, and a very comfy king size bed! The hotel itself was great - the staff were extremely helpful, it had a good coffee bar for the morning, a large bar, and a restaurant with a big buffet breakfast (although we did not eat there). The hotel was in a great location - within walking distance to universal studios, and very close to the City Walk, which was fun at night! We drove to downtown LA (grauman's chinese theatre) in 10 minutes, and were at Rodeo Dr. within 15. This hotel is beautiful and is a great choice if you're looking for something a bit more reasonable priced in central LA. I highly recommend it! Parking wasn't too expensive (I think $17 per day), and the lot was easy to use! I highly recommend this hotel. I have stayed at the Sheraton Universal and this is just as good, if not better.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingHeart08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not spectacular but it also was not horrible. For me it was just average. But here are a few things I want to mention regarding the hotel. First, if you are a smoker, I want to let you know that all smoking rooms are only on the 5th floor! Kind of sucks if you ask me. Also, you do get a very nice complimentary basket in your room that has water, fruit, cookies, and cheese & crackers. I felt that they were understaffed for a holiday weekend. It took forever for them to answer the front desk phone. And when we were changing rooms it took them forever to get someone up stairs to bring us the new keys, so we ended up leaving. The nice thing the hotel did was they never rushed us out of the previous room and held the other room for us until we got back later that evening. They were really nice just understaffed. I must say I was a bit baffled that we did not have a room service menu in our room. I had to call room service for them to bring me one and then when they did they first only brought me the breakfast menu that you hang on your door the night before. I had to tell them I already had that I need the binder with the full menu. The valet were extremely nice and helpful! They were always happy to help. We never had a problem asking them for directions to somewhere, they just printed them right out for us. They also suggested a wonderful local place that serves breakfast and lunch only. It's called Good Neighbor. I highly recommend eating there at least once while you are in town. Great food, not expensive at all, and the atmosphere is so friendly. As for the location of the hotel. You really do not have to wait for the Universal Studio shuttle! It's less than a 5 minute walk. You are litterally right across the street from it! Now as for the metro, it is a hike. You have to walk all the way down the hill and cross the intersection to get there. The walk down isn't bad but the walk up is not fun at all! That is a very very very step hill! Now there is a shuttle at the bottom of the hill that will bring you up (drops off at the Universal Studio entrance) and down the hill. I highly recommend taking the shuttle back up. Overall I was not impressed with the hotel, but the staff was friendly. Nothing spectacular just a clean nice place to stay while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Meadowtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights,it was better than expected.Room was on the 19 floor,good view of City Walk and Universal Studios.Roomwas very clean and quite modern.Found the staff polite but a little impersonal.Breakfast buffet was nice but a bit expensive.Good pool area not busy when we went.This is a great location up in the hills,next to Universal and only 10/15 mins to Hollywood and Griffith Park a must see not only for the observatory but the fantastic views of L.A. day and night.We also found this hotel to be reasonably priced in comparison to other L,A.hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update!”
Reviews.Author: marriedwithkids
Reviews.Content: Family of four stayed for 3 weekday nights this August. Room on 18th floor had a great view. However, the carpet was very stained and dirty. Whole room needs an update. Bathroom was very roomy. We had access to the Executive Lounge (also needs an update). Do not waste your money on the upgrade. Cold cereal and sweet rolls for breakfast and 2 "hot" snacks at night with cheese and fruit. For the extra $30-$40 per night you can get a real breakfast. Also, the lounge was so packed while we were there we had to stand and eat. The hotel is very convenient to Universal Studios and City Walk. They have a shuttle they share with the Sheraton that comes every 10-15 minutes. Next time I would stay at the Sheraton which was just updated.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: pommychick
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hilton Universal City earlier this year for a few days away from England. I'm not a huge fan of the Universal City theme park scene myself, but chose the hotel because of a good price deal. I was a little dubious about the fact it was a Universal City hotel, and was a little worried it would be tacky. Not at all. Arriving at the hotel blearly eyed after the 11 hour flight I was greeted by friendly staff who got me to my room in no time! The hotel restaurant serves decently priced (and excellent) Mandarin cuisine, with the friendliest waiting staff I have come across in a long time. The highlight of the stay had to be the warmth of the valet parking staff - they knew me and my car, always greeted me and were very welcoming each time I returned to the hotel. I was actually pleasantly surprised by Universal City Walk too, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel (or a shuttle bus ride away). On top of the usual theme park shops, there are also a fair few decent places to shop (if you're into California-esque surfer type clothes...maybe not for designer labels). The hotel and its location is excellent for families. There are many kid-friendly places to eat in City Walk should young children not necessarily favour the Mandarin cuisine, plus the hotel is within easy reach of anywhere in LA really with a car. The room itself was spacious and clean. Overall I really enjoyed staying here. I easily settled into the Californian lifestyle within 5 days here with all the friendly, relaxed (but professional) staff. Didn't want to leave for the hustle bustle of London at all! Easily could have done another week.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: lmccu81
